Reviews.Title: “A good choice for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: nzbear
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights here. Overall a good choice and handy to transport (bus). A short taxi ride from nearest Skytrain station. Large selection of restaurants in the vicinity. Great if you are keen to be near the gay part of Vancouver - Davie Street. Good staff - friendly and helpful. Rooms well appointed although the bedroom is a little small with a king sized bed in it. On a quiet street. Only two small reservations: the breakfast is very basic (cereals, croissants) and needs to be taken back to your own room; and the choice of TV channels available was frustrating - several channels we had watched as we travelled across Canada were not available here.

Reviews.Title: “Everything one could wish for as an enjoyable home away from home experience.....”
Reviews.Author: Fredifred
Reviews.Content: I doubt I should be willing to praise the Sunset Inn as highly as I'm about to, lest it has the effect of making it even busier than it has been, thereby reducing my chances of finding future accommodation there, while simultaneously raising the price of it. My wife and I have stayed there for many years now, as long-stay guests and hope to be able to do this for many years in future. Having travelled my entire life to earn a living "on the road", it is easy to recognize the best, when it is the caliber of the Sunset Inn, with its exceptionally obliging, helpful and congenial staff- from top Management, to Housekeeping, to the Night Man. While Sunset's amenities omit pools or full-fledged spas, everything else imaginable (totally equipped full sized kitchens, great TV's, programming, free DVDs and players, free high speed wireless and wired Internet in every suite, Continental Breakfast, daily newspaper, etc.) is included in its rates. The unusually large suites are all upgraded, modern and clean. The location, right beside the The Davie Street Village, is second to none, One can walk anywhere to the attractions of Vancouver, whether it be Downtown, the waterfront, shopping, Stanley Park, Canada Place, Gas Town, Granville Island. the Casino, or the Sports Arenas. For those who don't care to walk, the city's superior public transit is only seconds away, out the front door. For those with a car, the hotel even includes free, secure parking! So, although I've likely shot myself in the foot, keep up the fantastic work Sunset, but please don't do it so well that there will be no room in the inn when we want one. We plan to be there as long and often as possible. Thanks for the great stay(s)! Fred & Diane Steward, North Bay, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for a small inn with great staff”
Reviews.Author: cathy a
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite on the south west end for one night and then returned later in the week and stayed in a one bedroom on the south east end. The rooms were very homey and the kitchen well equipped for cooking your own meals. The continental breakfast included is a nice extra and free parking too. The staff are really great here. The GM was so good helping us with a booking for our Whistler trip and recommending restaurants. He is a real gem as are the rest of the staff. This is totally our go to inn when we're in Vancouver next.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced, convenient location, nice room with kitchen”
Reviews.Author: mllesarahk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two other colleagues for a conference at the convention center which was a little walk from the hotel, but doable. There was parking on site which was convenient. We had a one bedroom suite, with kitchen. The kitchen was a nice bonus. There was a modest breakfast each morning downstairs of coffee, cereal, fruit, and bakery. There was a small fitness room. The staff were welcoming. The location felt safe and there were many restaurants/shops within walking distance. My only criticism of the hotel was that the windows were not double pained so we head some noise from outside. There was also some noise from the hallway area outside of our room. Other than that, the place was great and I would recommend it. The jellybeans in the lobby were a nice treat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable suite”
Reviews.Author: vintagemary67
Reviews.Content: The Sunset Inn & Suites is our kind of place: great location in Vancouver's West End, free covered parking, roomy and stylish accommodations, great bed, and all at a fair price. Plus the staff was very friendly and helpful. We met a lady in the elevator who said they had stayed there over 60 times (to visit their daughter and family). We will return, possibly with our family in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great value”
Reviews.Author: Trom100
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week and was very impressed. Very clean, friendly and helpful staff, secure parking and comp continental breakfast. Rooms had all one needed to self cater but location is so good that many restaurants are within a few minutes walk. Very good wifi and also wired Internet. Will certainly stay again for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Amy P
Reviews.Content: We shared a room with a friend for a fun trip to the city, and it was a perfect choice for our needs. Close to everything we wanted to do, we never had to spend more than $10 for a cab. The apartment style living made us feel more comfortable, and the free coffee and muffins downstairs in the morning was a nice touch. The full kitchen was a lifesaver as well! The only complaint was our bathtub would not drain, and it was a bit of a hassle trying to get us all cleaned up each day. In the end, after they could not fix it, they let us use another room to shower in, which worked for us. I had to suggest that though, so I wouldn't expect anyone to offer any extras. DON'T be afraid to ask if you need anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Don S
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for a 2-night stay based on the good reviews it was getting and we were not disappointed. Great spot for tourists, rooms are large and well-appointed, free breakfast and parking. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at a great location”
Reviews.Author: harold28
Reviews.Content: The free secured parking was great. The continental breakfast was pretty basic: bagels, toast, fruit, cereal, juice and coffee. It was very handy to have a kitchen in our suite with stove, fridge and microwave. The beds were very comfortable. It was great that we had a DVD player in our room and the front desk loans out DVDs when you want to just relax in your suite. The location was perfect, within walking distance of alot of places. The hotel is also in a fairly quiet location, not on a busy road.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travel999
Reviews.Content: If you love spacious neighborhood hotels with a friendly, helpful staff, this is the place to stay. From check-in to check-out the staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. The executive one bedroom suite was roomy, clean and very comfortable. Being on the 11th floor we could crack our windows at night and had no problem with noise. Yes you could hear some noise from trucks in the alley below when the windows were open, but you are in a city after all! Television service was being upgraded during our stay to offer more channels and better quality. Kitchen is well stocked and had 2 coffee pots. Extra coffee was cheerfully provided upon request. The small balcony was great to get fresh air, but could have used a thorough cleaning. I'm sure if I would have notified the staff it would have been taken care of, but it was winter so I have to understand. The central business district and Gastown are a bit of a walk (or short cab or bus ride) but Davie village is a great neighborhood with many unique shops, restaurants and markets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: JayDive
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the middle of Vancouver and is just off Davie Street (one block) where many of the best local restaurants are located. The Vancouver beach walk is also a couple of blocks away and the best is Stanley Park. We rented bikes for the day to ride around the city and through Stanley Park. The hotel had real nice suites with full kitchens, living rooms, free wifi, free breakfast and free parking (which is unheard of in Vancouver). All the staff are great with good knowledge of Vancouver. This is a great fine and awesome value for the dollar. Stayed March 7 & 8th then again March 14th before going to the airport. Tip, ask for the higher floors with the view.

Reviews.Title: “Between Average and Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: RehanaF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sunset Inn from March 7 - 9, owing to a need to be closer to my place of work during this period (I work at UBC and live in Pitt Meadows). I booked a one-bedroom executive suite based on the reviews, location, and price. The location of the Sunset Inn is great, as it is within walking distance to all kinds of shops and restaurants. Getting across the Burrard Bridge and to UBC was a breeze, which is exactly what I needed. With an executive suite, I was placed on the 10th floor and had great views of downtown and the mountains. The lay-out of the suite, which included a full kitchen, has an apartment vibe to it as you're provided with everything you need. The bed was very comfortable, although I'd hesitate to call this a one-bedroom suite given that the 'bedroom' did not have a door. The room was clean, and the Neutrogena toiletries provided were a great touch. Gated parking was included, which was very much appreciated in a city where parking is limited. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful, and are a genuine asset to this hotel. Being in a north-facing suite, the room backed onto the alley behind Davie Street, which was loud and very visually unappealing. The windows did not seem to block out sound very well, and I could clearly hear all the alley noises even being on the 10th floor. I can't imagine what my stay might have been like had I been on a lower floor facing the alley. The bathroom is serviceable but very small. The suite is fully furnished and mostly well decorated, with the exception of the living room furniture which was dated and slightly uncomfortable. Overall, I enjoyed my stay here. I actually didn't realize that this was a two-star hotel, as I had booked based on the mostly positive reviews, and I would say that it exceeded what I might normally expect of a two-star hotel. I would recommend this hotel to others, and would stay here again in a south-facing room.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful touches, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sita A
Reviews.Content: Typically my hotel stays are uneventful. I've stayed at 5 star hotels and though the experience may have been positive, I didn't feel impressed enough to write a review - I just expect that for the amount of money I pay for the room, the service should be on par. My stay at the Sunset Inn went beyond my expectations. It's ranked as a 2-star hotel, however its service and hospitality are easily 5-star. Perhaps what touched me most were the packaged slippers tucked into a terry cloth bathrobe. My feet were aching and I was cold. To see these two items along with a note on my bed explaining all the free things available to me such as a library of DVDs to take up to my room, continental breakfast and a playful note about the weather made me feel like despite coming in so late at night, someone was there to welcome me in a personal way. And the beds! I was sick and have terrible allergies. The bed was like heaven - with fluffy pillows, crisp and clean sheets and a warm, comfortable duvet. I slept like a baby. In the morning as I was getting ready to start my day, I was pleasantly surprised to see that q-tips and cotton balls were provided for my morning skin regime. I truly felt at home. I was only going to stay for 2 nights and ended up staying for 4.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: muzzysmum
Reviews.Content: We spent the night here after a week in Whistler, attracted by the low price, free parking and description of spacious suites. The room was clean and large with a small kitchen, comfortable bed and free wifi. The hotel is on a quiet side street between Robson and Granville so a 10 minute walk to either. I would definitely stay here again, the room price included a continental buffet style breakfast. The reception staff were very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Nomads268
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in Vancouver, February 2012 and found this an excellent place to stay at great value. The hotel is well managed and the reception staff need a pat on the back. Complimentary internet is also a nice touch. Downtown Vancouver is only a 10 to 15 min walk and the ferries are only 5 mins away. There are bars and restaurants in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleased!”
Reviews.Author: ViajeraTK
Reviews.Content: Decided to take a last minute trip for a "girls' night/shopping/sightseeing" mini-adventure and booked at the Sunset Inn and Suites the same day of our stay. I called the hotel directly and talked with the nicest person (Ashley, I think?) who assisted with my booking of 2 rooms: one Executive 1-Bedroom King Suite and one Executive 2-Double Bed Studio, both very reasonably priced for everything you get! She was also there on our arrival several hours later and was just as nice and helpful in person :) The rooms were super clean, very nicely decorated and well kept, with comfortable beds and everything we could have wanted, including full kitchens with actual ovens, full sized refrigerators and dishes/tableware, and plenty of room to spread out. The bathrooms are a bit small but are nicely appointed and have everything you need including fantastic showerheads with lots and lots of hot water (my sister and I can challenge even the most efficient hot water delivery system!), and the Neutrogena toiletries were perfect for the allergy sufferer in our group. The beds were quite comfortable, with lots of fluffy pillows and again very clean. The continental breakfast is basic but more than sufficient and had something for everyone in our group. The location was terrific, a bit away from the hustle and bustle but within just a few minutes of shopping, restaurants and pretty much anything else you could want. The free *secured* parking is a nice plus, and although the spaces are a bit tight we had no problems at all parking our SUV. I will definitely plan to stay at the Sunset Inn and Suites on future visits to Vancouver. We simply couldn't have been more pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Sunset”
Reviews.Author: Fourniers
Reviews.Content: Recently booked a one bedroom executive newly renovated suite. Very comfortable with convenient amenities. I hosted a few informal client meetings in my suite and found them to be comfortable and roomy...nice to be able to offer my clients coffee as well. Will book again in the future without hesitation. Nearby Davie Street was great for food/restaurants, but not much for retail shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Brizsuz P
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 night at the Sunset Inn before heading to Whislter. It was a great hotel to recover from the long flight and provided a good base to explore Vancouver. Hotel is located in a more suburban area of downtown Vancouver, but still an easy walk to Robson St for shopping, and there are plenty of restaurants of varying prices within a couple of hundre metres of the hotel. Not far to the beach either - a walk along is recommended (although it was a bit chilly when we were there!). A simple breakfast is provided daily - bread, bagels, pastries, cereals - all of which you take on a tray back to your room to prepare and eat. All rooms have kitchen facilities which should satisfy most. We found the breakfast more than adequate to fuel us for our days sightseeing. Also free wi-fi is provided. We needed some extra ski bits & pieces and the staff gave us thorough directions to get to the store and correct change for the bus. Will stay here again if we find ourselves back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: Summer747
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed here for 2 nights recently on a trip from the UK and thought it was wonderful. The large one bedroom suite was very comfortable with a large front facing balcony and was in easy walking distance of Davie Street and its nightlife. The reception staff were warm and welcoming and there is a free continental breakfast which you can come down and help yourself to in the morning to take back to your room. It isn't amazing but then for the excellant price we paid for our room we really weren't that bothered. I really can't find any fault with this hotel at all and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great choice for hotel”
Reviews.Author: Midnightblue A
Reviews.Content: We were only here for a night, but it was very pleasant. Room was really nice and the view from the upper floors is wonderful at night. Location is great. Easy walking distance to both Davie St. and Granville St. which are both great for food, bars and clubs. Only bad things was their continental breakfast. Would plan on eating elsewhere. Other than that, things were great. Would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel, awesome price, nice people!”
Reviews.Author: Angela H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 weekends ago. It was very clean, spacious, and quite. I will definitely stay here again! Continental Breakfast is not very big, but it was perfect for a light breakfast to start the day! The rooms are wonderful! Bathrooms are a little tight, but didn't bother us one bit. Showers were great, beds were comfy, and the kitchens are SO handy! The only thing that sorta sucked was the parking. I drive a mid-size pick up and it was hard to park it in their tiny parking lot. BUT it is secure and free!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: nikolas g
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. The hotel is really nice, the location is good but it is not at the center of Vancouver. The center is 10min on foot, and basically you have everything around. The room has everything. Free wifi internet as well. The only "disadvantage" was that they said they have breakfast and they do, but it is just a small table with fruits, croissants and coffee (for us it was ok). The hotel is highly recommended though!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kristina Y
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, fantastic location, incredible deal. One of the best places we have ever stayed in any city in North America. Staff is warm and extremely helpful. Our second trip and we have traveled with young kids both times. Excellent for families and a really fun urban location for couples or singles. Even have free parking in a dense neighborhood, and a generous continental breakfast. We feel very at home here and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle T
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room on the 6th floor. Very clean and decorated nicely. Really suprised at what a beautiful room we had for the price. Everyone at the Hotel was friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was good and just enough to get you going in the morning. Close to the Granville Island ferry. Close to everything. The only complaint I have which wasn't the Hotel's problem was the garbage trucks that come early in the morning and are loud...the surrounding alley-ways are not pretty to look at but oh well...and the rain started up early in the morning and was dripping really loudly on the top of the air-conditioner outside. The Hotel itself though is definitely worth coming back to. I would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shirley W
Reviews.Content: I went to Vancouver on a medical trip. The hotel is very close to the hospital and shopping. The room was excellent and the staff were very helpful. If I ever have to go there again that is where I will be staying and I will be recommending this hotel to everyone I know that has to go to the city. It was nice to be able to have my daughter and granddaughter come and stay with me at no extra cost. I was able to visit with my children and grandchildren with no complaints from anyone, the staff were helpful and friendly to my family as well. As a person with a bit of a mobility problem everything was easy access. Simply great service.

Reviews.Title: “Simply - Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: john w
Reviews.Content: We come to Vancouver for a little winter getaway every year and the Sunset Inn and Suites is our home away from home. The location is perfect, the staff very helpful and friendly, and the executive suites very roomy, clean and with full kitchen, but who wants to cook when surrounded by a wide variety of excellent ethnic restaurants? Continental breakfast, wireless, parking, daily Globe & Mail, bathrobes and slippers - complementary. Sea wall and Granville Island, just down the hill. This is our fifth year and after staying for 6 nights, our only regret is that we can't stay longer! The essence of urban life in Vancouver. K & J Edmonton, Alberta

Reviews.Title: “Perfect again!”
Reviews.Author: OnAWalkabout
Reviews.Content: This time we chose the hotel because of being close to St. Paul's hospital. My husband was having a major heart procedure which would be a day procedure if all went well. We stayed in an Executive Suite so my husband could rest without me disturbing him. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and the suite was spotless with tasteful decor and an extremely comfortable bed. The room safe is large enough to accommodate a 15" laptop. Since we pretty much had to stay in our suite except when we were in the hospital we really appreciated the well appointed kitchen, the two flat screen televisions and the excellent wifi reception. The hotel includes breakfast which consisted of nice fresh bagels and croissants, cereals and juice and fresh fruit as well as coffee. There is no public gathering areas as such, so you are encouraged to bring the breakfast to the comfort of your suite as well as using the real dishes from the room. We also enjoyed the national newspaper provided at our door each morning. The bathrooms are compact but very well appointed and our suite on the 11th floor had excellent water pressure with a nice rain type showerhead. The bathrobes provided were a really nice touch as well. At this time of the year there was ample underground parking which is conveniently located to the elevators. There is a guest laundry and also a workout area should you need them. The location is great, right in the heart of things in Vancouver and the prices very reasonable. My husbands recovery went better than expected. We had reserved for 3 nights but were able to check out after 2 and were not charged for more than the two nights. We really enjoyed our stay and will be back, hopefully on a holiday the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, great service and value”
Reviews.Author: paulinelandry
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this downtown Inn & Suites in Davie Village, Vancouver. Well chosen alternative to the big chain hotels. Elvis and Dave at reception were so helpful and cheerful. Cosy well appointed, spotlessly clean suite with full kitchen and dining area. Continental breakfast, WiFi and parking included for $80-100 a night, can't beat that in vibrant downtown. Small but well equipped home gym, useful for a workout when it's raining. Good selection of DVDs at no extra charge. Walking distance to variety of restaurants and shops. Stroll or jog into Stanley Park few minutes down the hill. Highly recommend this place to my friends and work colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice for our family of 4”
Reviews.Author: jayjayAuckland
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here by default in October 2011. We had booked in at a back packers across the road, and were so disappointed in the accomodation there, that we walked across the road and paid $40 more a night for a suite with kitchen, dining/lounge, bathroom, comfy king bed in it's own bedroom while teenagers had a bed settee each in lounge. Spacious suite with everything you'd need. Well positioned, easy walk to city centre and close to many cafes and supermarket. Easy walk to estuary and ferry across to Granville Island. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good hotel - good price, good staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: katiekeating
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sunset Inn & Suites for 3 nights in mid December. We booked our stay through the hotel website and obtained a very competitive early bird rate.On our arrival, after a long haul overnight flight, the reception staff provided a warm and friendly welcome, immediately checked us in to a room (before the official check in time) and upgraded our room. The room we stayed in was spotlessly clean, spacious and quiet, with a separate bedroom, including a very comfotable bed, and living area. The hotel is an easy 10 - 15 minute walk to downtown Vancouver. The staff were always cheerful, friendly and helpful as we passed by each morning and evening. The breakfast was simple, but enough. Their DVD library provides a very good selection of DVDs for free loan to guests. Overall, a very good hotel - good price, good staff, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: SJS661
Reviews.Content: Having been very disappointed with the original hotel we were staying at, we decided to try Sunset Inn & Suites and were so happy to have found this wonderful hotel. On arrival we explained why we were changing hotels and if possible could we have a quiet room having just had surgery a couple of days previously. We were given a free room upgrade without hesitation and were not disapointed at all. The suite was spacious, extremely clean and well-equipped and the bed was really comfy. The addition of the free continental breakfast and wireless internet was great, as was the free DVD film hire!! The location is good and a ten minute walk to the centre of downtown. The reception staff called us a cab on our departure morning and it arrived within two minutes...fantastic!! Not only is the hotel and its facilities wonderful...the staff are great. They were very friendly, helpful and made sure we were happy with the room. They even took the time to ask how I was feeling as I was recovering from eye surgery. We would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here whenever we are in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: brysha
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a week in December. It's location is excellent for exploring downtown Vancouver, close to many eating and shopping options. The cost was very reasonable. The staff were amazing, helpful and caring. The rooms were lovely and very comfortable. It was a perfect home away from home. They did provide a light continental breakfast that you could enjoy relaxed in your suite. There is a laundry room onsite and parking was also available. It was perfect for me and will now be my "go-to" hotel when in Vancouver. What can I say, it provided a stress-free visit to Vancouver. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, superb service”
Reviews.Author: Emma G
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one night at the Sunset Inn and Suites and were really impressed by the size and quality of the room — a great queen bed, with high threadcount sheets and comfy duvet, a full kitchen, living room with two hide-a-beds and a balcony, and a well-appointed bathroom. This place was literally larger and nicer than the apartment we call home. The location, just off Davie street, is also great, because it's in a cute little neighbourhood near the beach, yet still close to everything downtown has to offer — shopping on Robson, eating out on Davie or Denman or going for drinks in Yaletown. The service was also impeccable. We checked in early and instead of giving us grief, they upgraded us to one of their best rooms for free. I doubt we'd stay anywhere else in Vancouver now that we've discovered the Sunset Inn and Suites.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best places to stay in Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: Can_PR
Reviews.Content: This is the one of the best places to stay in Vancouver, BC. You won't know this w/o staying there. Their front desk staff Elvis, Dave, Daniel are very friendly folks. Any thing you need back home is well taken care here. Feel like home, home-away! We had to cut down our stay from 8 nights to 3 nights, it was taken care by them w/o any hassles. Its is in downtown, surrounding is safe. Walkable from main attractions. We would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Spot”
Reviews.Author: Kit M
Reviews.Content: Hard to find much to complain about! We stayed 2 nights then added 1 more after checkout by phone from downtown and the room was already reserved. They had guessed correctly! Good location, friendly, knowledgeable staff, clean suites, well equipped and very large. My only possible complaint was the very cold bathroom floor (January) which has a carport directly below. Not a big deal and not a problem most of the year. Noise from the busy alley/street on the north side could be an issue for some. Wifi was strong and free. There are lots of convenient stores and services available right on Davie St. barely a short block away including a nice retail wine shop. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Vancouver, Canada”
Reviews.Author: gLoBe-HoPpErMaN
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sunset Inn 4 times in the last 2 years. When checking in the last couple of times I've been treated like an old friend. There isn't anything major in this hotel I can think of which could be much improved upon. Get a south-facing room as the north-facing ones can be a bit noisy if the windows are open. The parking is free but the spaces are a bit cramped but you'll be all right as long as you're not driving a very large vehicle. I'm at the point now that if I can't get a room at the Sunset Inn when I'm planning a trip to Vancouver I'll postpone my trip until I can.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: sushi-eater
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sunset Inn for 5 nights for our holiday. Our room was specious, clean and well equipted. WiFi (FREE!) was super fast. We could walk to Davie Street's restaurants and groceries for the everyday necessities. It was brief walk to the ferry station to catch a boat to Granville Island for browsing and getting more goodies from Public Market. We bought fresh handmade pasta, brought them back and you have a kitchen to cook them. Only funny thing was the curtain in the living room does not completely close to cover the window, but we were OK with it. From the airport, we took skytrain - canada line. You can catch a taxi at either Yaletown or CityCentre station to the hotel. I have stayed at Waterfront or downtown hotels before but this hotel was the most relaxing. We will stay here again for sure if we visit Vancouver in the future.

Reviews.Title: “One of Vancouver's best!”
Reviews.Author: Darrell S
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Sunset Inn & Suites in Vancouver, BC, and we were pleasantly surprised. We just stayed for one night, but we enjoyed the location, which was just West of downtown a little and very conveniently located to the entire city. The rooms have been very tastefully decorated and were quite comfortable, except for the sofa bed-couch combo (which we used for a couch only) and the "rock hard" side chair. With very limited bathroom space, it did include a nice large shower. The secure parking area provided for guests was tight but very convenient. Our room was located on the back of the hotel on the tenth floor which gave us a nice view of the surrounding area, but it was close to all the noisey night life in the area, which took place from about 1:30 AM until about 4:00 AM. If we stay here again, we will definitely request a room with a water view or at least a room on the South side or front of the hotel. The noisey night life kept you from getting an excellant rating.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation plus after a long plane flight”
Reviews.Author: travelbug1959
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the spacious room we were allocated. The staff were more than friendly and offered heaps of advice on things to see and do, gthey were always ready for a chat. Breakfast was adequate and you could take it back to your room to enjoy. Our unit had a fully equiped kitchen with full size fridge microwave and stove, so you were not compelled to eat out if you so pleased. What lacked in a view made up for it in spaciousness. Loan umberellas were a definate plus. An added bonus was the free laundry (incl washing powder) which helped when you had been on the road. They even gave us some large garbage bags to cover our luggage as it was raining on our return to the rail station.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and service”
Reviews.Author: shoppinghelen
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay at the hotel. The location is wonderful. Walking to beach, grocery, restaraunt etc. The staff is very knowledgable about the city, recreation and restaraunts. We enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel! Not a single fault, not even a small one!”
Reviews.Author: scotbokkie
Reviews.Content: We still have two more nights to go in our five night stay here but I felt compelled to write my review now. If you have come across this hotel and are thinking of vacationing in Vancouver - stay here! This is SUCH a great place to stay! Here are the reasons 1. Very central and <10 mins to Robson and all the tourist stuff, but on a quiet street off Davie 2. Extremely well appointed, spacious, spotless, comfortable apartment style suites 3. Beds are EXTREMELY comfy and super kings 4. Kitchens have everything you could need to cook/prepare food 5. Complimentary breakfast is excellent 6. Staff are all very friendly and ready to help 7. A DVD library at reception (free) and they'll even loan you an umbrella if its raining (again, free) All in all I have never been as impressed with a hotel as I am with this one for value. I will definitely stay again and recommend it without a single hesitation to others.

Reviews.Title: “We will be delighted to be back here”
Reviews.Author: Amitab B
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay in Vancouver. The only other thing you can get by paying for a five-star hotel is a location on Burrard St. or at the Waterfront. Other than that this place has everything. Rooms are good and spacious, breakfast is excellent, and the room will have amenities that you might not have found in other hotels before. They will even rent you umbrellas and DVDs for free.

Reviews.Title: “Would give a 6 if I could!”
Reviews.Author: kimchicowboy
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel 6 stars if I could. This place was fantastic: convenient location, clean rooms, and wonderful staff. With only 6 units per floor and only 11 floors, it wasn't crowded and the staff were able to be very attentive to our needs and questions. The rooms were all tastefully decorated and the bed was soooo comfortable. The 1 bedroom standard suite w had was very spacious and had all the necessary kitchenware we required. The location was very convenient. It would only take my wife and I less than 30 to walk to downtown or yaletown. The neighborhood is very quiet, but close to restaurants and shops. All this for a VERY affordable price. I would definitely stay here again. Thank you to everyone at the sunset inn & suites for helping our vacation very pleasant and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again--We Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: moonfroth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sunset for a month in March-April of this year, and at that time I wrote a TA review singing its praises. This time, we're enjoying our favourite hotel for ten days. Sustaining quality of facilities and service over time is a difficult balance, but I'm happy to report that the Sunset continues to deliver the same quality experience for its guests. We were greeted like returning family, and when the suite they assigned us didn't quite meet our needs, they immediately found one that did, and moved us. The continental breakfast has been expanded a bit, and since this is the Christmas season, complimentary eggnog, apple cider, and cinnamon sticks are laid out every evening in the lobby--just the kind of special touch we've come to expect from this gracious little oasis in Vancouver's West End. Do yourself a favour next time you're visiting Vancouver: check out the Sunset!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location near Davey St”
Reviews.Author: Ads_and_Wennie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in December and cant fault the place. Great location for restaurants, central to everything and easy to get transport, or close enough to downtown to just walk. Complimentary breakfast was a nice touch, really didnt both us using room cups and plates to go and get it. All staff very helpful. On site gym was good too.

Reviews.Title: “My fifth stay at Sunset Inn”
Reviews.Author: Helen M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sunset Inn and Suites 5 times - 3 for business and 2 for vacation. I recommend this hotel - it is unique and out of the way of the downtown hustle and bustle (but not too out of the way - you can still take a nice 10 minute walk to downtown). You can walk to grocery stores, restaurants, shopping and sightseeing. Every time I stay there I tihnk the hotel gets better! The staff is helpful, friendly and the rooms are clean, well set up and who could ask for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “Like Living in Downtown Van”
Reviews.Author: Big_D_Nanaimo_BC
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at the Sunset for one night during the 2011 Grey Cup in Vancouver. We frequently stay in large hotels such as the Sutton Place, Waterfront Centre, etc but wanted to try out something different. We noted the high reviews on TA but were a bit concerned it was a converted apartment building in a residential area. Verdict: What a gem of place to stay...especially if more than one night. Very well appointed, renovation is amazing, staff were very friendly. Kitchen was a real kitchen without the "ette" - granite countertops no less - new cabs, nice living area and separate bedroom with the "dream bed" that few places have (Like Westins'). Odd room numbers may have better views but it was not an issue for us with the "alley" view as we were 7 floors up - which I recommend at any hotel in a city - quieter. Bath was clean and modern. Continental breakfast was std, coffee acceptable - I DID NOT not find it an issue to load the tray up to the room pointed out in other reviews here. The location is about a 15min walk down Burrard to downtown...not bad at all. And you dont have to walk the gauntlet, it is in a nice neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Well and truly exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: nezza28
Reviews.Content: When my girlfriend and I booked this hotel through Expedia I wasn't expecting anything special and if anything I was expecting it to be nothing more than satisfactory. I couldn't have been more wrong. This is an absolute gem of a hotel! For the price we paid, which was around £72 per night, I would defy anyone to find a better hotel. Our room was huge! Bedroom with kingsize bed (super comfy), living room, balcony, bathroom and an extremely well appointed kitchen. It was more like living in an apartment than a hotel. It was also arguably the cleanest hotel room I have ever stayed in. The complementary breakfast, although basic, more than served its purpose and there was enough variety to suit most needs. The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. Also having spent a week in Banff and Jasper prior to our visit we were extremely thankful for the on site laundry room ($2 per load and washing powder provided). It's also in an excellent location. The street is a quiet residential street but just round the corner is Davie Village and it's about a 10 minute walk into Robson Street and all the shops. I would not hesitate to stay at Sunset again and would thoroughly recommend it to anybody looking for a place to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great deal, suite, location and amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugcheri
Reviews.Content: I thought this place would be good based on location and the photos on the website, but I read some not so nice reviews about it. I'm really glad I went with my gut and booked it. We, being a family with two teenagers stayed three nights from Sat-Tues. Got the CAA reduced rate, the room cost us 129/night The Good: Everything...and I mean this. Check in was great, we arrived early and they were able to accommodate us with early check in. Front desk staff..amazing and super friendly (Thank you) FREE secured parking...need I say more? We probably saved 80.00 on parking. We got a standard one bedroom, which was modern, spotless and well equipped. High speed Internet included. The kitchen had everything we needed to make a meal, the bathroom was new and clean with fluffy towels and nice shampoos and soaps. The bedroom had plenty of drawer and closet space as well as an alarm clock with an i-pod docking station. Bedding was soft and comfortable. My daughter mentioned the pull out couch was comfortable, the mattress certainly looked thick. Housekeeping was great (although we never saw them) upon return to our room every evening, the place was spotless and in order once again. I highly recommend, especially for families that want to save on meal costs, extended stay for one or more weeks and people that like to have that neighbourhood feel rather than a hotel experience. There really is no negative for me with this hotel. I will stay here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable”
Reviews.Author: kenbug
Reviews.Content: Nice place, highly recommend. 1. Rooms: We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen on the 11th floor, which is the top floor of this hotel. Decent view. Living area included 2 sleeper sofas so it would be possible to accomodate 6 adults sleeping wise if you so desired. Room also contained dining room table with 4 chairs, jetted tub, 2 flat screen TVs (one in bedroom, one in living area), and a DVD player. Room and all furnishings are updated and immaculate. 2. Location: Excellent, half a block away from numerous restaurants etc and within walking distance of clubs/etc. Also very safe, lots of people walking around at all hours. 3. Value: Excellent. We got a great price, and property includes free parking and continental breakfast (bread/juice/cereal). Bottom line: combination of price, location and excellent condition of rooms make this a quality choice for downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beowulf_agate
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the hotel. We stayed in a large one bedroom on the 5th floor and there was more than enough room for the 4 of us. The bed was very comfortable. We had a peek-a-boo view of the ocean. The kitchen was clean with an adequate number of dishes and cutlery. The breakfast was good – coffee, bread, croissants, bagels, jam, cream cheese, cereal, juice, fruit. The hotel is a block from Davie Street and close to a lot of restaurants, coffee shops, a grocery store, and a 24 hour Shoppers Drug Mart. It is a short walk to Robson Street. The (free) parking area is small but we had a compact car so parking was not a problem. We had some visitors and they had trouble finding parking near the hotel (a common problem in Vancouver). Housekeeping came at odd times and every day we got a different number of towels but the room was always clean when they left. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Why pay to stay in an high end Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jessace
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay st the Sunset Inn. Stayed the night when our daughter went to a concert nearby. It was again an excellent stay. The front end staff even recognized us after only being there once. So, you can pay for a high end Hotel or just stay in the West End at SWunset Inn! You will find this you find this will be your Hotel of choice when staying in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel we ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: SUBWAY41
Reviews.Content: We were graciously greeted the front desk and escorted up to our on the top floor. We were astonished at the size and cleaniness of the room. There was a beautiful view of Vancouver from the living room which also featured a small outside balcony. It was too cold and rainy for us to utilize it but I'm sure it is great during the summer. The kitchen was clean with adequate dish and silverware. The BEDROOM,I cannot discribe it enough. Clean, fresh smelling, crisp linens and CLEAN bedspread. It was very large and also had a view of Vancouver. The only thing I might complain negatively about was the size and quality of the breakfast. The croissants were a little stale, but then again, we had a kitchen if we wanted to cook a large breakfast. Would recommend this hotel to everyone who is traveling to Vancouver. Based on prices of other hotels in the city, this one is a real value for the money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GrantM196
Reviews.Content: We were a bit hesitant about staying here as we have been caught out in the past by places that look great on the internet but don't live up to expectations. Not the case with Sunset though. The apartment was spacious, really well kitted out, everything worked well and the standard of furnishing was high. The staff were very friendly and helpful without being pushy. The location is excellent with great local restaurants and easy transport links. We would definitely recommend Sunset to anyone looking for a spacious apartment in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: Patricia T
Reviews.Content: We started our four week trip to Canada and Alaska with a two night stopover at Sunset Inn and Suites arriving there after a 40 hour flight from Western Australia. An excellent place to catch up on sleep and adjust to time change. We found it to be extremely comfortable and convenient, within easy walking distance to Stanley Park and lovely walks along the foreshore and plenty of choice of resturants all around. Our only regret is that we had not allowed ourselves longer there.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat for location, price and ease of access”
Reviews.Author: CharlesSeems
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sunset Inn and Suites on at least a dozen business trips to Vancouver. The staff got to know me quite well and offered upgrades when possible. The location of the hotel (right behind Davie Street - the gay village) is perfect as you will be a short walk away from all of the downtown office buildings. With a good food store within minutes of the hotel, you can buy food and eat in as all suites have kitchens that are well equipped. The hotel offers a good continental breakfast. Although the coffee is nothing to write home about, the other offerings are good and incude at least one or two types of fruit. You can take the Canada Line to get to and from the airport. The hotel is a 12 minute walk from the RoundHouse station. You can hop on a No 6 bus (your Canada Line ticket is valid on the bus) or simply walk up Davie. The walk is invigorating and the sights and sounds are marvellous. Most of the time, I walked. If you have never been to Vancouver before, know that this is very much a walking city. In the downtown core, you can easily walk to most locations. The subway can take you out of the downtown core to see other places of interest. The Sunset Inn and Suites is priced just right and while you will not be in the lap of luxury, you will be in a safe, clean and central location. The hotel was a former apartment building!

Reviews.Title: “I could live here”
Reviews.Author: badtemperedzombie
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Sunset Inn and Suites several times a year for the past three years. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Vancouver. The location, in the heart of the vibrant West End, is within easy walking distance of restaurants, shops, beaches, Stanley Park, downtown, really anyplace you would care to go. The suites are spacious (apartment-sized), with a fully stocked kitchen and comfortable living room. The views from the balcony are incredible - the sun setting over False Creek, or gleaming off the glass towers downtown. The beds are exceptionally comfortable. But the true beauty of the Sunset Inn is the way that the staff make you feel, not just at home, but part of an extended family. When you walk into the lobby and the people behind the desk call out to you by your first name, wondering why it took you so long to come back for another visit, you know you are amongst caring souls. I've spent more time than I should admit, just chatting at the front desk. Even the housekeeping staff know me by sight now and welcome me back whenever I return. Amenities include continental breakfast in the lobby, free gated parking, small workout room, and laundry facilities. I always hate to leave, to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of good and some not so good.”
Reviews.Author: Trione1
Reviews.Content: First time at the Sunset Inn & Suites. I have been looking at trying it for a while and finally spent two days there for a short "get-away". The location is a bit hard to find, but is not that bad. It is in a decent area with a short walk to Davie Street and all kinds of places to eat. I had a "Standard Suite" though I reserved a Studio Suite. They had upgraded me which was appreciated. I would assume this was due to the work going on re-cabling for HD TV and I think Internet. Pros Nice unit with separate bedroom, Bath, Kitchen, living room, most of the furniture is decent though, the couch was looking and feeling a bit dated. Overall it is better than a lot I have tried. The bed had a great mattress and I was tempted to pull the sheets off to find out what it was. The whole bed experience was Very good; Good size T.V, 32"? Free parking (rare in Vancouver); Free "Continental" breakfast (all cold, toaster in the room, coffee was hot and surprisingly good). Cons Was not impressed with housekeeping, they changed one towel in the bathroom and pulled the sheets up on the bed. They didn't clean any counters, tables, etc. They also didn't vaucum any floors or carpets or replace glasses. Same glasses as I used the day before were still sitting out in the kitchen & bathroom the next day; Number of parking spots/stalls very limited and cramped; Breakfast is fairly limited and you have to bring your own dishes from your room; Internet is very slow, hopefully to be faster when the wiring is finished; No heavy curtains in the living room so privacy and sleeping in are difficult if sleeping on the sofa bed. Also hard to see the T.V. during the day depending on which side of the hotel you are on; I would rate my stay above Standard and below Very Good. I would recommend it and would stay there again. Check Facebook for a discount code. They post one every once in a while and is usually good for $10-20 off an Internet Reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: ginnyb
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a family of three with young child on the top and lower floors. The good: Very nice staff - nothing was too much trouble. Area grew on us - great patisserie round the corner and restaurants and shops easy to walk to. Bit longer to get to Stanley pak or down town. Room was clean and kitchen well stocked. Wifi worked well. Had free DVDs for rainy days ( we had quite a few) The bad: Area is a bit "colourful" ( mummy, why is that man dressed as a woman?) with quite a few street beggars, but not threatening. Breakfast is a interesting help yourself from a table at reception affair. Seemed expensive for what you got but that's Vancouver for you.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this”
Reviews.Author: rndm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and it didn't disappoint. Last time I stayed in a beautiful one bedroom suite complete with fireplace. This time I stayed in a studio since I was on Govt business. The staff tried to talk me out of it since the 1 bdr are nicer, but for $80 I got a huge bedroom with a king sized bed, a balcony, a full sized kitchen and bath, two hall closets, free parking, internet (that worked) and breakfast in downtown Vancouver. There is no better deal! There are so many great restaurants on Davie. There is even a 24 hr drug store and grocery store one block up Davie. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The suites look brand new with hardwood laminate. I'm worred this "best kept secret" will get out. That reminds me, its very difficult to find this place. Walk NE up Burnaby just off Thurlow. You dont see the small sign until you are right at it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in downtown Van”
Reviews.Author: Jay A
Reviews.Content: This is 1 step away from apartment living in Vancouver's West End. Stayed for 5 nights and for the price, free parking, and a nice continental breakfast included. Being downtown Vancouver you can' t beat their location. Close to the shopping area on Robson St. The staff was quite friendly and Dave and Daniel were very nice and personable. Try to get an executive suite if you can which has a TV in the bedroom and quite a nice view. I give this one a thumbs way-up and will stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: briandg
Reviews.Content: We ended our driving tour in Vancouver and looked at properties we had stayed in before, but decided we wanted to try somewhere else - we chose the Sunset Inn & Suites after a lot of searching and were not disappointed. We read the website accommodation details and chose a suite with False Creek/Granville Island direction views and it was worth the bit extra to be away from the alley at the rear. The accommodation was great and just what we needed in which to unwind after our hectic trip. A wonderful bed complimented the spacious lounge and, though we didn`t really use them, the kitchen facilities would have enabled us to be totally self-contained, had we wanted to be. The general areas are quite small and to be truthful, are ready for redecoration, but the suite was absolutely fine in all respects. The breakfast arrangements required that you went to the lobby to collect your requirements and take them back to the suite - not ideal, but the only option given the limited general space. It was interesting to see some of the night attire being paraded during collections! The Inn is located on a very quiet street (if such a thing exists in a large city) which was great except when we wanted to go out to eat; It was a bit of a trek unless you used a cab and being a little way out from the centre meant the closer establishments were quite widely separated. In planning your day it would probably be best to eat before returning. All things being considered, we would give the property a positive thumbs up and recommend it to anybody, but you need to consider the view when selecting your suite and think about dining arrangements to ensure you get what you expect.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: themidlifetraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights based on other reviews and could not have been more pleased! This is a great value and place in Vancouver. We walked everywhere and only took the car out for exploring outside the city. FREE PARKING! The bed was wonderful and the room was large with extra space in the living / kitchen area. We loved it and the staff was incredibly friendly. The breakfast is very basic with great coffee, fruit and random breads and cereal. We skipped it most mornings but the coffee was perfect. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, and close to all we wanted to see”
Reviews.Author: MarianneO22448
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable, modern and had a kitchenette. Great in the West End. Able to park car and leave it in their lot. Great value and helpful staff. Hi to Elvis :)

Reviews.Title: “Great in all ways”
Reviews.Author: kassy55
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great room. Great service. Great bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sn0wescaper
Reviews.Content: We have spent Thanksgiving in Vancouver for the last 4 years, this being the first time staying here. we will definitely return here as we are very impressed. We stayed in a suite which was well decorated and very comfortable. Hardwood floors in the rooms give the room a very homey feeling. Free parking is available, it was extra at the otherh hotels we stayed at. Downtown,beach,& Stanley Park within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: jedimom
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here (first was 2008) and it was just as great as we remembered. The suites are so comfortable and it's so nice to have a fully functional kitchen. We were on a budget, so we partook of the free continental breakfast (pretty standard, but adequate), ate one meal out and cooked one in the suite. The kitchen had everything needed to cook, with the exception of a cheese grater, which we picked up at the local dollar store. As we were there 6 days, we saw a lot of different staff members and they were all incredibly helpful and friendly. From directions to attractions, advice on "best place to ?" or even help checking out a (free) DVD, they were always quick with an answer and a smile. We were so comfortable in our suite, that I noticed that at the end of a day of exploring, we talked about "going home" instead of "back to the hotel". I loved the cushy bed, but my husband would have preferred firmer. They even provided a room fan, which really helped me sleep as we always use one at home. I'd like to talk about my "dislikes" of this place to make this a more well-rounded review, but I really didn't have any. Oh wait, the elevators are slow. :-) I would highly recommend this establishment to any type of traveler - solo, couple, business or family. Wish I could have a place like this in all of the destinations we travel to.

Reviews.Title: “More satisfied customers”
Reviews.Author: BasildonJohn
Reviews.Content: We chose Sunset Inn on the basis of other reviews and price and have been very pleased. Dave on reception made us feel welcome after our long journey from England and gave us useful advice on local shopping and eating and places to visit. Room 203 was next to a lift but we heard nothing from the lift and very little from the rest of the hotel - the noisiest thing was the fridge in the kitchen part of our apartment which was partitioned off from the rest of the room. The bed was large and comfortable, and the room large and clean with hardwood floors. Breakfast is provided buffet-style from the reception area and small trays are provided to take food back to your rooms. We found the combinations of cereals, croissants, fruit, tea and coffee to be more than acceptable (and there were muffins, bagels, bread, butter, jams etc too) Burnaby Street is a tree-lined residential street with well-maintained properties and a friendly atmosphere - around 5.30pm it is full of dog walkers and joggers. And nearby Davie Street has a wide range of shops and places to eat - the majority seemed to be privately owned rather than part of big chains. It has been described as a village and we can understand why. Granville Island is a short ferry ride away for those who like markets and arts and crafts, while we made use of the Big Bus which does 'hop on, hop off' circular tours and stops just around the corner. What of the negative comments described by others? While in reception we saw a group of cleaners and our room was spotless, so no problems for us. Yes, the decor was a little dated (eg CRT television rather than a flat screen) but fine for us. The view over the small (free) car park wasn't inspiring and we didn't make use of the small balcony - but that was because of the cloudy and rather windy weather. We didn't need air-conditioning but the heating worked well and there was instant hot water. And yes, the wi-fi signal did drop from time to time. The one snag for a truly budget traveller with a large suitcase is that you need to get here by taxi; at the time of our visit the van service from the airport wasn't running, and there is no space on buses for large suitcases. Ans this is essentially a self-service hotel - for example you collect your own breakfast from reception (and can cook your own meals if you want to do so) If you want to be waited on, go elsewhere! All in all we have been well pleased. In our view this hotel continues to justify its positive ratings and if we ever return to Vancouver we will stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mako2002
Reviews.Content: Overall I was very impressed with the Sunset Inn and Suites. It was clean and in a great location. We had a one bedroom suite. It has one king bed and 2 queen pull out sofas. There was one bathroom and a full size kitchen. There was also hardwood floor throughout which was a nice touch. The free internet was a huge plus. As was the free parking. Breakfast was minimal but it got the job done. If you wanted cereal you had to bring down a bowl from your kitchen. There were bagels and fruit as well. Dave at the front desk was there when we checked in. He was wonderful. He gave us excellent advice on places to eat and drink. He provided us with a map and circled everywhere we should go. He was right on with everything he told us. The hotel is in a great location. It is just off Davie Street which is full of some great restaurants. Robson Street is just a few blocks away and is great for shopping. Yaletown was a great place for after dinner drinks for the over 30 crowd. It was a little bit of walk though…maybe 10 blocks. But we felt safe the whole way. Stanley Park is very close by as well. It was about a 15 minute drive to Capilano. There are a few key items I wish I would have known ahead of time. The parking garage is tiny and very hard to get in and out of. It took us a few tries to get in and out. If you are used to big city parking this may not bother you. But parking was a 15 minute ordeal each time for us. The elevators and hallways are tiny. It can be difficult to get around with a lot of luggage. This place very obviously used to be an apartment building. On the positive side…they do have free loner umbrellas at the front desk should you need them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in friendly Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: raecheyraech
Reviews.Content: I chose the Sunset Inn based on other Trip Advisor reviews and location - and I wasn't disappointed. All rooms are self contained. I was lucky enough to get upgraded and my room was massive. The property decor is a little dated but that kind of thing doesn't bother me. All staff members I encountered were super-friendly and helpful. I loved the location - an easy stroll to Davie Street plus it was easy for me to walk to Granville Island, Stanley Park and Kitsilano. My cousin was staying in Vancouver at the same time at a different hotel and he was very envious of the location and amenities of the property. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Alan5655
Reviews.Content: Sunset Inn offers a good value for the money with its good location, free parking, and free continental breakfast. The rooms are spacious with a fully stocked kitchen if you choose to cook. The hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants, Stanley Park, Sunset beach and the mini ferry to Granville Island. We never had to use our car which was good because the parking area, although free, is tight and limited. We found the staff at the front desk to be very friendly and helpful in giving directions and restaurant suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Radarz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem. By that I mean that it is not what you expect when you pull up out the front. It just looks like any other small place with nothing to out of the ordinary to be expected. But in fact it is a very good stay. We were returning from a 7 day cruise and we needed a place with a laundry. This hotel was the only one we could find that provided a laundry so we booked it not expecting too much, but it had a laundry, so that's what we needed., To our surprise the room was spacious, the furniture was relatively new and the whole suite was well fitted out. There was a full kitchen, with a full size fridge, stove, microwave and sink. The staff on the desk were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is situated less that 2 mins walk from Davies street, which is a lively and varied shopping street and only about 5-10 mins walk to Robson Street, another shopping area. We also needed to pick up a hire car from Hertz, and again this was only about 5 Mins walk away. If you need to go to the Downtown area, that would be 10 -15 MIns walk away. So if you are needing a stay in Vancouver, I would recommend this hotel for a short or a longer stay. A little noisy if you stay in a back room, because of the hospital nearby, but it was not a bother really.

Reviews.Title: “Best bet by far”
Reviews.Author: Riki D
Reviews.Content: If you are into having the privacy of an apartment at your disposal as opposed to hanging out in a hotel bed room, the Sunset Inn and Suites will be your best bet. Located centrally around the corner from Davie @ Thurlow it offers inclusive parking, a daily paper, local calls and high-speed internet access. Two bus lines take you downtown and back well into the wee-hours. Groceries and dining options are plenty in the neighbourhood. Stanley Park and Granville Island are within a walking distance. Davie St. is great for finding your way onto any of the major highways when leaving the West End. Most surprising: the staff. They seem enjoying their job which creates a very kind atmosphere whenever crossing the entrance area. Great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelguruDanville
Reviews.Content: The staff was great and tried so hard to please so it's hard to pan this hotel. However, it is a very old hotel (actually apartment). Although the beds were very comfortable, all of the other furniture in the apartment was old and shabby. Our friends had to move to another hotel due to the musty smell. I did pick it based on pricing at the time and it is good value. But we have come to expect a little more modern and better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - spacious suites.”
Reviews.Author: trich22
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights (17 & 18 Sept). We really like the Davie Village location - it has a residential feel about. The studio suite that we had was spacious and immaculate - all the appliances worked. The reception staff were very helpful in providing us with information. We walked to most places however there are numerous bus services available to places further out such as the Museum of Anthropology at BCU. We only had one noisy night from the clubs - that was the Saturday, the Sunday night however was really quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: Susan K
Reviews.Content: I found Sunset Inn and Suites using Trip Advisor, and I am so glad I did. I travel a lot for work and I have been to many hotels, both big chains and boutiques, this is by far one of my favorites now. The general manager, Michael, must be doing something right. The staff was awesome, especially Dave and Elvis. The room was a new and beautifully decorated suite. It was very clean and there was a lot of attention to detail. They really seemed to go the extra mile to provide comfort and convenience. The only drawback was my schedule - I could only be there for one night! I will be going back, and recommending the hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jane F
Reviews.Content: The room had one king bedroom and two queen soft sleepers in the living room. The bed was very comfortable, but the couple who slept on the sleeper did not sleep well. There was no "bar" causing discomfort, however. The person who slept alone said it was comfortable. There was a free standing air conditioner in the living room that ran loudly all night, but failed to cool the room. It's right around the corner from Davie St. which has a lot of restaurants and shopping. Bring your walking shoes or you will sit in traffic. I would like to go back and stay here again and spend more time. The parking is free, so that was a big bonus. It was a very nice suite. It's right next to the gay community, which wasn't a problem. Breeders might want to go to another part of town for night life. We went on a thursday and the bars were dead on Davies that night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: kerrybrin
Reviews.Content: We were only in Vancouver for a short time, but this was in a great location for walking around downtown. We had a one bedroom suite and it was perfect for my family (me, husband, toddler) and my parents. There were two sofa beds and a comfortable bed in the bedroom. It was clean and pleasant. The continental breakfast was good - the bagels were great. Can't beat the free parking either. Definitely would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Super front desk guy, Elvis...”
Reviews.Author: Beckydenver
Reviews.Content: We loved the converted and clean apartment/suite and it's excellent location. It's just a few blocks down to the waterfront and an easy hop on a bus to downtown shopping. It's located in VBC's West End area which is the gay neighborhhod.There were great restaurants and everyone was friendly and helpful. Especially Elvis, the front desk manager. We can't wait to go back and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SupermomOC
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in Aug/11. We stayed in the large one bedroom on 10th floor. My kids who slept in double sofa beds in the living room said the sofa beds are better than the one in Embassy Suites. The kitchen is well equiped and maintained clean. All types of restaurants, Mexican, Japanese, Thai, Vietnamese, Korean, Greek, pizza etc, are located within the walking distance. Coin laundry is also available at the hotel ( they even provide detergent!). Free wi-fi, free parking and free breakfast were very vaulable as well. It is not a fancy hotel but, we were very comfortable and enjoyed our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff, but woefully maintained”
Reviews.Author: sandstonez
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel is the location, which is reasonably close to downtown, lots of interesting places to eat close by, and nicely laid out suites, on the smallish side, but not overly cramped. Also, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The worst thing about the place was the maintenance (or lack thereof). In the first 15 minutes in the place we encountered a sign on the key slot for the garage saying its on its last legs and takes many swipes to work, a sign on the safe in the room saying its out of order, turn on a light switch and the switch falls out of the socket, tried to plug in computer and plug socked was broken. When we reported an apparent water leak in the laundry room, the response was that they already knew about it, and now that we reported it he was going to call someone to fix it. Why all this stuff can't be fixed when its noticed is beyond me. However, the rooms themselves seemed to be in good shape, and certainly seemed clean and bright. There is a free continental breakfast - very minimal - coffee, orange juice, croissants and bagels. Given all the great bakeries within a block, we never tried it. The kitchen in the room was very nice (think building was originally built as apartments, not a hotel), but very minimally equipped - 4 plates, 2 coffee cups, 2 wine glasses, a few pots and pans, coffee maker, some cutlery. The parking is about 10 spots inside, another 8 outside but in a locked gate, and a few other reserved that are in the alley. Since we had a nice car, we made sure we were back early so we got a spot inside, and not take a chance on the neighborhood. There is WiFi, and it mostly worked, but kept on dropping in and out, had to reconnect over and over. Maintenance again? Prices were reasonable, so its a decent value, but I'd have felt better paying a bit more, and having a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenience service apartment”
Reviews.Author: Silawat_Tao_Bkk
Reviews.Content: This is my first time in Vancouver. After went through tripadvisor, I decided for Sunset Inn. We stayed in one bed room suite. The room is really good with very wide. I went there with my family, total of 4 persons. The bed was really great with very good sleep. Also, have air con, kitchen, dining tables, sofa bed and very big LCD TV. The location is really good too, close to Shoppers, small supermarket with in less than 5 minutes walk. Also, there are plenty of restaurants in that area. Also, car park is free. Small things which can be improved are wifi signal which sometime off and on, kitchen wares which the manager was already replace with new one. We will go back to Vancouver soon and will stay in Sunset Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place,will be my first choice”
Reviews.Author: bigblock1970
Reviews.Content: Great place,from location,staff,rooms,etc.Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “What an Excellent Base for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Coyote88
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in one of their studio appartments and were very pleased with our stay. The accommodation was excellent, maid service a little slow as they didn't get to our room untill late afternoon but with a complimentary breakfast we were very pleased. The 'Suites' are located in central Vancouver with many sites, Stanley Park, Gas Town and Granville Island all within walking distance. Do also try to get to the Cloud 9 revolving restaurant and Hons chinese restaurant both worth a visit. The desk staff at the 'Sunset' couldn't have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vittorio45_11
Reviews.Content: Great service, very kind reception, clean, located in downtown Vancouver. I stayed in room 1004 on the tenth floor. Excellent accommodation with kitchen, living room, bedroom with king bed and bathroom with shower.

Reviews.Title: “central location, parking, internet, kitchen (it's a suite), light breakfast”
Reviews.Author: elodTlv
Reviews.Content: Pros: central location, parking, internet, kitchen (it's a suite), light breakfast, friendly staff Cons: WiFi signal was ok, but could have been better (especially for smartphone, which has a weaker receiver). It's a suite, so if you take the standard room then the TV is in the living room but no TV in bed-room (they do have TV in bed-room of executive room).

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LWP100
Reviews.Content: I advised the hotel when booking that I would be arriving in Vancouver (by train) at 09.30. I got to the hotel shortly after 10.00, was greeted with "Bore da" ("Good Morning" in Welsh) by Elvis, the Welsh guy on the reception team, even before I had introduced myself and was then told that my room was ready for occupation. Every interaction with the reception team was friendly and positive - a great bunch. The hotel is in a good location in the West End, certainly convenient for Stanley Park, the beaches and Granville Island, with the restaurants and bars of Denman Street and Davie Street close by. The room was spacious and comfortable. A great place which I would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: alaska12550
Reviews.Content: good location and service, nice room. excellent kitchen we stayed on top floor and they never made it to clean our room but not a big deal let us print out a flle, no charge

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location but in need of a renovation”
Reviews.Author: silveritte
Reviews.Content: The decor is very old, 1960s style, badly in need of a renovation & a flat screen TV! Location is right in the heart of West End, in walking distance to Stanley Park and a lot of nice restaurants. Service was great and made us feel welcome. We were also given a free upgrade. Free breakfast (simple continental style) and wi-fi internet was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Treated us like family!”
Reviews.Author: abcd1965
Reviews.Content: We were a family with two teenagers who appreciated the large one bedroom apartment room - plenty of space for all, including two pull-out sleepers for the kids. Our bed was incredibly comfortable, as well as the sleepers. Excellent staff - incredibly friendly and very willing to provide the insiders scoop on best Vancouver eateries and activities. For Vancouver, the location was excellent: one block from Davies which boasts an abundance of tasty local restaurants, a market , walking distance from Stanley Park and just a hop, skip , and jump from Granville Bridge which takes you over to the Island as well as to charming Kitsalano. We are runners so we appreciated being so accessible to a variety of runner-friendly and picturesque areas. We are from Southern California and if we ever get here again, we would stay again and also would refer friends and family. Thank you for nice Vancouver memories!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: 9thANGEL
Reviews.Content: Located right off of "Davie Village," (google it), the place is right next to some very interesting restaurants and shops, and is a good central location to get around. Parking is free, which is nice for downtown hotels that can charge $25+/night. However, the parking lot in the back is a bit hard to get in and out of, especially if you have a larger vehicle--practice 3-point turns. Wifi is also free, but a bit on the slow side. The executive 1 br suite on the 8th floor was spacious and clean, with a small balcony and good view of the city. Fully stocked kitchen made life a bit more comfortable. Only gripes are the bedroom doorknob was a bit finicky and the safe was broken. Overall a great hotel for the price. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant and fabulous helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: LeepyLoo
Reviews.Content: We were planing an RV trip around Canada but needed a place to stay for my family of five for a few days to get over jet lag and to see vancouver. I came across the sunset suites via trip advisor and it was a good option for cost efficiency. We had a fabulous room overlooking the city. It had plenty of room for the five of us. Very clean, maybe a little dated but didn't matter. In the centre of town so surrounded by restaurants and shops. Good base to stay for a city trip. The staff at the reception were just so helpful. Thanks guys. Def pleased we found this place on trip advisor. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: okapiCa
