Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and loved it. Its a great base to see the city. Our daughter decided she wanted an apartment just like it (fab view of city, parks and water, great walking neighborhood, who wouldn't?). Its in a urban renewal area but not too urban, a mix of low rise buildings and apartments. Neighborhood felt very safe, even in the early morning and evenings. We went to the nearby huge community pool in Stanley Park which we'd highly recommend for families with kids. Only slight comment; we were travelling with two kids and when both of their beds were folded down, it made navigation in the main room tight. Morning breakfast was pretty limited.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillLawson
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from Mexico, you need a welcome and a nice place to rest after spending all that time on the plane. The Sunset Inn and Suites, found on TA and other sites is just the place. We arrived at 8 PM and the clerk was taking a reservation over the phone. Being alone, he covered the mouthpiece and gave me a huge smile and "I'll be right with you". He immediately made us feel welcome and soon had us on the 11th floor with a view of the mountains. The room, complete with separate bedroom, kitchen, balcony, and a living/dining area is spotless, roomy and fully equipped with everything from Scope mouthwash to huge flat screen TV's and even a fan if you want to turn off your AC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection--location, helpfulness of front desk”
Reviews.Author: B J
Reviews.Content: One block from busy Davie with restaurants, bike rentals. Few blocks from Sunset beach where we walked along the water every evening. Beautiful suite with separate bedroom worked well for the three of us. Great views. Affordable. Easy to get info on where to go.

Reviews.Title: “nearly perfect, cozy self-stay close to everything great about vancouver”
Reviews.Author: stillacitygirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sunset three different times this past summer in three different suites - each one nicer than the last. First and last times were with my husband; second time with one of our grown-up kids. We appreciate this property's location, not only pedestrian ideal, but lovely in aspect. We also appreciated making some of our meals in a serviceable kitchen and having a bright, clean area to relax in.Is an older building re-furbished with hardwood floors, lots of natural light, comfy appointments. Reception staff are friendly and very helpful; housekeeping staff also nice. Only criticism might be a little more up to speed (sharp) kitchen implements - sharper and more cooking knives, decent peeler - and more than one coffee pouch, and tea options, from housekeeping, but pretty small things overall. We intend to stay again and again in the future - a very nice, welcoming place in a great neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: JoJ_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the final week of our holiday and we so impressed with the room. We had a one bedroom suite that had 2 double sofa beds in the sitting room. There was plenty of space for everyone (we are a family of 4) and it was simply just a lovely place to be. A week there meant that we could take everything at a slightly more relaxed pace and the surrounding area really gave us a feeling of what it would be like to live in Vancouver, so glad we picked this.

Reviews.Title: “great price, location, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dyyzs
Reviews.Content: This place is a great deal: a one bedroom (king bed) apartment with full kitchen, balcony, on a quiet street, one block from Davie, five blocks from the beach, accessible to everywhere in Vancouver, for the price of an ordinary hotel room. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Wonderful People”
Reviews.Author: MotherMJ
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I flew out to visit my son in Vancouver and stayed for 5 nights at the Sunset Inn and Suites. It was a wonderful experience. The standard one bedroom suite was spacious, had a fully equipped kitchen and a great balcony with a view of the street. The hotel was close to the action on Davie Street but a block away so it was quiet at night. The staff were incredibly helpful with buses, where to find bicycles for Stanley Park, where to go for a walk, parking my son's car...helpful with everything. I will stay there again when we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a suite hotel close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: hamman1
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a suite hotel at a reasonable price close to the city centre for my children & I and the Sunst Inn & Suites was the only one that really fitted the bill. Whats more both breakfast and parking were included in the price. Our room didn't quite look as posh as the pictures on the web or in the brochure but it suited the purpose, and was clean and well equipped, though we were surprised the chambermaids weren't due to service the room until aftr 4pm each day, just as were were returning from a day out . The location within walking distance of a big selection of restuarants on Davie Street, the city centre around Robson, and Sunset Beach was ideal, and the reception staff were very helpful answering our questions, especially Elvis. Our only gripe was the way the buffet breakfast was arranged on a table in a narrow part of reception. If you had more than 3 people there it was too crowded and left no room for anyone to walk past, especially if they had a suitcase. Would I stay again? Yes I would.

Reviews.Title: “Most Attentive and Helpful Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: My father and I (I'm 24) stayed at the Sunset Inn and Suites about a week ago, and the experience was phenomenal. Even all the rave reviews that I'd read on TripAdvisor before booking didn't prevent me from being blown away by the excellent customer service, welcoming atmosphere, and pristine and comfortable accommodations that the Sunset provided throughout our stay. The moment we stepped through the front door, I knew I was in for a treat, since the gentleman at the front desk greeted me by name and injected his informative spiel with witty humor. Our suite itself, on the 11th (top) floor, was both compact and spacious at the same time. Since the hotel is right near downtown, space is quite precious, but the Sunset is designed to use its space as efficiently as possible. We even had a fully-equipped kitchen/dining area and a balcony! There was an event nearby on the first night of our stay, and the Sunset was at or near full capacity, so parking was a bit of a problem--but it wasn't one that we had to deal with! As soon as we walked back into the lobby after trying to park our rental car in the hotel's lot or garage only to find that they were both full, a staff member immediately took our keys and found space for it in the garage himself (he may have had to move it later to let other cars out). The complimentary continental breakfast had a wide selection of both nutritious and indulgent foods (but mostly nutritious foods, including whole apples, cereal, and English muffins). The cozy fitness room had only three cardio machines (a treadmill, elliptical, and bicycle), as well as some free weights and a yoga ball, but I never had to wait to use the treadmill. There was no TV in the room, but the machines all faced windows that had a spectacular view of the charming, lush front garden and sidewalks, so I could do plenty of people (and dog!) watching while I worked out. The location itself is probably the best in Vancouver. The Sunset is one block away from Davie St, which has tons of excellent restaurants and shops. However, Burnaby St itself (the street the Sunset is on) is removed from the frenzy of that main street, and the surrounding buildings are all residential condominiums and apartments. If I ever return to Vancouver--which I certainly hope to do--selecting where to stay will be the easiest choice of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms steps away from all the action”
Reviews.Author: BeATraveler
Reviews.Content: There were three of us that made the trek to BC and had some reservations about the hotel because it was not part of a recognizable chain be we knew we wanted to stay somewhere in the West End.The hotel was perfect for our needs--tucked away from main streets but close to everything we wanted to do. Vancouver BC is such a compact city and very walkable, so the hotel is convenient to Davie Village and a short walk to Robson and very close to several beaches. Check in was quick and the front desk crew was very helpful with our questions about sites and dining options. There was free parking (bonus!!! right behind the hotel) and free wifi in the room, and very comfortable beds. The bathroom was a bit tight. We were only there for one night, but the small kitchen was still useful and would be perfect for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, great value, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cancatchau
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Aug. 8 to 12, 2011 in the one bdrm executive suite. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Dave at the front desk was great with suggestion on local restaurants. Location is great - near the seabus to Granville Island market, Davie and Robson - everything within walking distance. Bed was nice and big and comfortable. Nice to have a kitchen with fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Must Be the Best Hotel Option in Downtown Van”
Reviews.Author: SanGillespie
Reviews.Content: FIrst of all, the location is perfect - it's easy walking distance to pretty much anywhere downtown and a skytrain station is only fifteen minutes away. The rooms are huge and complete with a great kitchen, and are also nicely furnished and very clean; the bed was huge and comfortable. I saw a couple of treadmills/elliptical machines in the lobby - had I been staying longer I would have found them useful! The service was noteworthy for being very friendly and knowledgeable about the area, offering some great restaurant reccomendations. On top of that, parking is free, making this well worth the price. Since our first stay, this has been the only hotel me and my family will visit in Van. I hope to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable 3 star but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: Daniel083
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in a 2 twin-bed studio on the 11th floor. Two adults and two small kids Good points were (i) good West End location on a quiet residential street (so just around the corner from Davie St, a 10 minute stroll to the beach and a 20-30 minute walk to downtown) (ii) friendly front staff (iii) free secure parking (iv) the fact that it had a kitchenette (iv) very close to supermarkets and grocers so easy to stock up. Not so good points - (a) be warned that having a kitchenette and small dining table eats up the space so it felt fairly cramped (b) disappointing kitchenette equipment (c) the laundry facilities are next to the reception rather than in-room (d) there isn't any concierge so you'll have to lug your own luggage around (not a problem for us) (e) it's not cheap for what it is (effectively a reasonable 3 star hotel) - we paid around C$270 per night. At the time we booked the Hyatt Regency would have been significantly cheaper - but with no free parking and kitchen facilities plus no laundry facilities. We made our choice knowing the pros and cons but beware the trade-offs!

Reviews.Title: “Relax with Sunset Inn”
Reviews.Author: WSUonline
Reviews.Content: Was up in Vancouver for the day and not only did the front desk staff get me checked in early (thank you Elvis) but help with finding my way around the city. Another party we were traveling with was also told their room was not ready but in 5 minutes their room was switched and ready to go. Liked: tons of space, open windows, kitchen area, nice bedding, small but nicely appointed bathrooms. Free parking is in the back alley (little scary) but in and out privileges is awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: jeffp94114
Reviews.Content: Just a block off Davie St restaurants and gay bars, easy walk down to English Bay, and in a wonderfully quiet and treed residential neighborhood, it's a great location. Rooms are a decent size, excellent/quiet European-style A/C in summer, well-appointed with full kitchen and nice living room area. It's a small & unattractive 1960's style 11-story converted former apartment building, but nicely renovated inside. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at several hotels on our vacation road trip this year. Sunset Inn and Suites was the best hotel all around.”
Reviews.Author: Patricia B
Reviews.Content: Book early as accommodations are limited! The location was centrally located to the attractions we visited. Staff were very friendly and helpful, even after our checkout. We are planning our next visit with them next year! Drs. Charles and Patricia Blair

Reviews.Title: “Very hand location”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneDon
Reviews.Content: The rooms were good the staff were helpfull and the location was great for the excitment of Davie street, It was very quiet could hardly hear any street noise. The price was rather high but it was a peak time and the kitchen allowed us to cook some meals and save a bit as well. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for small families”
Reviews.Author: jophine
Reviews.Content: This place gets you a convenient location, really good kitchen and decent bedroom. The AC worked perfectly and was nice to have on a hot day. Not much of a view or balcony but not really the point here: convenience, terrific location, and actually quiet for being in the heart of things. We brought an air mattress to put on top of the sofabed just in case, and it was a good thing we did because the mattress is super thin and not comfortable at all. But hey, most sofabeds aren't great anyway. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom very nice. You get a very large space with a real dining table so 3-4 people can be very comfortable here. We had a 1 bedroom on the 7th floor with living room window facing west. I think it's better the higher up you go so that you are furthest from the back alley noises and such. Parking lot is a challenge but it does the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you get the right rooms”
Reviews.Author: Detwom
Reviews.Content: Get an executive room, on a high floor and in the front. The AC wasn't doing anything for us, but with two windows we had a nice cross breeze. The card readers for the parking lots are pretty tricky (never did get the top lot to open up). Room was clean and bed was nice (and huge). Fun area, good food, but the guys at the desk seemed surprised that we were a straight couple -- maybe because we we there during the big pride parade/party. The area was nuts, soooo many people passing through the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: mjt001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during late July in an executive large 1 bedroom suite. The accomodation was perfect for a family of 5 including 3 adult size teenagers. The location was great being within 10minutes walk from downtown, 20 minutes from Stanley Park and 3 minutes from Davie street, a lively shopping and restaurant area. The hotel also provides onsite parking which is a bonus in Vancouver and the location is actually very quiet except for the seagulls! The suite was equipped with a well maintained stove/oven, fridge with freezer and dining area. Only downside was no dishwasher. The suite was cleaned daily. The laundry area was adequate to keep us in clean clothes! One positive point was the soap was provided free of charge which is not often the case. The breakfast was a bit on the light side but the suite was well equipped and a short walk to the local supermarket supplemented the meal. Lastly, the service was friendly and helpful. Dave, our concierge was a font of local knowledge and a great help. Thank you Dave!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice,good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerdaveUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to our trip on the Rocky Mountaineer. Our suite was at the rear of the hotel, facing downtown Vancouver, and on the 6th floor. The immediate view is of the backs of adjacent low rise property, but lift your eyes and you have a great view of Vancouver and its backdrop. The suite itself was very spacious, up to date TVs in lounge and bedroom, sofa, dining table and suitably equipped kitchen area. Entrance is in a pleasant street, and very easy access to shops and restaurants. We walked all over town from here - Stanley Park to Granville Island, and the centre itself. Nice welcome from the staff, and a very well provided breakfast area, to take back up to your suite. Another reviewer had said it was noisy - it's in the middle of town for goodness sake. No more than the usual hum when we were there. And the police cars are quiet/unnecessary in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal in a great neighbohood and city”
Reviews.Author: oldtraveler47
Reviews.Content: Our good time at the Sunset Inn started at check-in, when fthe riendly deskman Dave responded to my question about getting a room with a good view by upgrading us to a one-bedroom from a studio, on a higher floor. Everything about the three-night stay worked just fine. The bedroom and bathroom were cozy but adequate and the wi-fi worked, as did everything in the kitchen. The only downside here: The continental breakfast was skimpy and inconvenient., Still this place is a good value in a great neighborhood, one block off the very lively, happening Davie Street, with lots of bars, restaurants and boutiques...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: redh0und
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1 bedroom executive suite - 2 adults, 1 child and one infant. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. The suite was clean, quiet, comfortable and large. The bedroom (king bed) was just large enough to fit our portable crib.The mattress on the pull-out was one of the best we've experienced. We made good use of the full kitchen. The hotel is a short walk to the beach and less than a block from restaurants, bakery, etc. Our only issue was with the limited secure parking. The parking is free but the covered parking was always full and we were concerned about height. We managed to find a spot in the gated parking for 2 of 3 nights but on the last night we had to park outside the gated area. The breakfast was limited but that was expected and it was enough to get us going. Overall, a great stay. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Good Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: TheProf06
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a renovated apartment building right in the heart of the "Davies" district where there are several restaurants. Just a few blocks away is Robson Street with high end shopping and more restaurants. A few blocks in the other direction and you can catch the aqua bus to the Granville Market ($5.50 round trip/person) The front desk gentleman was extremely helpful and friendly when we checked in. He shared with us the "must see" sights of Vancouver and explained the different Vancouver neighborhoods. We also received $1 off coupons for bike rentals at English Bikes. The rooms are up to date and spacious. The floors are laminate flooring. There is a full kitchen in the executive suites where we stayed. The beds were not very firm, but still comfortable for our two day stay. There is a small balcony with two plastic lawn chairs. Parking is available at no cost, but you really don't need a car with the hotel in this location as you can walk everywhere you want to go, or catch public transportation. The continental breakfast is minimal (2 types of cereal, bagels, English muffins, bread, apples, bananas, "Tang" and lemonade). However, there are so many restaurants and bakeries within walking distance, I'd recommend skipping the hotel offering and finding a neighborhood cafe. The hotel has free Wi-Fi, though the signal is not strong. There is a very small fitness center next to the lobby, but again, with all the walking Vancouver provides, who needs a fitness center? I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Ruraam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 one bedroom suites, beds, very comfortable, nice fully equiped kitchen, bathroom, a bit small, but functional, Upon arrival we were greated by Dave, at the front desk, who was extremly friendly and helpfull. He gave us a quick overview of the city, which was very helpfull. The hotel is on a quite street, whithin walking distance from many attractions (stanley park, Robson st. Etc), and you can find everything in this neighborhood. The only dissapointment was the Gym room, which is poorly equipped (out of three machines one was broken), and there were no water and/towels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved teh location and rooms - but beds are terrible”
Reviews.Author: MomofAPN
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sunset Inn with three kids. while we loved the location, the helpful staff and the room as such, the beds were way too soft and we had a horrible night trying to get comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tartan69
Reviews.Content: I chose this as I wanted a separate bedroom & lounge but did not want to pay a fortune for it. The staff were very helpful, including keeping some prebooked Amtrak tickets aside for me. The location is very cool, right in the heart of the trendy gay neighbourhood with some great restaurants, coffee bars etc. Value for money is excellent, we had a huge suite including lounge/kitchen/bedroom/bathroom. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-cruise or post-cruise location.”
Reviews.Author: JaneAwbrey
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes by cab from cruise terminal. Lovely location bordering the west end of Vancouver (funky town as my husband calls it) and downtown. Easy access to a lot of great Vancouver attractions and a block from coffee shops, bakeries and take out. Transylvania bakery on the corner had wonderful pasteries. Front desk staff was extremely efficient and helpful with city info. We had a one-bedroom suite which was comfortably decorated, modern and spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Only a 2.5 Star Rating?”
Reviews.Author: welovetravelCanada
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here! This hotel is only a few blocks from the waterfront and Stanley Park. It is on a lovely, quiet residential street....shady and very pretty. Very pleasantly surprised by the room! Very clean and nice amenities. Spacious room, comfortable bed, with the added bonus of a full kitchen...full sized fridge and stove, toaster, tea kettle, cutlery...everything necessary should you have the need to prepare a meal in your suite. Great guy on the desk who provided lots of information about restaurants etc. A perfectly adequate breakfast is free in the lobby. A fun and easy way to see the harbour is by utilizing the sea bus that makes stops at all the pertinent tourist sites.....just a short walk from the hotel. Take note, the walk down to the waterfront is easy enough, but it's quite a steep climb up on the way back. I have trouble walking, but made out just fine with a few stops on the way up. Really good area for shops and restaurants. This may not be a 5 star accommodation, but it's certainly more than a 2.5 star, as far as I'm concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Added Plusses”
Reviews.Author: QuietTourist
Reviews.Content: While the Sunset gets deservedly great reviews, we were particularly impressed by : the great neighborhood which made walking to the beach or countless wonderful ethnic restaurants, bakeries, convenience stores possible at almost every hour of day or night; the desk staff which called taxis, booked tours, and gave detailed, accurate restaurant reviews; the proximity to bus stops, downtown, art museum, great shopping; the well equipped kitchen, flat screen tv, working wireless, private balcony. And all this for what we usually pay for a mediocre motel room in an American city.

Reviews.Title: “You will love it”
Reviews.Author: Partyoffivefromsocal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our 3 kids. Couldn't have been a better choice. Clean, spacious, close to restaurants, shopping, sea wall. Great staff, very helpful. Exercise room, washer, dryer, continental breakfast was fine for us. Highly recommend it. We would choose tis place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pmtcsmith
Reviews.Content: Great location! The hotel is very nicely remodeled the staff are very attentive, friendly, helpful. Lots of amenities included in the price including free breakfast, and free WiFi. Lots of restaurants within a short walking distance and convenient to downtown Vancouver. Our one bedroom suite (king size bed in private bedroom and a separate fold-out sofa bed in the living room) was clean, well-maintained, and comfortable for our 5-day stay with our children. Our suite with well equipped kitchenette was a lovely room with dining table that is great. The bathroom was small, but the lay out worked well. Like others travelers if you stay longer that the only one is the House keeping did not come until late afternoon after we had returned from our days activities. We were there 5 days and this was everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: msirani
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth annual trip to Vancouver, and i can't think of a nicer place to stay than the Sunset Inn and Suites. I usually take a one bedroom suite for about week. These come with a living room, balcony with a great view, dining table and fold-out sofa, desk, chairs and fully working kitchen. No matter how long I stay, it feels like a home away from home and I always want to stay longer. The hotel is immaculately kept and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Amenities include two televisions, a DVD player, an iPod player & radio, and a very comfortable bed. The West End neighborhood is both bohemian and fun. There are the practical shops close by like a Safeway grocery store, flower shops, fruit and vegetable stands, several banks, a drugstore with a post office in it, as well as a Starbucks on the corner. There are any number terrific restaurants and little unique shops to visit. There is handy public bus service to the downtown sights, and it is relatively close to the light rail. The Sunset Inn and Suites has parking included if you bring a car, which is very much appreciated. Some of my local Vancouver friends recently asked me, "Where did you find this terrific hotel?, and I had to say it was one of their competitors who suggested it. Hope you enjoy Vancouver and try the Sunset Inn and Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, good accommodation, very nice front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: HappyGirlTexas
Reviews.Content: Excellent location convenient to Granville Island, Grouse Mountain, Stanley Park, downtown Vancouver, lots of restaurants within a short walking distance. Our one bedroom suite (king size bed in private bedroom and a separate fold-out sofa bed in the living room) was clean, well-maintained, and comfortable for our 4-day stay with our two adult children.( The space in the bedroom is a bit tight for luggage.). Very adequate breakfast (cereal, toast, croissants, coffee) is available between 7-10 a.m for self-serve to take back to your room. The front desk staff, especially Dave and Elvis, were very helpful and friendly - do ask them for suggestions for restaurants, sightseeing, etc. This was one of the few places in such a great location in Vancouver that included free parking, free wireles and the breakfast in the room rate. Great value, great location, great staff! We'd definitely stay here again!.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mka1021
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quiet neighborhood yet a block from everything. It is just as the pictures show...beautiful! We had three rooms on one floor and the kids were able to go from room to room as the halls were safe and small. The staff was friendly, the breakfast, terrific, the parking perfect! PROBLEM: House keeping did not come until late afternoon after we had returned from our days activities. We were there 5 days and this was everyday.

Reviews.Title: “One bedroom suite on 8th floor had space and views”
Reviews.Author: cyberlion
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the fringe of the CBD yet still is well located because of all the cafes and restaurants around it. Nearby Davie street is an interesting area in its own right. Hotel close to the ferry to Granville Island. Easy walking distance to centre of CBD, to the shopping along Robson street and down to the waters edge, Vancouver Harbour and onto Gastown and its clock. Our one bedroom suite with well equipped kitchenette was a lovely room with dining table, lounge, good fold-out bed for adult daughter. Main bedroom was tight but comfortable and provided the necessary privacy. Good views. Friendly, happy, helpful staff. Small yet adequate breakfast was included. Popular hotel, do book in advance to get best deal. We could not get back in second time in Vancouver. Great introduction to Vancouver happy to highly recommend especially if you need a little extra space. Value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Good Price, Glad We Stayed”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltravels6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few weeks while looking for a new apartment to live in. We were relocating from another city and chose to stay here because of an advanced booking deal. Make sure you book in advance, WAY in advance. I booked about 8 months in advance because we needed to be sure we could have a few weeks if necessary. They are always full and run low vacancies. We had to change our dates several times and have mail delivered there and the staff were so friendly and helpful. When we arrived, we needed forms printed and faxed and they helped with that too. It was so nice to not worry about it and know it was easy to do. The rooms are decent sized, little kitchen, dining room, living room and bedroom. The beds are very comfortable. There were only a few improvements that could be made, like more hangers in the bedroom closet. I went shopping and didn't have enough to hang more than a few items. The apartment was rather dark because of only one main window and thick drapes, so it was quite dark inside. But we weren't living there, so not too big of a deal. The washer and dryer was handy to use and I'm glad we could do laundry. It is located near a lot of things so it was easy to do a little grocery shopping and get some food nearby. It was a very pleasant stay in the West End. And I'm really glad we booked with Sunset Inn. But now we have a place of our own in Vancouver. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Once again, a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bruno5Mom
Reviews.Content: This is really the best possible hotel for a great weekend in Vancouver. You can park your car (free underground ... unheard of in Vancouver) and never get in it again until you leave the city. We had a newly-renovated suite on the seventh floor and it was perfect. It's nice to come back to your hotel at the end of a day of walking and shopping and have a living room to sit in and a kitchen to prepare a few appies to go with a great bottle of wine. The staff are friendly and accommodating. There is grocery shopping just around the corner on Davie and you're only a couple of blocks to the sea bus to Granville Island. Restaurants abound.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and perfect service”
Reviews.Author: rotzek
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very large and offer all you need: kitchen, large bathroom, tables and couch and a very large bedroom. It is avery calm environment even though the main shopping street (Davie Street) is located directly in the back of the hotel. The staff is very friendly and helps wherever possible. We got an upgrade for free at our second stay and very valuable and helpful hints for sightsseing and getting around in Vancouver Downtown and the area. All rooms are very clean, only the fitness room sucks as this is only a small room with a threadmill and a few dumbbells. Would recommend this hotel highly and stay there definitely again when vistiting Vancouver Downtown. Location is very central and all amenities (shops, restaurants etc.) are in short walking distance. Breakfast is included for take away to the room but you have to come very early as it will not be refilled at later hours.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Shedave
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks in Canadian Rockies starting off in Vancouver where we stayed at Sunset Suites for 3 nights. Excellent service, Room and amenities, including well equipped kitchen, great. Based 1 block from Davie Street which has a multitude of bars, restaurants, snack bars, and other shops. Vibrant area. Stayed on high floor which gave a great view of the city. A little traffic noise but not enough to disturb us.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dovrat
Reviews.Content: Very convenient, close to false creek and Granville Iland and Market. The service was ok and the 1 bedroom suite was nice and comfi. good value.

Reviews.Title: “Needs new decor, good location”
Reviews.Author: zigzagMandurah
Reviews.Content: The best rooms are on the higher floors on the corners of the building, away from the lifts, but all of them need a decor make-over. We had 3 rooms in all, spacious, with a kitchen, fridge etc. clean, comfy bed, but a bit dark. The lower floors don't have any views. The plus's would be cheap laundry, breakfast, which was basic, but sufficient. Friendly helpful staff and good location, close to the city. There is a small gym for the keen keep fitter.We found Vancouver easy to navigate. Plenty of restaurants, cafe's, fast food places. Vancouver's biggest claim to fame seems to be that it's gay friendly. It also seems to have more than it's fair share of homeless, who seem to be harmless and of course sad to see. The six of us found plenty to occupy our 3 days, the hop on hop off buses were handy, as we didn't have a car. Best coffe at Artigianos, ask the staff where it is. I was heartily sick of the Starbucks type rubbish. Close enough to Whistler for a day trip, hire a car it's cheaper than the tour buses.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JayDogKiwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of a 6 week trip in the UK and Europe staying mostly in hotels. This had a clean comfortable spacious room, close to restaurants and shops and round the corner from stop for hop-on hop-off bus. Breakfast basic but okay, we enjoyed being able to take the food to our room after so many hotel breakfasts but some may not like that. Good to be able to use washing machine and drier. Staff were fantastic, they could not have been more helpful and nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff, good location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Traveler59
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent 3 nights at the Sunset Inn and very much enjoyed the stay. The staff were very approachable & friendly & offered good suggestions for dining in the neighbourhood, as well as useful information about getting around in the city. We were within easy walking distance of downtown, Stanley Park and the Crusi Ship Terminal. Our room/suite was clean, well-maintained, very quiet,and - being on the 9th floor - had na excellent view of the mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large suites”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaTraveller17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. When we arrived, our room wasn't ready. The helpful clerk ended up upgrading us to a larger suite for free. The suite was very clean and the kitchen is totally equipped with cooking utensils, pots, pans, microwave, oven, full fridge, etc. You can definitely save a few dollars by cooking your meals in your room. Our suite also had a K-cup single brewer (in addition to a regular coffee system), so bring your K-cups along with you. The bathroom in our room was very large with a double sink. Our unit had a rain shower head, which was a nice perk. The hotel is 2 blocks south of Davies Street, which has tons of restaurants and shops nearby. It is located in the trendy "Pride" district, FYI. We found the location to be very convenient for walking. It's only a few blocks to the Seabus terminal that takes you to Granville Island. Or you can hoof it like we did (it took 30 mins to walk). There was lots of parking, but the parking stalls are small. Our only complaint is that the room smelled faintly of curry the entire trip, and that the front lobby is small. The breakfast was also unappetizing, but this is easily solved by cooking a breakfast in your suite!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Paragon
Reviews.Content: What a find! Our suite was huge and very comfortable. Ideally located near to great restaurants, particularly the Greek Taverna round the corner and Vera's burgers on Davie St.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: pjbucks
Reviews.Content: Friendly welcome and staff could not have been more helpful. Excellent location (Davie Village) with easy access to Downtown, Granville Island, Stanley Park etc. Apartment very clean, fully serviced and spacious -we requested a room as high up as possible and got it - on the 11th floor with views toward the mountains. A selection of restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. Great value for a central city location

Reviews.Title: “Annual sister trip a huge success”
Reviews.Author: FanceeFree15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sunset Inn & Suites for 3 nights and found the hotel comfortable, great service, and perfect location. Walking distance to everywhere. The bed was comfy, though the sofa beds were less so. The kitchen is well stocked. The staff were wonderful, very attentive and accommodating. I would happily stay there again. What a great find!

Reviews.Title: “BEST OVERALL HOTEL VALUE IN DOWNTOWN VANCOUVER, CANADA”
Reviews.Author: moonfroth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent from March 23 to April 23 at this wonderful hotel, and we can't sing its praises long or loud enough. \we travel a lot. We're grumpy and fussy when a place fails to meet the mark, and the /sunset never disappointed us once. All the staff, from Manages to Maids, were consistently cheerful and helpful and more than willing to walk that rare extra mile to please us. Our one-bedroom suite was newly decorated, and so tastefully done that it felt like a personal.. apartment, not a hotel room. A 42 inch flatscreen TV in both bedroom and living room, DVD player in the l. room. The full kitchen had every utensil and gadget you would want, and if it did not--the staff will go get it for you! Small complaints: the continental breakfast is cereal, muffins, juice, and coffee. That's it. And the balconies are too small. But overall value. . .good grief! Because we stayed 30 days, we got our suite for $70/night, NO TAXES. Under 30 days, taxes apply, but the place is still a bargain at about $90 - $100. Oh!--and get this one--underground, locked and secure parking is FREE. Unheard of. Downtown hotels typically charge $14 - $20 a day. The location is amazing--half a block away are \\Korean, Mexican, Greek, Italian, Chinese, Indian etc., the list goes on and on. So, check out the website of this lovely hotel. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient location, & felt like home”
Reviews.Author: hallgay
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for the money because it has such comfortable rooms, a continental breakfast, laundry, good walking distance to Granville Park and local restaurants. We stayed 3 nights at this hotel and were given an upgrade from an executive studio suite to a one bedroom suite. The bed was very comfortable and the room had two flat screen TV's with a kitchenette, table/chairs, sofa, desk, etc. The hotel is located on a residential street not far from a main street with a number of quaint neighborhood restaurants. We were able to walk from the hotel to Granville Park area and take a small ferry to the park which also has restaurants and a farmers market. The hotel staff was very friendly and even loaned us an umbrella one day for the rain. We enjoyed our stay and found it was very relaxing. We would definitely return and you cannot beat the value. It's a real hidden gem in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay”
Reviews.Author: Jessace
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic! Clean, quiet and a gem in the West end. We stayed in the executive suite which has a king bed, dining area, kitchen and living room. This is a small apartment with all you need right there. Everything is close by to walk, beach, dining, etc. Just wont stay in a big hotel chain if I want to be in the West end. We took a short walk to nearby Sanifir for dinner and did not need to worry about having a few drinks becasue of the excellent location. And, private gated parking at no cost! I can not think of one bad thing to say aobut Sunset Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Wolfeman_jack
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the stay. Extremely friendly and helpful staff, make you feel like you are part of the family. Has a free small breakfast to get you going. The room was a studio suite with a bathroom, bedroom area, dining area and a small kitchen. There was a balcony. too. The room was clean and relatively quiet (some street noise). Well located in the West End, one block from Davie St, a few minutes walk to Georgia St, a few blocks from English Bay Beach. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Marathon, Friendly service, Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: koscube
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at the Sunset Inn and Suites during the last week of April, 2011. We were in town to participate in the Vancouver Marathon, and this was the perfect location for the race. We stayed in a suite on the 10th floor with a view of Sunset Beach and Vanier Park across False Creek. Our suite had a fully equipped kitchen (including pots, pans, dishes and utensils). There was a little dinette set seating four, a couch that was a pullout bed (fairly comfortable), a coffee table and TV/DVD player in the living room. The bedroom had a king sized bed which was comfortable, with plenty of closet space, a safe, and a flat screen TV as well. Awesome mountain and city views from the bedroom window. The windowless bathroom was small but adequate. The pluses: The guys (Elvis and this other guy whose name I forgot at the front desk were exceedingly helpful in assisting us with our plans for sightseeing, restaurant selection, directions etc. The location being close to the Davie Street gay village put is in close proximity to all the gay nightlife. Perfect for early morning runs along the beach. Having a full kitchen let us enjoy a few home cooked meals when the restaurants were getting tiresome. The continental breakfast served near the front desk was adequate (english muffins, cereal, juice, coffee, milk, fruit, bagels), but you have to bring your breakfast up to your room as there is no dining space in the lobby area. The tiny gym was equipped with some free weights, a treadmill and mats... minimalistic, but again, adequate for our needs. We could take umbrellas from the front desk for use on rainy days throughout our stay at no extra charge. The fax machine and computers were available for free use. Wifi in the hotel was also free and flawless. On race day, the starting point was a comfortable 2 km (less than 1.5 miles) away, which was a perfect warm up. The minuses: Not really much to complain about other than the housekeeping staff could tend to be a little noisy when they were in the area near the elevators (we could hear them through two sets of closed doors: the front door to the suite, and the closed bedroom door). Otherwise no complaints. I would highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Fishface67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - next to the bustle of Davie Street whilst being on a quiet road. Good value with breakfast and wifi included. Well appointed suites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful,Suite was spacious and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: jantheau
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded as the room we booked a year previously wasn't available due to remodeling. We were suprised by the size of our suite,with seperate bedroom,kitchen,bathroom,lounge,dining and plenty of cupboard space. Bed was very comfortable and shops are very close by.Staff was helpful and polite.Free Continental Breakfast was served in the lobby,which you could take to your rooms.Our stay was one of the best in our two month trip.Price was good against other hotels offering a lot less.Definately one worth staying at again.

Reviews.Title: “Economical and friendly”
Reviews.Author: yorick2
Reviews.Content: We had a small suite, but it was well designed, with a good bathroom, comfortable large bed, decor a little dated to our taste. The staff were very friendly. We found the basic kitchen facilities very useful, as we were staying ten days, and eating out every day is not cheap in Vancouver. Also economical was the good breakfast included which suited us perfectly - cereal, toast and coffee, with fruit and yogurt. Only downside was the outlook which was over the rear of the shops on Davie Street and these had an early morning garbage collection. The larger suites to the front of the Inn had a much nicer outlook. Altogether a very economical place to stay, with easy access to Downtown, Robson and Gastown. and by ferry (2 min) to Granville Market and beautiful walks by False Creek. For a long stay, it was much better than a hotel room. We were able to relax and enjoy the local cafes, feeling completely safe in the 'village' atmosphere of Davie. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location, excellent service-best value in vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: soolou
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the Sunset Inn and Suites, we were warmly welcomed by David and felt right at home. We loved our one bedroom suite, modern with a complete kitchen. It is located near Davies St with lots of shops, clubs and restaurants. The hotel is relatively small with about 50 to 60 rooms, so there is always an elevator available. All the staff was helpful and friendly. Adding to the room value was the free parking and continental breakfast. And I loved the little extras a smaller hotel gives you, such as free DVD rentals and the use of their umbrellas while you stay, something always appreciated in Vancouver. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The best deal in Vancouver, BC!”
Reviews.Author: SandraSue95
Reviews.Content: What a nice place to stay. The suites are like small apartments. There is plenty of room. We enjoyed having a living room, dining area and complete kitchen. The bed was very comfortable. The only drawback was the bathroom was a bit small. Not all suites are alike. We would definitely return to this Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing much to add really....”
Reviews.Author: NeilM31
Reviews.Content: Anything I say will just add to the glowing reviews already posted! First time in Vancouver, good place to stop, friendly staff (although someone on reception needs to improve his "English" accent!!), location is pretty good, easy to walk to ferry for Granville Island, and buses to go elsewhere in town. Was at the rear of the hotel had no problem with noise as reported elsewhere. YMMV with that one though. Recommended. Would definitely stay again. (Really want to go to Vancouver again!!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay & service”
Reviews.Author: crami007
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend staying here and it does make you feel at home. A plus is free wifi :D We stayed at the hotel on May 14-17 and we loved the service provided. It was our first time ever in Vancouver and the concierge gave us great recommendations of where to go. The location is in the middle of great attractions and we didn't even have to pay for a cab until our departure of the airport. :]

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Gavin1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sunset inn for 3 days middle of may with my wife an 2 kids ages 1 and 3. We found the room to be good size and the kitchen was great, the included breakfast was also good. We would defiantly stay here again if we come back to vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly, clean hotel located close to beach, shopping, museums, parks”
Reviews.Author: Patjane1712
Reviews.Content: There was nothing we did not like about this hotel. The staff were amazingly friendly and provided a neighbourly feel to the hotel. Location was excellent. It lay slightly outside the busier downtown core in a more residential neighbourhood, we could walk five minutes to the beach and the sea wall that runs around Vancouver, five minutes to grocery and drugstore, 15 minutes to the Art Gallery and downtown shopping, 25 minutes to Vancouver harbour and the ferry to North Vancouver and the bus to Grouse mountain. There were also innumerable local coffee shops and excellent small ethnic restaurants within a 10 minute walking radius, and a large public market with salmon, salmon, salmon a short walk and ferry ride away. Complimentary breakfast provided us with our energy for the day. Complimentary newspaper [Globe and Mail] got our brains working early!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Montreal-Matt
Reviews.Content: I looked for months to find a hotel that would fit my needs, and in the end the Sunset Inn was the PERFECT place. It is not in the usual cluster of hotels you will find down town, but it is 5 mins from everything you would need. 5 mins from English Bay, around the corner from plenty of shops and restaurants on Davie Street, even a 24 hr Denny’s right next door. There are plenty of transit options and also there is a stop for the Hop-On-Hop-Off tour right at the corner. The service at the hotel was above and beyond what I would expect. Michael at the Front desk always had great advice on things to do, places to see, and the best way to get there. The rooms are spacious and nicely renovated. What you see in the photos is what you get. The Kitchens were fully equipped and well stocked what everything you would need (minus the actual food). The beds were very comfortable and made coming home something to look forward to. Note that Sunset offers a continental breakfast. It is nothing luxurious but you get juices, cereal, bagels, coffee and fruit. It is enough to start your day. I really can’t say enough about this place, accept that when I am back in Vancouver.... and I will be back, This is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: hb2350
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 days and was very pleased with our accommodation. Had a one bedroom apartment which was well equipped, very spacious and comfortable. Staff were friendly, approachable, helpful and very happy to share their knowledge and enthusiasm for their city. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Sunset - but watch the noise”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaIslandMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sunset for 9 days. Fabulous location, easy walk to the ferry to Granville Island, Seawall walk , fairly easy walk to Stanley Park, downtown, whatever you need. Any kind of food you might want is within easy walk. The rooms are clean and well appointed. As previously reviewed, continental breakfast is sparse but reliable and you can easily supplement from local markets as you have a full kitchen. Staff is wonderful, friendly and helpful. The only complaint - unless you are there for the nightlife and are out until the late hours, if you have a room facing the back alley and therefore busy Davie St - you will be up until the wee hours hearing screaming and yelling until the bars close. And then in the early AM, dumpster crashing and delivery trucks as there are at least 4 restaurants in the immediate vicinity whose trash is all in the alley under your window! Bring your earplugs or be smart enough to ask for a room facing Burnaby St.. The noise factor disturbed each night's sleep, damaging what would have been the perfect holiday. We would say there again, but only in a room facing quiet Burnaby St.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Hard_Woman
Reviews.Content: Although this place could do with a bit of updating, it's an excellent base with friendly helpful staff. Fantastic location if you want to get out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and interesting location”
Reviews.Author: stanmcd
Reviews.Content: Visited Vancouver attending a conference Took my entire family including adult daughters. The hotel (a former apartment building) was quite nice, spacious suites, and located in an ecclectic, walking neighborhood of the city. Could use a bit more space for the continental breakfast area. Overall, a positive and interesting experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jac2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a couple of days. Was on the 10th floor in an executive one bedroom suite. The room had a kitchen which was very convenient including pots, pans, toaster, microwave, kettle and coffee maker. Had a flat screen with DVD player in the living room and another flat screen in the bedroom. The bathroom is a little small but clean. We had hot water all the time. The balcony was nice to go out and take a view of Vancouver. The parallel street (Davie Street) had so many dining options that we were blown away. The hotel has parking at the back. Breakfast was a little limited in options but sufficient for us. You have to fill your tray and take it back to your room. I suspect this maybe because of the lack of space. Hotel had free WiFi. Overall not a bad hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The best attention”
Reviews.Author: juliocgut
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the Sunset Inn. The room we got was impressive -- a big studio with two big beds, a full kitchen/living room and even a balcony. But the greatest thing about this hotel was not the room, but the people. Everyone made all in their hands, and more, to provide us with help with anything, and not only with hotel-related stuff. From here a BIG thank you to all the staff! They genuinely care and try to make your stay in Vancouver a pleasant one, be it with local advice, help with trouble you might have or just making things easy in general. I would definitely come back here nd recommend it to everyone staying in Vancouver. On the down side, I felt the room was not very well isolated, both noise and cold-wise. We were on the 8th floor and yet could hear every noise at the street, but I would say that should be a minor thing.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mtthumphrey
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a couple of times and are always surprised by how friendly and helpful the staff are for a very well priced hotel. The rooms are basic and tidy, not super modern but comfy. Location is great if you want to experience a bit of local Vancouver culture. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: crzcrzy
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights the start of our family vacation. The Inn was able to accomodate a last minute request to add a night to our stay as we arrived one night earlier than planned. The accomodations are decent size with living area, separate bedroom with king bed, and small kitchen with required amenties to cook your own meals if desired. If the weather had been a little better, the balcony would have been much better enjoyed and considered a good perk. The bed was comfortable, lots of pillows as was the sofa bed for the kids. The location is great, waking distance to many shops, restaurants, and grocery stores to fill your cupboards. Short walk (approx 10-15 min) to the water to catch a water taxi to Granville island among other destinations. Water taxi ran every 5 mins and cost $18 round trip for our family of four. Not that we used the exercise room, nor did we see anyone else use it, but it is small. The continental breakfast was adequate and typical of most. My only minor complaint is the front door of our suite did not block much noise from the hall. Free parking and free internet were a bonus. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We will definitely be back. If you are travelling with kids, the Vancouver Olympic Centre pool is a must!

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: Americanuckchuck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 nights at this hotel. It's a clean, quiet hotel with kitchenettes, actually more like a full kitchen with pots and pans, oven, stove, toaster, coffee maker, micro, full fridge and freezer, table and chairs, counterspace. They thought of everything you need pretty much to cook in the space. The hotel is located in the heart of Davie Street "village" with great restaurants and walking distance from just about everything in downtown Vancouver. Every single person on staff, without exception, was extremely friendly and helpful with city info, restaurant recommendations etc. They even have umbrellas you can borrow if it's raining. They provide a really nice continental breakfast with lots of fresh fruit, coffee, bagels, croissants, etc. The beds were extremely comfortable. We will definitely stay here again when we come back to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sushar
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Sunset Inn and Suites and this is definitely the best place to stay in downtown Vancouver. I shopped around before booking this place this time around to see if I could find a better hotel, but didn't find anything remotely close to the Sunset Inn & Suites for the true value for money. Location, rooms, service & amenities are all great. This time we stayed in a Executive One Bedroom Suite and it had a lot of room with comfortable beds and a well-stocked kitchen. The front-desk staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was sufficient. Some of the major pluses of this hotel are the free wireless internet in the rooms and the free parking. Will highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for accommodations in downtown Vancouver. The only 2 nit-picky things I would call out are that 1) The parking garage entry/ exits are a little too narrow for bigger cars (SUVs and mini-vans) and 2) They should consider moving the breakfast area to the front of the hotel where there is more space so that people can sit and eat there. This may also lead to an increase in breakfast selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, amazing location, amazing beds !”
Reviews.Author: SylvieCrete
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for only one night on our way back from a week of skiing at Whistler. This is a great hotel very close to everything but at the same time on a very nice tree-lined street in a quieter area. One bedroom suite is very spacious, bedding is ultra comfortable and the kitchen is well-equiped. Our unit even had a balcony (I think they all do). Breakfast is basic (bread, croissants, cereals, juice, fruits & coffee) but everything is good and fresh and best of all, you're allowed to bring your breakfast up to your suite to eat in peace. The staff is great and very helpfull, some of them even tried to speak French to us, nice touch. Free parking at the back is a plus as well. Really, I've stayed at many fancy YVR hotels on business (Shangri-La, Opus, Wall Center) but this hotel is one of a kind, unpretentious and priced right. Don't hesitate. I'm going back for sure, hopefully next time for a longer stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: Bon_11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a long weekend and couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. Rooms are very spacious and clean, staff was very friendly and helpful. It's in a great neighborhood, close to the water and downtown shopping. Will definitely be staying there again on the next visit to Vancouver and also recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel with a great location and awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: slojudes
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 days at the Sunset Inn and Suites for business in the area. The room was very large and extremely comfortable, like an apartment - not luxurious, but very comfortable and nice with a great bed, a separate living area and a full kitchen, fully stocked with everything I could ever need during my stay. The staff was outstanding, always helpful and friendly, accommodating whatever need came up for me. I loved the city (my 2nd trip there). The excellent location of the hotel made it very easy to meander down the main part of Yaletown, which is a wonderful part of Vancouver. I never had a bad meal anywhere, and was able to become quite familiar with the public transportation systems.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone. Great place, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: miketash
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in one of the cheapest standard suite with two double beds. It was a well presented room with modern decor and finishings. The double beds were a little small but we just took one each (for the little time we were there it was no issue). One street back from all the action on Davies street, you can pretty much walk anywhere in Downtown vancouver within 20 minutes. The central location was great. The staff also were friendly. A big thanks to Dave for being so helpful and kind. Even though it was the cheapest room it was well worth more than what we paid. If ever i am in the area again this is the first place I will enquire to book. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: wbod
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at the Sunset Suites on my way to Whistler. I was so impressed. They upgraded me and I had a one bedroom apartment. It was clean, spacious, and very comfortable. The location is great - it has free secure parking, a free mini buffet in the A.M. and staff that go out of their way to be helpful. What a deal. It will definitely be my go to place in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great staff and really nice room!”
Reviews.Author: Ny2memphis
Reviews.Content: Our room was exactly what had been pictured on their website, it was large (we had the studio), it was clean, etc. The staff was amazing helping us navigate around town, making suggestions on what to do and how to get there. It was a great vacation! I would definitely stay at this establishment again! Next time I would ask for a higher floor (we were on the 5th)...the 7th or higher would provide a slightly better view.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice rooms, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: nathancar
Reviews.Content: Staff was amazingly helpful, located in a nice quiet part of downtown Vancouver, away from the hustle and bustle. Rooms were very clean, great size with a kitchenette, with nice bedding, and they had a small continental breakfast in the morning, which is unusual for most hotels I've stayed in Vancouver. Great price as well. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the best place to stay in Vancover”
Reviews.Author: gsppgi
Reviews.Content: veru nice and helpful staff. great quality breakfast great rooms and services well maintained

Reviews.Title: “great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lbrd
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here -- great rooms with a full sitting room and kitchen and 11th floor views to both the north and south and to the west from the balcony. Easy walk and aqua taxi to the Granville market for fresh Pacific NW food items to cook up in the kitchen -- great location and price (and free parking and internet). Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful holiday.”
Reviews.Author: traveller5827
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home after spending a very enjoyable 10 days in the Sunset Inn and Suites. I have nothing but praise for the hotel and its staff..nothing was any trouble for them! The location was great..close to the sea wall. restaurants, shops, places of interest. I stayed in one of the standard suites with my teenage daughter. We had loads of space ..comfortable beds,sitting area,dining area and a well equipped kitchenette...everywhere spotless! It was great to have the breakfast in the lobby every morning..delicious coffee, juice, breads, bagels, croissants! I would definitely stay in this hotel on any return visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic jewel in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: AnneMarie042
Reviews.Content: This location is perfect, the hotel is quaint and wonderful, room sizes are phenomenal,staff are friendly and very helpful. Incredible

Reviews.Title: “Great attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Robbie420
Reviews.Content: Friendly & helpful staff. Clean rooms, hallways & lobby. Pleasant colors throughout. Furniture is reasonable quality and the bed was comfortable. Free secured underground parking. Central location. All rooms have kitchen units with cutlery etc. Wholesome continental breakfast & free WiFi. I’ve stayed in many hotels over the years. In my experience, this represents the best value ever.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: aplett
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay while our son was in the ST Pauls Hospital , for surgery.It is a great location with everything we needed as far as restaurants ,groceries, pharmacy's ,as well as anything else you can think of.The staff was the the best we have encounterd in all our stays over the past 10yrs all over the area.They were friendly, helpfull,kind and sinsere. This is a very clean, comfortable,afforodable home away from home.We will be back! Thank you Sunset Inn for the great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful older "suites" hotel”
Reviews.Author: paoseattle
Reviews.Content: From the moment the desk clerk at check in took a look at my partner's "Tabasco" baseball cap and claimed that chipotle Tabasco had changed his life, we knew that this hotel was going to be pleasantly different. They upgraded us to an executive suite for free and we were glad they did. There's a full kitchen (stove, microwave, medium sized fridge, sink, pots/pans utensils), a comfy sofa and easy chair, dining table, two TV's, balcony with view over the Fraser, nice fluffy bathrobes, etc. This is an older building--may be converted from apartments, so don't expect anything trendy. But the suite we had is nicely appointed and very, very comfortable, the staff is warm, friendly, and helpful. Close to Yale Town. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, convenient and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: lewanWhistler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on our way to whistler in December. Very friendly, helpful staff. Large, comfortable rooms and beds with plenty of kitchen equipment. Reasonable breakfast which can be taken up to your room and a morning newspaper delivered daily. In a great location to see the sights and for shopping. Quiet residential area. We would recommend this to anyone and everyone, the suites are large and spacious so can easily house a family

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: linda58350
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of the location. When I arrived was greated by Dave who was extremely helpful and friendly. I was so surprised and happy with how clean & nice our suite was. This hotel was walking distance to restaurants and sights so never had to drive. This was a wonderful experience and would definitely stay here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, people... we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Dana_V
Reviews.Content: We needed to be at St Paul's hospital so we added a week before that and an extra week after. Thats 3 weeks and it was comfortable enough to stay much longer. The building was originally built in the 1970s as an apartment. The hotel has the feel of the size of a boutique hotel, the friendliness of a B&B between the staff and other guests, and the privacy of an apartment. The location couldn't be better - we walked everywhere. We cooked 1/2 our meals in the room quite comfortably. The breakfast was continental with the coffee being great. We did however buy our own fresh squeezed OJ. The big thing though was that they went the extra distance: free parking (every other hotel charges $15- 25/n), free loaner umbrellas, DVD in the room and a selection of loaner DVDs at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, personal service boutique hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: AlisonBosnia
Reviews.Content: Sunset Inn and Suites is just far enough removed from the tourist core of Vancouver to guarantee a peaceful night's sleep and a lovely residential neighbourhood where walking anywhere is safe and fun either day or night. A great staff, nice self-catering suites with full kitchens to save on meals if you wish, but close enough to some great eateries to lure guests out to sample Vancouver's best. Free parking (a rarity in Vancouver) and a predictable but free continental breakfast in the lobby which guests are encouraged to take up to their suites on trays to eat in their own dining facilities. A win/win in a fairly expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “WOW Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: DocBC
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was fantastic, very polite staff, and not just polite because they get paid to be polite, but because are just nice decent people. The service was also really great, house keeping was very good in their cleaning, everything was always sparkling clean and bed well made.. The room was like a small apartment more than a Hotel. And there is free laundry soap available, and the price for laundry was reasonable as well. The location is in a good neighborhood, everything close by. And buses not far away either.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, well-managed, affordable, convenient apt-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbarc
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Sunset Inn, mostly on business but occasionally on personal trips, for roughly 15 years. I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Vancouver. I travel on a moderate budget, and it provides great value. Having a fully equiped kitchen in suite lets me do breakfast in the room, and occasionally dinner. Others can cook a full meal for family. First thing I do when I arrive is hit the local supermarket for yoghurt and cereal for bkfst. The rooms are great (you either look north to the mountains or south to the sea), spacious (at least by Vancouver standards), clean, well-decorated, quiet, with fancy TVs free web-access and the techno-like. I have found since day one that the staff are always friendly and helpful and come with a sense of humour rather than stern formality. The hotel is a block away from Davie Street, which has restaurants ranging from wrap take-outs to fine dining (check out Stephos' Greek restaurant if you don't mind waiting in line; it is excellent). A supermarket and large drug store are within a block of the hotel. The bars are mostly gay, so if you are homophobic, you are in the wrong 'hood. That said, the Fountainhead is a very comfortable mixed pub in which you can have a pint and watch sports. And alternatives are within 2-3 blocks. Davie Street is, to me, far more eclectic than Robson Street. The Sunset Inn is a hidden oasis for someone like myself. If you really want to max out your credit card on something fancier, there are lots of alternatives in Vancouver. This place is a home away from home for me. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly situated to St Paul`s - had everything we needed!”
Reviews.Author: willardlilo
Reviews.Content: We booked an executive suite for our five night stay in Vancouver while our parent had surgery at St Paul`s Hospital. This hotel was perfectly situated for our needs, staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, free parking for one vehicle was also a very nice feature as was the continental breakfast and free Van Houtte coffee 24 hours! Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend to family and friends

Reviews.Title: “Space, quiet, and location at a great rate.”
Reviews.Author: Chapul
Reviews.Content: The Sunset Inn lives up to the reputation for value for money. This is a full-sized one bedroom apartment, with a full kitchen, parking (in Vancouver's parking-scarce Westend, that is a big plus), and free internet. Oh yes - there is a complimentary continental breakfast included. The location is ideal - a quiet street steps away from lots of restaurants and other services, and a quick walk to the Aquatic Centre and Sunset Beach. There really is no lobby to speak of. There is a desk and that's it, but the staff is helpful and knowledgeable. My one observation is that the room smelled faintly of someone else's cooking when I got there, and the housekeeping (at least in this room, and on this occasion) was superficial. The furniture is comfortable, but there were a few signs of wear on the couch. At this rate, in this location, for this space I am not going to complain to loudly.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noxida
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay with family of five. Easy location for down town Vancouver. Very comfortable king sized bed. But best of all the staff could not have been more helpful. Good value for money. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: brossmac
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! It was in a great location, within very easy walking distance of at least 25 restaurants, many of which I sampled. The free parking and wi-fi were big influences on my decision to stay there and I have to say that both were terrific conveniences. The executive suite was sizable, clean, comfortable and well maintained. There was plenty of space and many amenities. (Having a DVD player was nice for a relaxing evening in. They even have a small library of movies you can borrow!) I didn't bring an umbrella, but that was no problem as they have plenty that you can borrow for your stay. The staff were incredibly helpful, friendly and smart--from the cleaning staff to the front desk. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Lu_and_Pete
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at Sunset Inn and Suites. We loved the hotel and the city and it has been the highlight of our trip around the USA/Canda so far. We were lucky enough to have our room upgraded to a suite, which was huge! It included a fully stocked kitchenette and bed in our room was one of the most cosy and comfortable I have ever slept in. We arrived in Vancouver on Amtrak around midday and were thrilled that our room was ready and we were able to check in early. We did hear a little bit of noise (e.g. sirens) at night-time, but realise this is beyond the control of the hotel due to it's location, and it was nothing that affected our sleep in any way. The staff we dealt with were incredibly helpful, including recommendations for restaurants, booking taxis and advice on tipping (which is unfamiliar to us as Australians). The location of the hotel in the west-end is fantastic and although the city has a good public transport system, we walked everywhere (e.g. to Stanley Park and the Sea Bus terminal) A very highly recommended property and we hope to return some day and enjoy a longer stay in lovely Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Large Executive Suite was perfectly spacious for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: Bamak0
Reviews.Content: We found most things outstanding about Sunset Inn and Suites, where we spent five nights over Christmas. I have a few suggestions that would have made it perfect, however: 1. Offer a better quality of pillows; a range of much comfier options is needed. 2. Replace those terribly uncomfortable sofa beds with better quality, truly comfy ones that adults could sleep on. These were ridiculously uncomfortable! 3. Supply the kitchenettes with basics like salt and pepper shakers. Bottled water would be nice. Refill the coffee and tea used, daily. 4. Ensure that front desk staff are all smiling, friendly, welcoming and helpful. The number of aloof, surly, just-shy-of-rude people (esp. men) at the front desk was off-putting. Shame on them, that's no way to make your guests feel appreciated for their custom. The best things: a spacious and pleasant living room, nice view, great location, occasional treats at the lobby, the excellent cleaning staff who went out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great find at a great price”
Reviews.Author: TravelFunSeattle
Reviews.Content: Location is terrific, you can walk to the beach or downtown. Easy access to Stanley Park, Granville Island, and points south towards UBC, etc. We loved having an entire apartment with a full kitchen. This saves a lot of time, money and hassle vs. eating out every meal. It's also nice to have a separate living room, just so comfortable. Staff was extra friendly and helpful. They recommended an excellent neighborhood restaurant not otherwise on the radar. Free parking is a welcome perk in pricey Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Paid Premium Price; expected ocean/bay view; no water view, only buildings!”
Reviews.Author: alexander5431
Reviews.Content: Great staff (always very helpful); excellent location; no real lobby or restaurant in this hotel. They advertise ocean view when staying in a large executive suite, but we did not see the ocean or the bay! First trip for my mother and son. Came for a wedding and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, Service”
Reviews.Author: shoppinghelen
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay with family. All delightful little restaraunt is a block away. Hop on the bus to waterfront station, walked down to water front park, 5 min drive to stanley park. the room is clean, the front desk personnel are very friendly & helpful. We are very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: lcook72
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room, breakfast was just right. Staff wonderful - will definitely recommend this hotel to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, great family value”
Reviews.Author: Guildenstern
Reviews.Content: Good location, huge rooms (big plus with a family), free gated parking which was nice (if a bit awkward to get into), full kitchen, clean, functional. Good place to stay. Will likely come back on business trips -- especially when it's on my nickel as a business owner -- as well as future family vacations. The one downside is that there is sound leakage from adjoining guest rooms -- not terrible, but it's there.

Reviews.Title: “Roughrider Fans would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: letmecount123
Reviews.Content: I feel bad that I didn't leave a review sooner, because we really did enjoy our stay!! Chalk it up to my own love of procrastination, not the hotel because it was really very good! My only complaint about this location was how LOUD the neighbourhood was. Definitely used my earplugs. It was Halloween weekend + a football game but there were constant sirens and screaming and fights outside in the area.
