We were originally in a room on the 4th floor, but after the first night we realized that one of the windows in the main area wouldn't close and that was one of the reasons we could hear EVERYTHING. This was mentioned to the front desk and they immediately offered to upgrade us to a similar room on a higher floor. The gesture was definitely appreciated and they even moved our luggage up for us while we were out touring Granville Island. Front desk staff were great! We were dressed up in ridiculous Roughrider garb for the whole weekend and the jeering and jokes were awesome. Very helpful in recommending places to eat and arranging taxis. They seemed pleased to have the "Roughrider Cheerleaders" staying with them (not really....but I'm sure it was a bit of a draw to have a crew of watermelon slices parading around on game day). Good location apart from the noise in the area... liquor store about 2 blocks away and lots of little restaurants as well as a grocery store. We didn't really use the kitchen as we were only there for a weekend but it was nice to have it regardless. We were able to keep a few things handy for breakfast (even with the continental downstairs we often have to deal with a food allergy and bring a few things along), keep our beverages cooled in the fridge, and had a microwave for popcorn! The value seemed great for what you got. Would definitely be great for a longer stay with the kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: CKleung
Reviews.Content: It was the first time we tried this hotel during the Xmas week. Great downtown location next to many eateries along Davie and walking distance to Robson and adjacent areas. Free parking and breakfast make the deal even better. The room is spacious and the full kitchen is ideal for families. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely come back again when we get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great suites, friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: patlnichols
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Sunset Inn twice now & plan to return. Feels like "home" now. Single female traveller. Front desk guy, Dave, is wonderful - remembers me, very helpful & kind. Very fair prices for Vancouver. It is great to have a suite with full kitchen & dining room style table & chairs. The continental breakfast is simple (cereal, toast, bagels, croissants, apples, oranges & juice, coffee, tea) but that helps. The rooms have been upgraded & decorated in "warm" colours which I like. One block away on Davie there are scads of restaurants: Thai, Indian, Greek, Sushi, plus Shoppers Drug Mart and a great fresh vegetable market which is gorgeous. The beach and its pathway is 2 blocks away. Stanley Park is quite close on that pathway if you like to walk. I use Canada Line train / Yaletown stop is 15 minute walk from Sunset Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: janiray570
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. Great location right downtown, secured parking included, niceley decorated suite which was spotless with our own equipped kitchenette, continental breakfast and a newspaper in the morning, and very pleasant, efficient staff to look after us. Everything we needed for a comfortable stay. We will definitely stay here again, and I brought home some of their flyers to pass out to my friends so that they can stay here too. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service, friendly staff, very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: SusieC_Toronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Sunset Inn. We were on the top floor in an "executive suite" which was clean and had everything we needed, and more. It was a short walk to lots of restaurants and to the ferry to Granville Island. The price was amazing and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: StaceyW70
Reviews.Content: On Arrival the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, rooms where very clean and spacious with everyting you could need from a short stay to a month with very comfortable beds, Kitchen and dining room, plasma TV, desk and free wireless internet what more could you need, plus free parking and continental breakfast. Close to good resteraunts that the staff recomended and all attrations in Vancouver, did a great bus tour that was also recomended and booked by the hotel staff, would stay here again on future trips to Vancouver BC.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vancouver BC”
Reviews.Author: cassieO68
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and spacious, great views, parking on site, staff couldn't do enough to make our stay one to remember, thank you Elvis!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Excellent Staff !! Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: georgie_eliza
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed here for 2 nights in November & shared an Executive Twin Double Room, the beds were comfy, the room was clean & had everything we needed. The complimentary breakfast was decent. The only negative I could find was the daggy wallpaper... but the fully fitted kitchen and new bathroom made up for that. If you are looking to stay in style in Vancouver and not spend an arm and a leg.. this is the spot!! The staff are VERY poliet & helpful. I would definately stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great value.”
Reviews.Author: northam
Reviews.Content: This is a small, very comfortable hotel, clean and well appointed. I have stayed in hotels that cost much more that were not as good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: klynnr
Reviews.Content: Easy walk to many shops and restaurants. Balcony would be nice to use if the weather was good. We were there for one of the few times there is snow in Vancouver. The staff are very nice and easy to deal with. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Early Bird - Advance Purchase cannot be beat”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie1953
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our third stay at Sunset Inn & Suites and experienced our second complimentary room upgrade. So we've experienced three different configurations and could not be happier. Reserving and pre-paying online at their website a couple of months in advance gets you an unbelievable price for a hotel in the heart of Vancouver (especially one with parking and continental breakfast included). The kitchen is beautiful and well kitted out, although the array of restaurants in the area are very tempting. Transylvanian desserts, anyone? My husband wondered why we book a hotel in the heart of downtown Vancouver when family and the events we are there to attend are in Richmond and Delta. Having spent many years booking Richmond hotels, I haven't found anything nearly as nice for the price and the location gives me the flexibility to bird-watch in Stanley Park, catch a mini-ferry to Granville Island, or visit the Vancouver Art Gallery.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could need”
Reviews.Author: Klunk2213
Reviews.Content: I had a grand total of four days in Vancouver and stayed in the Sunset Inn - a definite upgrade on the HI Youth Hostel opposite where I had stayed 12 years earlier. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. I had booked a studio but was upgraded upon my arrival to a fabulous suite. It makes so much difference having a sitting room area and not watching TV sitting on one's bed. The kitchen area was perfect in helping me keep costs down by eating in one night. Everything was clean and very spacious. The location is perfect too. Whether heading down to Stanley Park for a walk, a trip across False Creek to Granville Island or even just heading Downtown. Just a word of caution as a British traveller, when booking just remember the figure you see is not the final one as they add tax on top. Going directly to the hotel also gives greater flexibility on what deals they can offer.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: irisheyesVictoria
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Sunset Inn and Suites where every room is a suite. Although there was everything we could have needed just outside our door on Davie Street (Vancouver's lively West End), the full kitchenette inspired me to shop and cook. So cozy to come home and feel 100% comfortable -- just like at home. Staff were very accommodating with special requests for additional parking and maps/advice about the neighbourhood. Price was very reasonable for what you get. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Our New "Go To" Place in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: mqrussell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were lucky enough to find the Sunset Inn when we stayed in Vancouver for a few nights in September. We could walk everywhere; and the desk staff were extremely helpful whenever we had questions. i.e.: where to rent bicycles, buy groceries, or whatever! We always look for hotels with kitchen facilities when we travel, and our room at the Sunset Inn had one of the best set ups we have ever seen - hands down! Beautifully appointed, immaculately clean. We can't wait to find another "excuse" to visit Vancouver again. We'll definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: regularfolks
Reviews.Content: Best rooms are on the 7th floor and up, VERY clean on ALL 5 of our visits. Excellent location. you won't need a car. Kitchens included, Kind professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, the next best thing to being "at home"”
Reviews.Author: squiffy11
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel having sold our home and in transit to our new one for a period of two weeks. The accommodation, service, location, personalized attention and the daily complimentary continental breakfast were awesome! We also appreciated the full kitchen which lacked for nothing and the proximity to grocery stores, banking, restaurants and other services one needs while "homeless" were very much appreciated. Congratulations to Michael Wright (GM) and his team! with heartfelt thanks for making an otherwise stressfull situation seamless! John & Linda

Reviews.Title: “Super value & location - but let's keep it secret!”
Reviews.Author: Lesley_ey
Reviews.Content: My only fear is that too many people will find out about this place and the rates will go up. I'm not sure what kind of room we would have had if we hadn't been upgraded, but for $99 + tax, we basically got a full apartment with a separate living room, kitchen, etc., plus the Holy Grail of Vancouver hotel amenities: free parking in a secure location on site. There were a few reasons why the deal didn't seem too good to be true: It's not the place to stay if you're looking for aesthetics or a breakfast that consists of much more than toast and cereal and our view was of the parking lots and dumpsters in the alley. But everything was clean and comfortable and I can't think of a better location. You're perfectly positioned for jumping off to any other part of the city. There was some merry-making in the streets of Davie Village, but we have a soothing-sounds machine and weren't disturbed at all. I liked being so close to tons of stores, restaurants, etc., but having the hotel itself on a quieter, more residential street. All our interactions with staff were pleasant, although one desk person, when asked to help us find the address of a restaurant, claimed it didn't exist. That was OK because the hotel offers free wi-fi so we just Googled it ourselves and found it with no problem. This was a comfortable, convenient, well-equipped haven just a stone's throw from tons of interesting things to look at and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate Apartments with Hospitable Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Elgar
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Vancouver since the 1950's and stayed in many apartments and hotels. I decided to have a change from my regular hotel and booked 10 nights at the Sunset Inn, I was not disappointed. I stayed in apartment #601, a corner suite with the lounge facing Burnaby Street. It would be in the readers interest to book an apartment from the sixth floor upwards if you want some elavation over the surrounding neighbourhood. The easy access to the shops and frequent bus route makes staying here very convenient. The rear of the property looks over a service road for the Burnaby Street and Davie Street buildings so there is some nominal noise from deliveries. I therefore suggest you ask for a suite/studio which has a front view towards False Creek and Granville Island. My bedroom faced the rear. I was not not disturbed by any excessive noise. My apartment was of a very high quality. Everything is there for guests in the kitchen/bathroom/ lounge and bedrooms. I found the queen size bed very comfortable. The house keeping staff are often left out of reviews, I found their standard of work exceptional. The harmonious decor is really pleasing with pastel colours, some thought has been applied to the apartments. The staff are a credit to the Sunset Inn, nothing is too much trouble, they have a good knowledge of Vancouver and ready to assist at any time. I did have the opportunity to engage in conversation with 'Elvis', yes that is his name and 'Dave'. Both very charming and hospitable. In fact all the staff I encountered were most polite. I also feel that I enjoyed 'value' for money. I did not use their 'complimentary' continental breakfast available for guests or their secure parking. I visit Vancouver annually and will not hesitate in returning to this exceptional accommodation. Well done Sunset Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Janetmacleod
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by chance as they were offering a great price on Expedia. I have to say we were extremely satisfied and would return in the future. We ended up with one of their larger suites on the front of the building, very spacious, large living room, well equipped kitchen, updated bathroom and good sized bedroom. The location is ideal, walking distance to English Bay, Stanley Park and the shopping districts on Robson. This is not a glitzy spot or typical of your high end hotels, but if you are looking for value for money, friendly and very helpful staff and the fact that you are able to leave feeling extremly satisfied with your choice of hotel then this is fore you.

Reviews.Title: “Best value and location”
Reviews.Author: rbrsfn
Reviews.Content: If you go to Vancouver as a tourist or for business this is an ideal choice if you want a personable small hotel with very good staff. the location is a residential neighborhood next to a thriving commercial street. Walkability is amazing. Ferry close by to various destinations. We rented a car for part of the stay to see Whistler area, etc. and the parking was free. The rooms are designed well and have great cross ventilation. There is a kitchen for those who do not want to eat out every meal. The continental breakfast is just fine. The staff was amazing with suggestions for lots of things and for their knowledge of the area. You cannot beat the value for the price. Remember, you get more than you pay for at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Service patchy but stay delightful overall”
Reviews.Author: melbourneasha
Reviews.Content: Bad: the bathrooms need to be cleaned more, mine smelled of stale soap and shampoo after 6 nights. I was hung up on and personally abused by 2 desk staff for asking if someone could help shw me how to turn on the shower... but one of them apaologised later and the rest of the staff were great. The breakfast is patchy. Good: Excellent quality rooms, kitchen and bathrooms, excellent location, very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Top Choice”
Reviews.Author: eileenmccloskey
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful surprise to have found this hotel. The decor and the modern suite upkeep was obvious. A perfect location in Vancouver -convenient to everything yet a quiet residential location. The staff will go out of their way to accomodate any wish and the continental breakfast was perfect. Would recommend requesting a higher floor facing the streeet.Have slept on other sofa beds before and found this one the best. Can't go wrong with this hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location near gay village, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: garhuff
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious (executive suite), nice/basic decor, full kitchen. We could walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “No Desire To Stay Anywhere Else In Vancouver - It's Sunset Inn For Me Everytime I Visit”
Reviews.Author: Mitchell6591
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here multiple times and have never been disappointed with anything. The excellent location means most everything is within walking distance. I give all of the following a top-notch rating: pleasant and competent staff; FREE secured gated parking; suites are well appointed and very comfortable including the bed and bed linens, towels and kitchen; FREE internet; even the elevators are quick with never a long wait at all. The hotel offers an extra good rate if room is booked and paid well in advance. A nice feature is to be able to print airline boarding passes at the front desk. Unit balconies are great too. While the interior of all rooms is equally presentable throughout the building, it's perhaps best to get a south facing room on the front of the building for better view and sunshine, but I believe they are more expensive, while the north facing rooms have some alley noise with garbage trucks and delivery trucks, but they are cheaper. One thing that I think is worth mentioning is that having stayed here over a period of quite a few years, I have observed that the front desk staff has not changed much, which in my opinion, is a fairly strong indication that the hotel is a good place for them to work and they are likely happy there. It's always nice to see familiar faces there and their genuinely friendly helpful manner indicates that management considers those qualities to be important and hires accordingly. I believe all of this speaks well for any establishment and is certainly the case with Sunset Inn. Cheers to Michael Wright and his staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Vicdb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sunset Inn for 5 days on vacation and it was great. Perfect location just behind the bars & restaurants of Davie St with the number 6 bus heading downtown regularly and within walking distance to Stanley Park and the beaches. Great complimentary breakfasts in the lobby to take back to your room (with a fully functioning kitchen) plus free wi-fi. Our room faced south with a small balcony and so was lovely and warm during the cool fall days. Fantastic value for 2 travelling friends as one has the pull-out bed and one the bedroom. Very helpful and friendly staff. Highly recommended, would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel handy to City”
Reviews.Author: GillyB57
Reviews.Content: The free parking offered to us together with the very reasonable rates we obtained from this hotel and the good write ups from other members on Trip Advisor made this our first choice. We travel with friends and like to make our own drinks and picnic lunches so having a kitchen included was great. The hotel upgraded us so that we could be on the same floor together as we were scheduled to be on different levels. The friendly hotel staff were extremely pleasant and helpful when we had a problem contacting our "help line" by telephone and let us use their computer to send e-mails. Parking for large vehicles is difficult but can be done with help/care and street parking is also available.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location excellent, rooms comfortable”
Reviews.Author: andic18
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have found a better place to stay - breakfasts not brilliant, but overall we really enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: nolasirois
Reviews.Content: We stayed twelve days in Sept.; as we were getting our daughter setup to attend University of British Columbia this year. We toured a lot of properties both online and personally since we will need to make this stay several times over the next four years. We travel a lot and are normally the four star large resort type people. The conclusion was the Sunset Inn and Suites will be our home away from home. The suite was spacious by most standards and especially when compared to other properties in Vancouver. The location was great easy access to the bridges, downtown with plenty of dining options, casino nearby, closet to UBC (that we would want to stay at). The property was within walking distance to the beach, Robson Street, shopping, Gaslight district, and china town. It was quite and faced a nice residential area. The staff was warm, personal, and attentive to all our needs. The parking was secure and “FREE”, as well as “FREE” internet. The continental breakfast was sparse but adequate. If views are important to you I would suggest asking for a view to the front of the building, the rear views are not very desirable in my opinion however those suites were a little larger. The bathrooms are very small but have nice granite countertops; there is plenty of closet space one in the bedroom and one in the hall. Very comfortable beds would have like to purchase the duvet but was told it was custom make for their property. The hallways are small and tattered, but one can overlook that since over all it’s a well appointed suite, a quaint boutique property. The value is exceptional; we won’t hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated & very comfortable suite with the friendliest staff.”
Reviews.Author: grandmascanada
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter booked a standard one bedroom suite for our 2 day stay in Vancouver. We need accommodation that allows us to sleep in seperate rooms, but still be together. Usually this makes our options very limited, but in this case we were very pleased with the results. From check in to departure all of the staff we encountered were very friendly and cheerful, a big plus in any hotel. Our suite was on the lowest accommodation floor directly over the parking lot so we didn't have a great view but that didn't matter to us. Previous reviews have mentioned that the noise from the back alley is bad, however we didn't find it to be a problem at all. We were there during the week and found that that is was pretty quiet most of the time. Our suite was great, very comfortable queen bed in the bedroom, the sofa bed in the living room was fine for one person (although might not have held up for two.) The full kitchen is small but well appointed and has everything you need. Previous reviews have also mention the small size of the bathrooms- but we weren't planning on ballroom dancing in there so we found it to be fine for our needs. Nice big mirror, granite countertop and big fluffy towels, all very clean as was the entire apartment. The lounge/dining area had plenty of space and we had a nice balcony too although the weather wasn't great so we didn't use it. Tons of closet space too. We made use of the washer and dryer downstairs which was a great plus, and the complimentary parking is a fantastic bonus- we appreciated being able to leave our car for a couple of hours after check out so we could go for brunch at nearby Twisted Fork- highly recommended. The only negative was that the main door to the apartment has a gap of about half an inch under it. Great for pushing a complimentary paper under, but also lets in all the noise of the people coming and going all night long in the next apartment. The second night we rolled up a spare blanket to use as a muffler under the door, and that seemed to block the noise. Our TV was also switched over during our stay and the new TV, although bigger, didn't have as good a picture as the first, and also had weird sound- it was either muffled or tinny and seemed to be missing the middle range. We mentioned it on check out, so hopefully that has been sorted out. Had a great stay and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: marionp
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at this hotel. We found it to be excellent value for the location. There are many attractions within easy walking distance, dozens of restaurants and the staff very helpful. The room was clean, comfortable beds and a well equiped kitchen (although we did not make use of it). A good continental breakfast was included as was secured parking, a plus for a downtown location. There was a little street noise but that is to be expected in any big city. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcoming Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: newarkdelawaregin
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights here during our first trip to the City of Vancouver. Its location on a quiet street but close to night life was ideal. Free parking and continental breakfast seem to be rare in this city and so were very much appreciated. Staff were incredibly pleasant and helpful. We were upgraded to an executive suite which was not only comfortable and classy, but had absolutely everything you'd need to stay long term. This was by far the nicest accommodation during our two week trip; I wish we could find a Sunset Suite at all our travel destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located to all attractions, walking or transit.”
Reviews.Author: pop60eye
Reviews.Content: The service was more than excellent and the location is also most convenient to everything. It is a suite that lets you enjoy making meals appealing to yourself. Continental breakfast is a great way to start your day, pick it up and take to your room. Has gated parking on the premises Have stayed there before and will saty again and recommend to anyone we know going to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A "home away from home" in a great location”
Reviews.Author: neilmg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Sunset Inn, and we could not have been more satisfied. The hotel was very clean, and the room was nice, with a good working kitchen. The location was fabulous. We love to walk, and Downtown, Granville Island, the False Creek Ferry, and lots of restaurants were within easy walking distance. The best feature, however, was the front desk staff. They were eager to answer our questions, and even helped us when our travel computer had a Wi-Fi problem. We would definitely stay there again on our next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Glencoelad
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sunset Inn and Suites in Vancouver, BC, Canada and found it to be a wonderful experience. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room cleanliness was very good. We booked and paid early and got a great deal on a executive king suite complete with a kitchen and dining area, huge bed, writing desk, nice bathroom, and a balcony overlooking downtown Vancouver with the mountains in the backround. They do provide a secure parking area but don't go with a large vehicle because it does take a little maneuvering. A continental breakfast is provided. It is located in the west end just minutes walk from Stanley Park and other downtown neighborhoods. We would definately stay there on any future trips to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasent Experience To Say the Least”
Reviews.Author: RedSox1938
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure, this is a great place to stay. We received a upgrade upon arrival. Sarah, the afternoon clerk, helped my wife get our luggage to our room/suite while I parked the car. In addition, she provided us with a number of local places to eat. Not one was a disappointment. Dave, on duty during the morning, assisted us with whatever we needed. Set us up for the " Big Bus" two day deal. We never had to move the car while in Vancouver. Free parking plus a continental breakfast makes the Sunset Inn & Suites a fine value. Our thanks to Michael Wright, General Manager, and the entire team for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kooss
Reviews.Content: Kitchen, Bedroom, living room, and bathroom. Rooms were very comfortable with kitchen appliances, soft beds, a large TV living room and another in the bedroom. Very helpful local restaurant and sight guide. Very convenient location. Parking was free; spots were hard to get into but available, but try to get a spot early in afternoon or evening. Staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable about Vancouver. Breakfast was simple, yet filling (pastries, juice, fruit, and coffee/tea). Cost is average for Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful sanctuary to come "home" to!”
Reviews.Author: manitou52
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vancouver and really did little research about the area pre-arrival. Upon finding Sunset Inn and Suites when we arrived in Vancouver, we were impressed with the size of the suite we had reserved. It was a wonderful base camp to come home to as we traveled throughout each of our days there. The location is such that we could easily walk in many directions (ferry to Granville Island is only minutes away, we walked to Gastown, Sunset Beach, etc.). The bed was very comfortable, the room was very clean, and the staff was very informative! We had the best fish and chips and salmon tacos based on their recommendation! Assuming we make our way back to Vancouver, I'm sure we will stay at Sunset Inn and Suites again!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Triciairene
Reviews.Content: Cleanest hotel & most comfortable bed All was great & the rooms were nice & roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: PamD10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sunset Inn & Suites twice. The location is great; it is near downtown Vancouver, but on a quiet street. Their suites are perfect for our family of four. I would especially recommend this hotel to families traveling with children. We have found the Sunset Inn & Suites to be an excellent value. Free parking behind the hotel is available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base for Visiting Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Walberswick
Reviews.Content: Second stay at Sunset Inn & Suites - as previously well equipped suite for us and our three grown up children! Great base to explore Vancouver - close to Stanley Park and Granville Island and a doable walk into the main area yet not on a main street and fairly quiet at night. Helpful staff who even photocopied map for us to explore North Vancouver and then made a thorough search after our son thought he had left something crucial in the room when we left (he had not - apologies!) Only gripes would be Suite could sleep 6 but table was a very tight squeeze for 5, higher up suites aircon dripped onto our balcony (annoying noise) and the air con was not up to the job (but it was very hot)

Reviews.Title: “very well appointed suites - great location”
Reviews.Author: 1dl2
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills, but in all respects very adequate hotel. We stayed 1 night on our way from Rockies to Vancouver Island and a further 5 nights on our return to the City. The front desk staff, though there seemed to be frequent personnel changes, were at all times very helpful and responded to all requests for service and information with courtesy. They know that their guests are interested in value for money and went out of their way to point out alternative means of transport to taxis. The executive suite we stayed in on the upper floor appeared to have been recently re-furbished with wood floors which the standard suite we used for one night had not. The real win here is the location, in the West End (which is primarily residential, but within a 10 minute walk to Robson and the City centre and 20 minutes to Stanley Park which you reach by strolling up English Bay and Sunset Beach which is just two blocks away from the hotel. A short stroll and hop on the little bay ferry takes you to magical Granville Island which can feed any culinary desire you want. Admittedly we lucked out with the weather - 5 days of unbroken sunshine and 28 degrees is not typical Vancouver even in August, but it meant we caught some spectacular sunsets over the bay before going out to eat. Altogether Sunset Inn and Suites delivers what it advertises and I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms but cold staff”
Reviews.Author: Renata005
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, with full kitchens, but reception staff was very cold and bad-mooded.

Reviews.Title: “We were so happy to come back here.”
Reviews.Author: MaryK001
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sunset Inn with Michael and his fabulous staff many times in the past when we were en route to our jobs in northern Alberta. But this time we were there strictly for pleasure purposes and we were not disappointed. The hotel has done extensive renovations since our last stay and the suites were so lovely and spacious. A nice touch was the bottles of water in the frig on our arrival. The breakfast was always fresh and the coffee superb and the staff so friendly and never rushed or too busy for a chat when we were coming and going during the day. One marvelous perk for a downtown hotel is the free parking. What a bonus!! We can hardly wait to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid location , excellent value......staff are great !”
Reviews.Author: 613adams
Reviews.Content: Close to everything....lots of great food near by...make use of the suggestions in the in-suite binder( for more than just good eats). Parking is included in the room price and this a huge plus in Vancouver. We stay here whenever we are in metro Van.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: cville16
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews I read here, I booked three nights at Sunset Suites. Perhaps my expectations were too high for a two-star establishment, but I fail to see why this hotel receives such rave reviews. The suites may be big and clean enough, but virtually everything else was a disappointment. The furnishings were dated with one small, old TV outside the bedroom. The weak toilet in our tiny bathroom got plugged twice during our stay, and since there is no dedicated maintenance person on call, we were forced to go downstairs to the lobby to use the facilities throughout the evening until the next morning. Like the toilet, the one AC unit in the bedroom was barely functional. Fortunately, the heat wave in Vancouver did not hit until after we had checked out. The room we were given was on a low floor with no view and was surprisingly noisy from passing delivery trucks, despite the hotel being in a supposedly quiet residential neighborhood. The meager continental breakfast, which had to be brought up to one’s room on trays, consisted of corn flakes, frosted cheerios, mini bagels (no cream cheese), English muffins (none on our second day), sliced bread, and artificial tasting croissants.. At least apples, oranges, and bananas were offered on most days. As for service, I didn’t find the front desk particularly helpful. We were directed to English Bay Bike Rentals and told to mention the hotel there, presumably for a discount, but no discount was offered. Given the rate we paid including an extra charge for children staying in the same room, there are definitely better hotel options in Vancouver. If you appreciate a good breakfast like my family does, not to mention better facilities, book instead at the nearby Cascadia Suites, where we enjoyed a huge free hot breakfast buffet, good AC, and a working toilet, all for less than we paid at Sunset Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Large clean room, gated parking but parking is small and tight”
Reviews.Author: KenAZBoat
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. I think they might have been a condo turned into a hotel. Full kitchen, dining area, living room and balcony. Continental breakfast was extremely small. Small fitness center. Washer and dryer on main floor.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel, feels like a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: 2010mapleleaf
Reviews.Content: I stay here whenever I am in town for business. The front desk staff welcome me by name and offer great tips for restaurants, sightseeing etc. I often hear other guests chatting with the staff about all kinds of things from the advice received, their trip, their families... The rooms are spacious and clean. I love the suite idea, the kitchen supplies, and I love the convenience of being able to shop and cook if I want to . And how many downtown hotels offer free parking, free wireless, free local calls.....? The location is perfect - I walk everywhere - beach, seawall, restaurants, shopping...

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience .........ARROGANT MANGER”
Reviews.Author: RAJ97
Reviews.Content: We had booked an executive bed room suite with the expectation of having a comfortable stay with our kids ... but this manager named Michael Wright insured that dream to turn into a nightmare. Despite paying a high rate.. We could not get our kids the basic comfort of air -cons. The staff sounded very welcoming on the first day but their manager tagged us as TROUBLE (yes over our faces) when they were asked to resolve the issue of one A.C. over-cooling and the other not cooling at all. He was non-co-operating with us and denial with room problems for all 7 days of our visit....Due to holiday season we could not move elsewhere.. Despite our constant reminders nothing was done till end. I think this guy rules the place.Thier other staff like Dave & Alvis seemed fair guys but looks helpless under their manager. I would never go to this hotel as long as Michael Wright their manager is managing the show. This misconduct needs to be brought to level above manager so that other visitors don’t face the misbehavior & misconduct which was faced by us. WE GAVE THE OFFICIAL FEEDBACK TO THE HOTEL BUT NO APLOLOGY OR COMPENSATION WAS PROVIDED TO US.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of five city twelve day holiday”
Reviews.Author: vancouverfan
Reviews.Content: Yes this was the year. We decided to skip the inclusive to Mexico and go on a driving holiday. We travelled 2000 kilometers over twelve days and stayed two nights on average in Penticton BC, Vancouver, Victoria, Seattle and Spokane - visiting smaller towns in between. With credit to each city highlight of trip was the Sunset Inn and Suites and Vancouver - both contributing to the top experience. The Sunset Inn & Suites is excellent --like living in your renovated home but with maid service. Excellent help at front desk upgraded us to a decent sized executive seventh floor suite with partial view of ocean. Secure parking at rear of hotel allowed us to leave our Lexus parked safe and without concern. Granite countertops, hardwood floors, Koehler taps, gourmet coffee maker, new high end and comfortable bed and pull-out couch. State of the art remote control, efficient and quiet heating/air-conditioning . Top notch materials from nice decor wallpaper to coating on balcony floor to rain shower head into large jacuzzi. We are a family of five, with three young girls and did not feel crowded, with a separate bedroom, family room and kitchen. What did I like best? Well, all of it. Cental location, the clean room, lots of towels and pillows and large flat screen Phillips TV that added with the smaller TV in the bedroom allowed for each generation to watch show of choice and in peace. Davie Street around the corner with tons of restaurants including the best one the Greek one midblock with the fast lineups every night...awesome meals and prices. We loved the three block walk to the seawall, strolling along million dollar ocean front condos and marina yaughts along with lots of joggers and cyclists. From there buy the all day pass for the water taxi and float to Granville Island Market, Chinatown and Gastown that all are within walking distance allowing us to leave our vehicle parked during our stay. Don't waste your money anywhere else. Loved the Sunset Inn & Suites like I loved this city. This would be an awesome place to live. We will be back, hopefully sooner rather than later. P.S. Continental breakfast and parking is included. Travelled lots first and only review. Marcel ( Calgary, Alberta ) 2010-08-05

Reviews.Title: “Hidden small hotel in the heart of the rainbow district - off Davie”
Reviews.Author: katmorrell
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad that we found this treasure. We go to Vancouver several times a year from Seattle. Love the vibrancy and street life of the West End. We had always stayed at the Pacific Palisades Hotel on Robson, but it is no longer a hotel. After searching, I found the Sunset Inn and it will be our new go-to place in Vancouver. It is small and laid back....just good, clean, inexpensive suites in the heart of things. Couldn't ask for more. Plus free parking-which would have cost at least $25 per day at other hotels. The room has hardwood floors, very clean, nice furniture, a small dining table, a kitchen stocked with dishes and pots and pans, coffee maker, electric kettle, toaster. The bathroom is small but very nicely designed, with a large magnifying mirror. the shower head was especially good. There was an air conditioning unit in the bedroom....and also 2 oscillating fans that helped move the air around. A small balcony has 2 chairs. They have a basic continental breakfast in the minuscule lobby. No room service....but you can get any kind of libation or food on Davie right around the corner. It is right around the corner from the must-visit Stephos Greek Restaurant. on Davie.......oh and the front desk staff were totally engaging and friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: LaurieY12826
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is staying in the downtown vancouver area. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. My family had never been to Vancouver and the staff was alway helpful in making suggestions and point us in the right direction. There is a beautiful small balcony (we were on the 9th floor) that I did not get to use as much as I wanted to, just becuase I have a rambuncious 5 year old that I did not want out on it. He never got out to the balcony, since he was tired from being out and about and was happy to play his DVD on the in room DVD player. Great kitchen amenties right in your room with a full stove, fridge and microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jsforget
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and rented an executive -bedroom so that our little guy (4 yr old) had a space to himself. The room was great with a fully equipped kitchen. The location rocked being just steps from the ferry to Granville Island and minutes from Englishman beach. The staff were amazing -- Dave at the front desk was awesome and had lots of great tips for things to see and do. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of a small hotel in the heart of downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: katrinka3
Reviews.Content: This is s jewel of an intimate,cozy and modestly appointed family hotel with suites in downtown Vancouver. As a nicely converted low rise apartment building in a residential area, it is just across the street from an attractive hostel, just blocks away from shops, restuarants, and a a little dock from which can take a ten minute ferry boat to Granville Island. This hotel reminds us of some of the small family hotels in Europe where one feels sheltered and cared about, the faces of the staff are familiar, and the staff make every effort to be of informed assistance. This hotel is ideal for families travelling with teens or young adult members who prefer a hostel, and parents or grandparents who prefer more space and comfort nearby; and for special family occasions such as weddings where well equipped kitchenettes, a living area and separate bedroom are needed. Parking is somewhat limited and tight, so small cars are an advantage.Staff are helpful in manouvering around this. We would gladly stay at this hotel again. It is not fancy, but it is clean and comfortable and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, fabulous stay, great room, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aliskiGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2010 for 4 nights for a conference. I couldn't afford the extortionate rates of the conference hotel and looked for something which was better value for money. I chose this place which was about a 20 minute walk from my conference hotel which suited me fine. When i booked, an executive suite was the best value and so i ended up with a great room. it was a good size, with a little well equipped kitchen [i'd like the sound of having my own cooking area to keep costs down], a dinning area, a balcony looking out to the snowy mountains and a good bathroom. I also had free wifi which was a must as i had work to do too. When i arrived i was made very welcome by incredibly friendly and helpful staff who were always on hand to help out throughout my stay. The hotel is located in the West End of Vancouver's down town and one step onto my balcony made me disappear into culinary heaven, the smells of local restaurants was intoxicating. Exploring around revealed a huge mass of places to eat and drink within a minute of the hotel. Other areas of downtown are not too far away either and there are good bus links on Davies street which is parallel to the one the hotel is on for those not as keen or able to walk. The hotel is also only 5 blocks from the Canada Line which is the new fast train link to the airport. All in all this was a fantastic choice of somewhere to stay and i would highly recommend it for those who want a good quality place with friendly service that's located well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay except for the size of the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sushar
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice place to stay with good location, clean rooms, friendly staff and good breakfast. It is not too far from the heart of downtown Vancouver and is close to all the major attractions. The rooms are clean and the staff friendly and courteous in general. The morning breakfast had enough variety and we overall had a nice stay. The only criticism is the size of the rooms. The rooms look a little cramped with not enough space especially when you have young children around. There is barely enough space to walk around with all the furniture. Overall still a good place to stay for its convenient location and nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, Considerate, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: SuitesTraveller
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to discover this excellent suites hotel with spotlessly clean rooms in downtown Vancouver with private parking -- it takes some manoeuvering to get in and out -- included in the price. This is essentially a residential suites hotel, and it's really a place one could live comfortably. The suites are not only nicely proportioned, but just about everything one needs is to hand, from a cutting board and usable knife to washing up equipment and proper dish towels. Hotel staff were unusually helpful, accommodating, and friendly, as were guests we met in elevators or lobby. This may reflect the residential nature of the place and that people are comfortable and made to feel at home. Don't be put off by the small lobby or unattractive hallways; the planning, decoration, and expenditure have gone into the suites, which are carefully designed and laid out for comfort, even including good lighting, useful reading lamps on both sides of the luxuriously made up bed, a generous desktop and comfortable office chair as well as ample storage, well-laid out bathroom, a small balcony with chairs, and a window that opens. Do ask for a street rather than alley view if one is available. If needed, computer and printer are available for use at the desk. Breakfast food is included in the price and is set out in the lobby to be be picked up by those who wish to eat in their room but choose not to shop.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: ilishm
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't stay anywhere else now that we have stayed at Sunset Inn & Suites. Spacious, clean self-catering suites; friendly staff; close to all major attractions in a beautiful area of Vancouver; ourstanding value all round, with free parking - very unusual in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great suites”
Reviews.Author: sailingzephyr
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our three teen daughters and found the spacious suites to be perfect. We had a king bed, they had queen pull-out couches in the LR. We asked for the highest floor and got a view of the water. It's not a new, upscale hotel, but clean and well-maintained. Very peaceful street, and close walk to shops and restaurants. Walked through Stanley Park; took the water taxi down the hill over to Granville Island. Perfect location. Front desk was very helpful in sourcing restaurants and provided us with umbrellas on our one rainy day. Great city and great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wow what service”
Reviews.Author: Diablocanyon1
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very friendly even when I checked in at 12 pm. I knew that my room wouldn't be ready yet, but he gave me a time and told me to come back. After adventuring around the city, it was during the Olympics, we returned to find our room ready at 4 pm. He told me 3 pm, but we were enjoying the city. The room was clean, spacious and had a very nice view to the south. I liked the location. Close to the action, but in a more residential neighborhood i.e. little to no traffic. There was plenty of parking. The only downside is that I didn't discover a full coffee pot until right before checkout. This would have been helpful to know ahead of time. I would definitely recommend to friends and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “it's a good space besides the spacy staff member in the morning...”
Reviews.Author: teddykitty24
Reviews.Content: I had a look at the one king bedroom suite and it looked much older, and the kitchen was like a dark tunnel. We slept in the 2 bed executive studio suite that was absolutely beautifully done inside. the beds nice white linen and duvet cover, the kitchen had so many things to use i wish i knew because i could've made some juice there! It was very nice and i would definitely go back there. the location is near less fortunately housed people, so it's just kinda not a nice area, hence the view from the balcony looked over piles of garbages and back alleys.. but it was a block from davie st. and a 10 minute. walk to granville. we loved everything about it even the continental breakfast was great! lots to choose from. no cream cheese for the bagels :( but oh well, i didn't need it anyway. i wish the guy checking us out monday morning was a little more pleasant, as i said i would like to come back here, and i do recommend people to stay here, but he was like yah.... and didnt say much.,, so other than that, the other staff was absolutely perfect. !hopefully i can go back and have the same experience if not better!

Reviews.Title: “Our first choice for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Earthrats
Reviews.Content: We lived in the west end of Vancouver many years ago. So this is our old neighbourhood and we love it. For the price, this is the best location to get anywhere you want to go. Walk down to sunset beach and the seawall or Stanley Park. Walk to downtown shopping, Robson Street and across the Burrard Street Bridge to Kitsilano. Take the quick ferry to Granville Island. We have stayed in standard studio and 1 bedroom suites and executive 1 bedroom suite. They all have similar amenities but the standard rooms overlook the alley between Burnaby and Davie Street. You don,t have to look down! The executive suites on the upper floors look out over English Bay but there are lots of high rises in the view. You can still see the water and the sunsets. Better still walk the few blocks down to the ocean. If you are staying one night choose a standard studio but any longer we recommend the one bedroom. The secure FREE parking is a top selling feature when you consider the daily cost at all other accommodation. With a full kitchen you can supplement the pretty good continental breakfast if you need more. On our last stay the safe did not work and one of the closet doors came of the hinges. This is no indication of the quality of the accommodation but if it happens to you..take it in your stride. This is an older building and things can go wrong. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful. We live in BC and have stayed in many other Vancouver hotels. You can pay loads for 4 and 5 star places but they are still only hotel rooms. If you like to have space this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, room and location"”
Reviews.Author: takemeaway1127
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending the Olympics. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly (all of them!) Although overpriced for the timeframe (but everything that was available was!) the location was great and walkable or near the busroutes. Can't wait to go back to Vancouver and would stay here again. The breakfast was simple but the room had a full kitchen if you wanted to add to the toast and Croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could need/want and then some!”
Reviews.Author: theorbo-pgh
Reviews.Content: We were in town during the Winter Olympics games and had lucked out by finding the Sunset Inn & Suites. We found that it was perfect for our trip. Like they describe, the place is like no other because it offers an excellent location with apartment-like accommodations. We found our Executive One Bedroom suite to be the perfect size and found the many small touches like bottled water and the DVD player to be a nice bonus. The staff was very helpful - allowing us to leave our bags upon checkout and also arranging for a cab to come at 2am in the morning one night. Regarding the complaints about the free breakfast, we found it to be ample and satisfying. They had juice, apples, oranges, coffee, milk, cereal, croissants, english muffins, and bread. To pair with it they had peanut butter, strawberry jam, and butter. The fact that they provide trays to take to your room is nice. I usually don't care to eat in an often loud room with a tv and a bunch of strangers. We liked being able to easily take the breakfast back to our room. The place was clean and had everything we could need or want. We liked having the furnished kitchen. Ok, this is enough rambling about how great this place was and how we would definitely stay there again. Thanks, Sunset Inn & Suites - i hope to stay with you again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for working in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie2010
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel if you're doing work in Vancouver. I am sitting at my desk, in front of the window, looking at an incredible sunset over the mountains. I can easily walk anywhere for meetings and there is a bakery, grocery store, drug store and produce market within crawling distance. The housekeeping staff are friendly and efficient, the kitchen is fully stocked, there is a small but sufficient workout room, and it is a 3 minute jog to an incredible running path on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a residential neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: PDXWalker
Reviews.Content: On check-in we were upgraded from a standard room to a standard suite: bedroom with king bed, sitting room, dining area and separate kitchen. The extra space was nice, as our visit coincided with a monsoon; it was good to have extra room to dry things out. Also, having a kitchen meant you use the local markets to get supplies for lunch and/or eat in without a lot of hassle or expense. The breakfast was sparse, but that was okay, as it was as advertised and enough to get you out the door. The location in a residential area is pleasant. Great public transportation is available within 1-2 blocks, with buses going everywhere for minimal cost. It was really nice to walk back from the bus stops on the busier streets and turn onto quiet Burnaby St. The staff was helpful with recommendations. This isn't a glitzy place, but it sure was comfortable. I would stay here again, but next time would request a room on the south side of the building on the upper floors (facing English Bay), as the rooms on that side would seem to be a bit quieter with a nicer view.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a very fair price.”
Reviews.Author: rgmomHarrisburg_PA
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my husband and two young adult children. The suite was very comfortable for four. The location is ideal. The staff was helpful. They even loaned us umbrellas. All in all it greatly exceeded expectations at a very modest price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: ZARA78
Reviews.Content: We (myself, my husband and 2 yr old daughter) stayed at the Sunset for 4 nights. We had booked an Executive bedroom suite with separate living room so we could be guaranteed a higher floor room (we were on the 10th floor). The hotel was very clean, bright featuring many windows, offered a spacious floorplan and nice view of the Granville Bridge. The separate bedroom with King size mattress allowed for a comfortable stay when travelleing with a young child. The fully equipped kitchen was more than we could ask for with new appliances. The gym was a bit of a disappointment though. Guests are offered a small selection of breakfast items such as toast, bagels, cookies, croissants, juice, milk and coffee (which was very good!) every morning. We would w/o a doubt stay here again. Noise was minimal at night so our 2 yr old had no problems sleeping through the night at all.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: klapl250
Reviews.Content: I love staying at this hotel when I go to Vancouver. The rooms feel like my own place rather than a hotel room. The location is great! It is within walking distance to tons of great restaurants, Granville, and Robson St., and the beach. As well it is right by the Big Bus Tour bus stop if you are planning on doing that. However I will say that the rooms are not fancy, or five-star worthy, and the devices in the room are not new (old TVs, DVD players, had a broken air conditioner once, uneven stove tops). Despite all that, it is still a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: jeh106
Reviews.Content: We had 9 members of our family at this hotel (from age 9 to age 70). Most of the rooms were suites. My wife & I and my sister-in-law each had a suite with 2 beds, 2 rooms, full kitchen with dishes, pots, silverware. Large rooms, also had a balcony. My nephew had a larger suite with a sofa/bed large enough for their two sons. Parking was free and secure but a tight fit for larger vehicloes (SUVs, etc). Lots of restaurants in the area within walking distance. A variety of price ranges and ethnicity. Robson St. shopping was a longer walk but doable if not raining. Granville Island Farmers Market aldo walkable (via a very short ferry ride). Our suite was around US $100.00/night. Breakfast was free but limited - criossants, muffins, coffee, tea, bagels, sliced bread, milk, 2 types of cold cereal, butter, jam, peanut butter. You had to eat it in your room as there was no breakfast room. The staff was extremely helpful when asked for restaurant recommendations and calling for a taxi (usually a 5 minute or less wait). 2 hour drive to Whistler Ski area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: OceanBlvd
Reviews.Content: I'm hesitant to write this review as I feel like a person who has found the perfect fishing spot -- where you are never disappointed. But I feel I owe it to the owners / mgt / staff of the Sunset Inn & Suites; they have created a wonderful home away from home at a price which is extremely reasonable. I guess I should share my favourite spot. Its quiet, clean, spacious, well equipped, friendly staff, inexpensive, unique, great central location, secure parking,

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant small hotel, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: Latitude20North
Reviews.Content: I stayed for several days and enjoyed the mini studio apartment. The kitchen was small and very satisfactory, the continental breakfast downstairs very nice, with trays to bring it upstairs to the room. Front desk personnel knowledgable and helpful. Request one of the top floors to get the best views of the city. Located on a residential street, walking out the front door a pleasure, seeing leafy trees and green grass. Great location, a little off the beaten path, easy walking down to Yaletown. Great open air farmers market nearby on Saturdays, and lots of restaurants within walking distance or short taxi ride. Comfy bed, nice robe, free highspeed internet. I liked the place, and you could save money staying here if you shopped for groceries. There are a couple of very nice trendy supermarkets not far away, so getting set up to do light cooking would be easy. One odd thing was bathroom was really really small, but new and very clean, enough towels for an army. It's kind of a nifty little hideaway hotel, a little on the funky side, but somehow I overlooked slightly odd headboard and bedside tables and enjoyed the room. They were quite nice to me, too.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible gem..”
Reviews.Author: mchjc
Reviews.Content: I am a veteran of many...too many.."solo travels"...around the world...every continent except Antarctica...including stays in "classy" hotels in Vancouver.....and I can honestly say...after my week's stay..that I have never encountered any hotel offering more than the Sunset.. Location: In the downtown center of a large metropolis...within short walking distance of principal shopping, business, dining, and entertainment areas and cultural attractions...YET...located on a quiet street with very little traffic, in a virtually suburban setting !! Building: Simple... but strikingly well-maintained and clean throughout.. Room: Mind -blowing..I stayed in an Executive One Bedroom Suite...and quite a "suite" it was !! Two large rooms, with bathroom, plus a good-sized fully -equipped kitchen..with excellent ...free...internet access....far surpassinging any room I've ever had..at a fraction of the cost I would have expected and have paid elsewhere. Service: Highlighted by the friendliest, most helpful, Front Desk one could ever hope for.. Not to lessen my praise for all of the desk men I encountered, I cannot fail to mention Dave...awesome !! In short...FIVE STARS rating...without a doubt !!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Inn”
Reviews.Author: OzTravellerBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in an Executive Studio and loved it. Room had 2 double beds, spacious kitchen area and a very clean room. Special thanks go to Dave on reception as he was always willing to help and always treated his guests with a smile (although a couple of others were a bit surly). The Inn was a short walk to the water taxi that takes you to Granville Island and a street away from busy Davie St. The hotel itself was on a very quiet street and was well lined with trees to give you that “green”’ look. Vancouver, unfortunately, has a problem (I think) with homeless people and we had to find our walks to Robson Street on streets that avoided this blight. The hop-on hop-off bus tour stops just around the corner and we found this well worth the money. Some may say the breakfast options are a bit small but we had some local goodies from the market we wanted to eat anyway and didn’t rely too much on just the Inn’s selection. However, they did leave the juices out for most of the day which I found a nice touch. Overall, great location with plenty to select from around the area and great hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sunset Inn and Suites definitely a repeater”
Reviews.Author: toetap
Reviews.Content: If you like reasonable , friendly, locally owned hotels, this is a gem in a great location..Easy walking to Yaletown, downtown, and passenger ferry to Granville Island. Its older and small, but on a nice street and we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite which was lovely with private bedroom and good kitchen..would be great for long stay...Free parking in 2 small gated lots...Only downside is the lot under the hotel is hard to get into ,so one needs to have a small car..But another lot topside is easier. Just around the corner is a neighborhood street with grocery store, cafes, and all one would need, and a short hop if raining and cold..good choices. This will be our hotel choice on every tirp to Vancouver..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, completely satisified.”
Reviews.Author: rebroz
Reviews.Content: This hotel will be our first choice for a return trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, a total hidden gem in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: tripnut_08
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a hotel to stay at in Vancouver can be a daunting experience. Lots to choose from, but pretty pricey. The Sunset Inn & Suites offers some terrific value. The hotel is well located, close to Burrard Street Bridge. It was only a few blocks to the water and beaches leading towards Stanley Park. The hotel is a block off of Davie Street, close to coffee shops and restaurants. Parking is included in your room rate - a rarity in downtown. There is also a bike locker in the underground parking which was a nice bonus. Free wi-fi available. I stayed in one of the king executive rooms and it was very spacious. Tons of closet space, plus a work desk, dining table and chairs, and a kitchenette. There is a continental breakfast included, but it is pretty limited. Toast, bananas, coffee and juice boxes. Grab some fresh bagels and cream cheese from Siegels bagels in Granville Island Market instead. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suites but cold reception”
Reviews.Author: grizzly71
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sunset Inn and Suites on two different occasions and found the room rates reasonable considering the proximity to English Bay and Stanley Park. However, the front desk personnel definitely needs improvement in terms of both friendliness and demeanour towards guests. Even though I do believe this is a good place to stay, I would think twice before staying here again due to the lack of hospitality exuded from the front desk personnel.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Sunset Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: TZK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 nights at the Sunset Inn. We were very happy with our decision to stay there. The location is great, especially for people who like to walk. The Inn is located on a quiet, tree shaded residential street, yet it is close to downtown, neighborhood restaurants & stores & the ferry to Granville Island. We walked to Stanley Park & across the city to the Convention Center. One night while we were there, we were able to watch the Celebration of Light fireworks show just a few blocks down the hill at Sunset Beach. Our room was at the back of the Inn; I'm not sure but I think guests in the upper suites facing the Beach may have been able to watch the fireworks from their balconies. We had a car & we were able to park in the secure underground parking lot each night. There are 3 parking areas & the parking was explained to us in detail when we checked in - how to access the parking from the alley, info about the 3 lots, etc. There is a guest laundry room & ice machine near the parking garage. We stayed in an executive studio on the 9th floor. Our room faced the alley but because we were high up, we also had a view of the skyline & the mountains of North Vancouver. We didn't have a problem with any noise from the alley. There were 2 smallish elevators. We were in Vancouver during a hot spell & our air conditioner kept our room cool - & it was reasonably quiet. The kitchen had a refrigerator, stove, microwave, toaster, dishes, etc. but no dishwasher. There is a table & chairs for eating but no "seating area" - you had to sit on the bed to watch TV. The dresser & closets provided us with plenty of storage space. The lighting in the bathroom could be brighter but there was plenty of light in the rest of the suite. The bed was comfortable; I didn't like the pillows. There was a small patio with 2 chairs & a small table. The suite had a recycling bin for bottles & cans under the sink in the kitchen & a separate recycling bin for paper - I thought that was great & wish more hotels would do that.

Reviews.Title: “I'll definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: rontzu
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful, the room was newly renovated and very clean. The kitchen is equipped with everything but a dishwasher. Nice attention to details: ie. small bottle of Scope in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: PegBro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the start and end of our 5 week holiday . Pleasant staff. Upgraded on second visit. Suites have everything you need.Great location, everything within walking distance. Superb Greek restaurant around the corner, may have to queue but worth the short wait.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, inside at least!”
Reviews.Author: JoannaAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: We were surprised how nice the inside of these suites were and great value for money. Well equipped and nicely decorated. I had booked two lower floor suites, not realizing the difference between that and the higher floor suites. Upon arrival, one suite was upgraded but not the other. Both had the same view, just 7 floors apart. Higher floor suites had a/c units on the wall in both rooms and a window unit - lower floor suites had a noisy window in the bedroom only. Disappointed with the view of a seedy back alley. Continental breakfast was ample, but served in the hallway. Had to take it back to our suite on a tray. But that was ok. Front desk staff were generally a little frosty! Dave was the exception - hillarious! Very honest about the area, which was extremely busy and diverse on a Saturday night! Not really the place to be with a young teenage boy. But such is life! At least we had free parking and still enjoyed our visit to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great value”
Reviews.Author: actormat
Reviews.Content: Great location, great room, great value. Just a short walk from Davie Street's bars and restaurants. Also a short walk from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: SaraJanec
Reviews.Content: We came here and while ago and loved the Sunset Inn so mjuch that we are going to stay there when he head back to Vancouver in June. There are four of us and the suite gives us enough room to get over our jetlag and get grounded. The brekkie was a wonderful welcome, something for everyone, it was the little things that made it great like real milk for the coffee and not instant coffee the "real stuff" Whilst the hotel looks a little old, the location is suberb, great to shopping and to a variety of different restuarants, and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “4.5 out of 5, very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: mum_and_3boyz
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with 2 small children and had a one bed suite which was spacious, clean and had a well equipped kitchen. Location is excellent as it is just around the corner from a variety of restaurants and bars. Parking is free which I believe is unusual in the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a base for exploring Vancouver, it was very good value for money. The only thing I wouldn't have been over excited about was the breakfast - it was very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy”
Reviews.Author: Cherryto
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights. CARPARK Entrance was at the back of the building. We parked our Chevy Uplander in the basement carpark on the first night. It was sheltered & gated. However, we did find it a little tricky to drive up & out the next morning. For the rest of our stay, we parked in the open but gated carpark. However, we need to walk down a steep flight of steps before using the room card to gain access to the building again. ROOM The lift was small. When we first opened the door to our unit 402, we were surprised to find the walkway equally narrow...we were bumping against each other. The bathroom was small, the kitchen was small(fully equipped though), everything seemed "tiny". But it was nice, clean and definitely cosy. Just need some coordination when walking around. The beds in the room was good. The pull-out sofa bed was the worst we had encountered. Even a 16kg kid could feel all the 'spring' when lying down. There were days when we came back after 3pm and the room was still not make. Topping up of toiletries was slow. Our room was facing the back alley. City view if you look far out. BREAKFAST Could bring the breakfast up to eat in the comfort of our room. On the first morning, I went down at 8am(B/f time 7 to 11). It was just a small table that situated along a narrow walkway at the lobby. Trays and disposable cups were available. Although not much varieties, it was wholesome enough. Read from other TA members re: 'going down early before the items run out', I had no problem with that even when I went down after 9am. GENERAL The staff (a tall young guy) at the reception was very helpful & approachable. He gave us a detailed direction of how to get to the carpark. He also called to make sure we had settled in on the night of our arrival. Free loan of umbrella. Short walk to dining & shopping.(one of our favourite:- Pho Central @ 1118 Davie St. Delicious, one of the cheaper & more authentic Vietnamese cuisine in Vancouver that we had found ) A minute walk to the Big Bus stop 12 http://www.bigbus.ca/ The street along Sunset Inn & Suite was dark.

Reviews.Title: “Sunset Inn was disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: LLL89
Reviews.Content: There were 5 of us and our room had one king bed in a separate bedroom and 2 sofa beds. The living area in the room was fine but it was nearly impossible to get around in the room with both sofa beds open so we only opened one. Being July, it was hot outside and only the bedroom had a window unit, which was noisy. The other 3 sleeping in the living room were sweating all night. If you leave the windows open you hear the traffic and late night partiers coming home. The kitchen was not that well stocked for cooking. Our bathroom had some holes in the wall but you could tell they were trying to fix it up. The hallway smelled like cigarette smoke and the elevators were really small and took forever. The breakfast was basic but ok with rolls, juice, milk and fruit. We had covered, gated parking which was great but hard to get in and out of and you access it through the alley. The staff was helpful and gave us advice on tours and directions. For the price we paid, we didn't feel we got a very nice room or that the facility was updated. Wouldn't recommend the neighborhood with kids or young teens.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Sunset...”
Reviews.Author: SweetDee69
Reviews.Content: My friend and I read the reviews of this hotel on trip advisor and decided to book. It was the best decision we made for our week in Vancouver. The room was spacious with a wonderful, comfy king size bed. The kitchen was a bonus and we enjoyed breakfast each morning at our dining room table. The bathroom was quaint and sufficient for two people. Loved being able to shower and bath. Centrally located to all shops, bus routes and the ferry to the market. The staff were friendly and the hotel was clean. The week still rates as our most memorable romantic getaway....thank you SweetDee, New Zealand & Gerald - Canada

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in the best neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Nora1999
Reviews.Content: Sometimes you just get lucky and stumble upon a gem. This is the perfect hotel for my friends and me. The staff here is more than accommodating, our room and view was simply FANTASTIC...and it's in the best neighborhood in town...GREAT food and shopping just a block away....clean...it was GREAT to have a full kitchen and we definitely took advantage of that with Granville market just a short walk and a water taxi ride away...there were small touches here that made Sunset extra special...like being able to rent an umbrella...and the continental breakfast wasn't shabby, either. I am SO happy I stayed here and will definitely return here my next trip! Sunset Inn is GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the Sunset Inn!”
Reviews.Author: KingstonEmerson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sunset Inn over the US Thanksgiving holiday and we couldn't have been happier. The hotel upgraded us to a roomy Executive Suite - bedroom with king bed, large living room with two couches (convert to double beds), a desk, dining area and full kitchen. Our room had a peek-a-boo view of the water through high rise condo towers which were beautifully lit at night. The room was spotless, pleasant, with restful colors, quality linens and furniture. The towels were plentiful and of qood quality. The bath had decent lighting and a wall mounted, magnifying mirror as well as a hair dryer. The shower rod was of the new, bowed variety that afforded much more room and made showering a pleasure. We especially liked the location close to Davie Street - good food was just around the corner, as well as neighborhood grocers. Although the continental breakfast looked interesting and had a decent variety of foodstuffs, we tried neighborhood eateries, instead. All in all, the Sunset's a very comfortable place to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great sunsets at Sunset Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBermuda_Fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Sunset Inn late November, 2008. We were really happy with the accommodation - we had an Executive Large One Bedroom Suite with a view to the west. The first two days were rainy, but the umbrellas in the lobby available for us to use were perfect. The front desk was very helpful always giving great advice and answering our questions. The rooms were very clean and well made up every day. The towels were high quality as were all the other supplies in the suite. The bed was comfortable and the kids did fine on the pullout sofas. Breakfast in the lobby was good and if you want more - Denny's or Starbucks or great bakeries are just around the corner. Being near Davie Street made it easy to get everything you might need. Free parking, underground, was terrific. Laundry facilities looked good but didn't have time to use them. We were very, very happy with the suite. We thought it was terrific value for money. This was our first family trip to Vancouver and hope it won't be the last!

Reviews.Title: “Had a very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: happytravellerpcty
Reviews.Content: I booked one night in the Sunset Inn and Suites at the start of our trip in Vancouver/Banff. The hotel upgraded our room to a one bedroom suite and it was very clean, nice wood floor, separate tv in sitting and bedroom, full kitchen facility and a very nice but small bathroom, free locked up parking was a bonus in Vancouver. Free Wifi was great. There was a very small gym but we never used it. Breakfast was simple but it filled us well into lunch time when we traveled towards Banf the following morning. Reception was ok, not unfriendly but did not exactly show willingness to help. The guy that checked us in the night before was very efficient.
