They had a different guy in the morning and did not exactly offer to tell you what to do, although he could hear us debating how to bring the milk and cornflakes to the room etc. Location was very convenient to walk to restaurants. Overall, the hotel exceeded our expectation for the price we paid in such a convenient location and with all the extras thrown in. Definitely recommend it and with no hesitant to book here again next time. Especially we will be renting a car again to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, indifferent front desk”
Reviews.Author: rickewal
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful accommodations, great price but the front desk personnel seemed blase. Seldom did they look up to say hello as we passed. You had to make a real effort to get them to open up and help you with any questions you had. That said, we'd stay there again because of the other advantages.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel itself was Great, not so sure about neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: LKotsonas
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to an executive suite with a nice view to the West. The hotel lived up to its name as we enjoyed a very nice sunset. The rooms in the suite were large, clean and very nicely decorated. The staff was friendly and very helpful. My only warning, and this is minor, is that while the street the property is on is quiet (save for a 2:00am rendition by some drunk reveler's performing Queen songs--oddly entertaining!), the neighboring street, Davies, is a little bit on the seedy side (porn shops etc)with a lot of panhandlers, but.....just walk two blocks in either direction and you're fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: jbullock47
Reviews.Content: Sunset Inn and Suites is the best value-for-money I have come across in a long time. Our one-bedroom executive (i.e. higher floor) suite was $129/night. For that, we got a one-bedroom furnished apartment. There were sufficient pots and pans, plates and bowls, etc. that we could have made all our meals there. But why do that when they are loads of restaurants on Davie St., just one block away? The living/dining area was quite large but the bedroom was a little tight on space. Everything was spotlessly clean and the furniture appeared to me to be of good quality and pretty new. The sofa in the living room was a sofabed, so 4 people could conceivably have stayed in the apartment. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Family Suites - Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: blazerj
Reviews.Content: We recently had a family long weekend in Vancouver and stayed at the Sunset Inn and Suites. We chose this hotel primarily as it has suites suitable for a family of 5. What we found was a quite reasonably priced, comfortable accommodation for the 5 of us in a great downtown location for exploring Vancouver. We had only a couple of minor issues, one being that one of the sofa-beds had a damaged mechanism, making it "almost" impossible to open, and, that their free wireless internet access is not compatible with Safari on Mac. :-( The suite included two sofa-beds, a separate room with a king & TV, a 32" LCD TV in the living area, views of Granville Island, a dining table, desk and a suitably appointed kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great for self-sufficient travellers”
Reviews.Author: LancashireMouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel three times during our 24 day holiday, for varying lengths of time, each time occupying a one-bedroomed suite. The suites are spacious (although the bedrooms are a bit tight), and well equipped. We slept well every night and were extremely comfortable. There is a laundry room and on-site parking. Breakfast is supplied in the lobby - you help yourself to cereal, bread, croissants, etc., and take it to your room. There are plenty of restaurants/cafes locally. The hotel is situated on the edge of downtown and was great for us as a base in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Tigers2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sunset Inn on 2 occasions during August.We experienced 2 different rooms and were very impressed by both the size of the apartments(different room each visit) and their cleanliness.The shower area was also large and the bed very comfortable. Also the continental breakfast each morning, which you could consume in the privacy of your room, was more than filling and gave us a great and healthy start to each day. We found their location to be very good and within easy walking distance and/or access to Granville Island,Robson Street English Bay ,Stanley Park and other attractions-Vancouver is an easy city to get around. We had a backroom location on both visits and yes, you do get a pretty average view but you don't have to look at it!We found it very easy to draw curtains at night and there was never any problems with noise etc. Some reviewers seem to have an issue with Davies Street but my wife and I as well as other friends who stayed nearby, found this area full of character with some really great cafes and restaurants.It is definitely more interesting than mid town which can be just as generic as most large cities. There are some homeless peoples around this area and close to hotel but over 6 days(2 visits) we never had an issue with the homeless people who are really harmless and very unassuming unlike other places we have visited where you are constantly hassled by the beggars. In essence, we thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Sunset in every sense be it Paul and the lads in Recpetion who were always helpful when called upon to the great sized and clean rooms and great location and accessiblity to many of Vancouver's popular tourist attractions.We would return to this hotel again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Sun is setting on the Sunset Inn”
Reviews.Author: AMagone
Reviews.Content: First, the pluses... the general location is OK, relatively close to downtown Vancouver, a few blocks from False Creek and the Grandville Isle ferry (good) one block from Davie Street (NOT GOOD). The interior of our room was nice and relatively new. The sofa bed is not fit for humans. The problems: We were assigned the "Dumpster view suite". Look out the window,,,see an open dumpster. Actually the dumpster was not the worst part of the view, it was the piles of trash surrounding the dumpster. The front desk person suggested that we "close the drapes" and stay out of the room until after dark. Thanks. The front desk person indicated we could move to a better location for a an upgrade charge, but when I came downstairs to complete the transaction for the move the offer was rescinded as no "better" room was available. Not sure how other reviewers of this hotel on this website got a free upgrade. The front desk people were among the worst I have interacted with in 36 years of travel. They were aloof, unfriendly and seemed bothered by the simplest question about the area or "how do you get to X?" questions. While air conditioning is listed as one of the "amenities" of the Sunset Inn, in fact there is only one cranky window unit in the bedroom and nothing in the living area. When I called the front desk about the living room being hot they indicated that AC really shouldn't be necessary and if the room was too hot it was due to "global warming". Thanks guys. The maid service was marginal. The maid apparently never entered the kitchen area of the suite and didn't respond to requests for soap, etc. There are plenty of great hotels in Vancouver. I would avoid this hotel at all costs. The 2 stars rating is an extreme exaggeration.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty underwhelmed with the service”
Reviews.Author: Enfant_teribl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before, and the room and service were good. Good value, big room. Stayed again, and it was not a good experience. We booked a 'Executive Studio'. When we checked in, we were given a non-exec room, right next to the car park - I can't think of a worse room in the place. We complained, and were moved to a non-exec suite, which was better, but not done up to the same standard as the execs, and it had twin beds, not the King we had booked. No one apologised or seemed particularly bothered when we complained, though they did give us a suite, as opposed to a studio. We do not have such a good view, being on the lower floors in the standard rooms. Also, the wi-fi is a joke. I only got a signal sitting near the door, next to the bathroom in the hall! And still it was only about a 40% signal. We had 2 computers with us, and it was the same for both. The cleaning staff also seem to like to have a shouting contest in the morning, which is quite irritating. Next time we will stay in a better place. At the time of writing, places like the Pan-Pacific are only about $20 per night more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DevonDaffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sunset inn for two days at the beginning and end of our honeymoon. The staff were helpful and friendly and upgraded us both times (for free) to a bigger suite than we had booked - one even had a jacuzzi bath in it! The suites were comfortable, well furnished and clean (not to mention huge!) You had everything to suit every traveller - even an office chair and desk if you are away on business. The hotel is well located next to Davie street (which is the Gay district in Vancouver). There are hundreds of restaurants on Davie Street to suit everyones budget and tastes. Although you are next to Davie Street it is still quiet though. You are also a 25 minute walk from the sea wall and English Bay. We only have two criticisms of the hotel. The first was the breakfast. As long as you were there at 7 when they first put it in lobby for you to collect you are fine.... if you go much later than this there doesn't seem to be anything left! You do have a selection of cereals, cakes, bread and some orange juice for you to take back to your room to consume. The second criticism are the views from the balcony. They are a bit poor, but thats not the hotels fault! You are surrounded by 70's style buildings which aren't the most attractive thing to look at..... the inside of the rooms make up for the poor views though, so don't let that put you off. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if we are ever fortunate enough to return to Vancouver.... thank you for helping make us feel so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: ethelred
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for four nights from 27th june,2008 and found it hard to fault (i could be picky and state only one lift was working).Had a suite on the seventh floor with a small balcony and a partial view of the harbour.Suite clean and tidy with adequate amenities.Mention should be made of Hotel Employee Sean who was very helpful and excellant in his choice of restaurants. Of particular note are Takis greek restaurant on nearby Davey Street where its popularity is measured by the fact people queue outside for a table and a Singapore restaurant on the opposite side of Davey Street in the opposite direction.Be warned theportions are huge and two dishes are quite enough for three people - we stupidly ordered starters and three main meals however the efficient staff cheerfully bundled up theremaining food and there was enough left for another mealat the hotel the next day. Vancouver itself is a clean vibrant city and visitors should doall the usual things.Do not bother with a circular trip on the Skytrain though good value there is not much of interest unless you study suburban homes. A word of warning do not walk as we did from Gastown to Chinatown unless you have a peculiar affinity for tramps and drug addicts. THE AREA IS CRAWLING WITH THEM WE FELT LIKE EXTRAS IN aGEORGE A ROMERO FILM. Tramps emerged from skips,sidestreets and doss houses like zombies all making for a place called Pigeon Park where they gathered for their prey (methadone and cheap alcohol).The locals do not seem to be bothered by them stating theydo not hassle people which was true and preferring them all to be located in one area rather than their own area.Nevertheless I found their presnce quite threatening and appalling watching at least one drug deal and seeing people root through litter bins for discarded food.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kjff
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this. This small hotel has 50 suites on 11 floors, each with real balconies, either overlooking English Bay or the cityscape and mountains, all in a great location. Room was terrific. We booked one of the "executive suites". Nice large bedroom with king size bed, desk and desk chair. Dining room area with 4 ft diameter table and four chairs and a kitchen with full fridge, oven, microwave, coffee percolator, electric tea kettle, teapot, cutlery, pots and pans, etc. In other words, fully equipped. Bathroom was small but, heh, what do you want to do in a bathroom? Everything was very clean. I particularly liked the hardwood floors in bedroom and dining area. Would have been nice to have a sitting chair in the bedroom area (our suite was totally open - except bathroom). But no real loss since we spent lots of time reading on the balcony. Nice staff and did I mention the location? On the edge of downtown in an apartment area. Two blocks from a beach and aqua taxi to Granville Island (don't miss the farmers' market there), 8 blocks to English Bay beach and Stanley Park. we walked a lot. 5 minutes to downtown. 10 minutes to Chinatown or Gastown. 15 minutes to Stanley Park. One block away is Davie Street with, I'm guessing, 30 or 40 restaurants and bakeries. Every cuisine style, all casual. Would you belive a Transylvanian bakery, just one block from hotel, as was a convenience store. Two more blocks away and you've got two fine vegetable and fruit stores. As you can guess, I highly recommend the Sunset Inn & Suites. Great location, great room and we paid $240 including taxes which was a good price for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: evilstepmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in early July for the purposes of attending a friend's party. Location - very good, close to seabus to Granville Island was a plus, love the market and having a kitchen we could buy some great snacks. Easy walk to Stanley Park. Rooms - Floor was dirty/hairy in all rooms, had not been cleaned and the microwave was covered in fingerprints. We spent $ 220 a night and were sure we were promised and executive with sitting room, but the only place to sit was a small kitchen table, 1 desk chair, the bed or the balcony. Entire 3 night stay was $ 750.00 with taxes- also note local calls being charged at almost long distance rates. Only half renovated, the bathroom tub was small and OLD, and the closets smelled like an old folks home. Windows are not new. Can not turn around in the shared or room hallway, and I would not want to use the elevators in case of emergency - takes forever!!! Forget it if houskeeping has used the one elevator that works. Which brings me to my next point - IN 3 DAYS OUR ROOM WAS NOT CLEANED ONCE. We were told check outs were first - we left our sign out (and left the room all day) for 3 days and someone finally showed up at 5 p.m. on the last day when we did not want to leave our room to have it cleaned, so we got clean towels, but had to live with the yucky floor. View was nice, which is good since we spent a lot of time on the balcony where the only chairs were! Breakfast was GONE by 8 a.m. and not replenished. Customer service was almost snobbish. SAFETY: Someone was shot in the alley behind the hotel in broad daylight while we were there, apparently gang related. I was told this is not normal for that area, but it was still frightening for the guests who use the alley to the main street or park back there. Be careful, it is Vancouver! Will not stay next time we are in town, will try something more upscale, but the prices in Vancouver for accomodations is ridiculous for what you get, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Abury
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, plus a lady friend, stayed here for one night before joining an Alaska cruise. We had all been to Vancouver before, so were only staying to make sure that we did not miss our cruise in the event that the flight was delayed, so we were not really looking forward to the stay. We like suite hotels in cities because after dragging around the city all day, the ladies are usually too tired to go out again looking for restaurants, so I go out and 'forage' for food and drink, which we can then have at our leisure in - hopefully - comfortable surroundings. I had looked at this and other suite hotels in Vancouver on tripadvisor beforehand, and this seemed the least worst, as a number of the others were reportedly in or near rather 'iffy' streets. In the event we had an excellent time. The reception staff were very pleasant, providing us with tea/coffee as our room was not quite ready, and giving us good advice as to where to go for a pleasant stroll before dinner. The rooms have all been redone, they said, and our one bedroom executive suite was spacious and very well turned out - see pic attached. The area was fine, close to Davie Street, which has a very wide choice of shops, bars and restaurants, and an easy walk down to English Bay and the beginning of Stanley Park. The breakfast is laid out in reception, consisting of juice, tea/coffee, cereals, muffins and fruit, which you take up to the suite to eat. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vancouver hotel!”
Reviews.Author: C.Weeks
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sunset Inn and Suites in Vancouver for 3 nights and were very impressed! There were refurbishment works going on at the hotel while we were there but it did not affect us at all, apart from only 1 of the 2 lifts was working, so we had to wait ever so slightly longer for a lift. I think it was because of these works that we were upgraded from the standard room that we had booked to an executive suite, as they are higher up the building away from the works. So that was a good start! The hotel is on a quiet, tree-lined street that actually made you forget you were right in the middle of a big city. We had free, secure parking, which was an absolute blessing, as parking in the city could be a bit of a pain. Staff were very friendly and helpful and were even able to lend us an adaptor plug when my husband realised they didn’t have round pin shaver points in the bathroom. We also had access to free wireless internet, which we found really helpful on our ipod to give us weather updates and help find attraction info etc. We were also not expecting the free continental breakfast that they offered in the morning, including cereals, muffins, bagels, bread and jam etc that you could take back up to your room to toast. The room was great – the beds were really comfy, there were loads of TV channels to keep us amused when getting ready to go out or settling in for the night, the bathroom was spotless with a good shower and the kitchen was well equipped with just about anything we could think you might need. We could also just about see the mountains between the other high rise buildings from our windows, to remind you that you were somewhere a bit different. We thought the location was good. We were able to walk about 2 blocks down to false creek (about 5 minutes?) to get the little ferries across to Granville Island (you must try to find the bakery/ delicatessen in the market that sells miniature cakes – the New York cheesecake was incredible! The micro brewery was also good fun). We were right round the corner from a 24 hour convenience store, shops and various little restaurants. In 15 minutes we could walk to the end of Denman street where there were a couple of really nice restaurants that we would recommend (the Milestone and the Boathouse) that looked over the beach and out to sea. Overall, we would have no hesitation in staying at the Sunset Inn again, even if they gave us a standard room, just as long as the beds and shower are as good as the executive suites, which I’m sure they would be.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: gails09
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights after Alska cruise. Reserved 1 bedroom "executive suite" with balcony on higher floor - referred to as "best room in the house" by desk clerk. It probably was. Huge room with wonderful king bed and 2 sofa beds - which were actually sleepable. Full kitchen with dinnerware. Balcony with incredible city views. Beautiful bathroom. Very clean. Price was also good. Location, while out of main downtown area, was walkable to that area and since Vancouver is full of high-rise everything, a pleasant break. One of the nicest places of this type I have seen. Now, the problem. Told at check-in that of the 2 elevators, one was inoperable since it was being over-hauled. Therefore, elevator service would be slow. Fine. Shortly after check-in, remaining elevator ceased to function for 6 hours and then worked intermittently for next 6. Little info provided by desk other than to say that it was because "Russians were fixing it" - what in the world does that mean? Walked up 9 floors, did not go out to dinner because of elevator issue. Husband inquired as to possibility of moving next day if there still was an elevator problem. Assured we could and to check in AM. Next thing we knew, we were evicted in AM from our glorious room and forced into 2 regular second floor rooms and promised they would "do something about the rate". No amount of arguing that we wanted to stay (since by then elevator appeared to be working) helped. They stated they had "sold our room". I suggested they unsell it or put new guests in 2 second floor rooms for 1 night. They refused. Nor did they even offer to help us move our stuff. Upon check-out there was no rate adjustment and since it was at 5:30 AM, no one with power to change it was present. Placed note to management with unsigned bill and awaiting response.

Reviews.Title: “This kept getting worse and worse”
Reviews.Author: Donnajoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to all the great reviews on Tripadvisor.Let me tell you that all the reviews seem very skewed and do not at all reflect the experience I had. I doubt I am alone, as the negatives were "built-in" to the experience and not on a personal basis. The hotel itself is definitely 3 star. We requested a crib for our room and a dirty, unpacked "Pack and Play" showed up in our room, 1 hour later. The bed linen they provided for the crib was dingy and left in a plastic bag by the unmade "Pack and Play". There was only 1 window mounted airconditioning unit in the bedroom. Nothing in the main living room, where our child was sleeping. The heat was unbearable. The TV had 10 stations,but advertised something closer to 100. Our free Wi-Fi did not exist- the signal was too low to have been used. When we asked the front desk,they ignorantly and non-interestedly said that it was our computer which was the problem. The "breakfast" is a joke. Our electronic parking pass never worked- they said that there was no problem with it. We ended up having to park on the street. Bottom line is that the staff had no interest or training to make this property work.

Reviews.Title: “May 2008”
Reviews.Author: twhi
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with this hotel. Yes, the neighborhood was nice, but there is a hostel across the street which allowed parties in the front lawn until late at night on weekends. It was quite loud until 2am both Friday and Saturday. The rooms are spacious but the common area hallways are very cramped. TVs are in the living room, not the bedroom where one might expect them. Paul at the front desk was exceptional. The others there were mediocre at best. If you want a hotel room with a kitchen, this place is OK. But when we left dishes in the sink after breakfast, they were still there unwashed when we returned in the evening. I'm certain there are better values to be had at this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: sleepyjen
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the Sunset Inn this past week, and we loved it. The room--the smallest they have--was huge, with a nice little kitchen. The staff were always really friendly and forthcoming with information, helping us find our way around Vancouver's public transit system in particular. Location is on a quiet street, which is a plus for me, but it's only 1/2 a block away from quirky Davie Street with its numerous restaurants and shops. We had a blast and could walk the mile or two to any destination from where we were. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: wanderers26
Reviews.Content: Fabulous find through Trip Advisor. We had a studio suite which was large with a well equipped kitchen and dining area, living room and king sized bedroom. The bathroom was small but everything spic and span. It was all the small things that we appreciated from the continental breakfast which you bring back to your room and the locked garage to the umbrellas they give out if it's raining. But most of all we appreciated the great advice from Paul. He gave us great suggestions for restaurants and told us about the boat to Granville Island. He also was great at giving us money saving ideas for some tourist traps we otherwise would have gone to. The location is in a quiet neighborhood but there was quite a bit of noise in the middle of the night in the back alley (certainly not the hotels fault). I would ask for the front room in the future. We were away from the hustle bustle of downtown but close enough to walk to through some interesting neighborhoods. I enjoyed staying in an apartment-like setting. I only wish we could have gotten the same rates as Expedia and booked directly through the hotel in order to avoid any charges if changes need to be made.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: ukgolf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sunset Inn for two nights after a 19 day Panama Canal Cruise, and must agree with the previous comments - this must be the best value in Vancouver. We had a standard studio suite at the AAA rate of $129 per night. We arrived at the hotel before 11am, just expecting to drop off our bags and go out to see Vancouver, but were delighted when we were informed that our room was immediately available. The room was located on the 6th floor and had recently been renovated to a high standard. In addition to a king bed, the room incxluded a dining area and full kitchen, with full size applicances. The bathroom had also been upgraded to the same high standard. The staff were all very welcoming and helpful. The rooms were exceptional clean and the free continental breakfast set us up for the day. While a little out of downtown, we were able to walk into town and Granville Island and English Bay were located within easy walking distance. We also walked to Stanley Park and rented bicycles to ride around the park - well worth doing. The hotel is located in a quiet tree lined smart residential street and Davie Street with its vast variety of eating establishments is just a block away. The hotel provides an extensive list of restaurants. The hotel is a $8.00 taxi ride from the Cruise terminal and $25.00 ride from the airport, being located on the airport side of downtown, with very easy drive to airport. For those with their own car the hotel has parking available. We will definitely return to the Sunset Inn on our next visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing accommodations”
Reviews.Author: TravelsavyKootenays
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 other adults stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in a standard large one bedroom on the 6th floor. This place was renovated in 2007 and the rooms are stunning. While the lobby is small, our room was 700 sq ft and had a balcony with a view of English Bay. From the outside, a person would never guess that this hotel is as comfortable as it is. Walking into the room felt immediately like home with all the comforts of home. The pull out sofa beds were very comfortable and all linens were very nice and clean. There was even a fully equiped kitchenette. The only problem with our stay was that when we got to the room neither of our 2 phones worked. I notified the desk and within 2 hours this was fixed. All the staff, including the housekeepers, bent over backwards to make our stay as nice as possible. I could not believe that we found somewhere to stay in downtown vancouver for under $175 a night with 4 adults. If i was ever to return to the city, I would stay here guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Deal”
Reviews.Author: Crikkers
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Sunset Inn & Suites for one night near Valentine's Day, and we were blown away. For the price it was a wonderful deal. The suites are fully outfitted apartments - they were spacious, clean and nicely decorated, kitchen was spotless, and the bed and pillows were THE most comfortable I've ever slept on. And I'm really picky. The complimentary breakfast downstairs was a nice touch, if a bit sparse. But we were thoroughly pleased with our stay, and recommend the hotel highly. We will most definitely stay here again if we have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sal71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sunset Inn for 7 nights in an one bedroom executive suite. We had lovely views from the 7th floor, all be it in between other buildings, looking out to English Bay and Burrard Bridge. I had decided on this hotel based on other reviews as we had 5 year old with us and we wanted somewhere in a decent part of town. It is near the gay part of vanocuver but it looked no different to any other major city. We felt quite safe. The neighbourhood was fairly quiet which was great! The street was very appealing.The hotel is 2 blocks from Davie Street with resturants and supermarkets a short walk away.. English Bay is about a 10 min walk down hill. Lovely sunsets! As is the water taxi to Granville Island, Telus Science Centre and GM Place. The free breakfast (starts at 7am) was good which you take back to your room. . Mini bagels, fruit, muffins, cereals... I thought a good choice. We were in a room with kitchen facilities so we had our own milk etc... but that is provided if you do not . The kitchen in our room was stocked with all you needed (except food) and we used it alot during our stay. The pull out bed in the living area was quite comfortable and we had plenty of pillows and blankets. Overall I would definately recommend the Sunset Inn and Suites.. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: tc2044
Reviews.Content: it is very nice and convenient for the clean kitchen and dining table, and providing simple sliverware to use. neighborhood is close to many good restaurant. bed and bathroom were both clean and comfortable. walking distance to stanley park. great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: CiviCSingapore
Reviews.Content: Great location for a low price. Spacious albeit dated interiors. Very adequate kitchen. Big apartment suites. Its situated right opposite the Hostelites International in a quiet and probably forgotten part of downtown Vancouver. However, almost 24 hours supermarket (Supa Value), Denny's, Starbucks, KFC, Japanese restaurants, Chinese takeout, Korean groceries and much more within a 5 minute walk from hotel. If you rent a car there is a covered carpark at the back of the hotel. Useful especially in winter. My family of four had an enjoyable time in Vancouver and the location of this hotel was helpful in accessing areas like Stanley Park, Lions Gate Bridge, and of course just being downtown. Highly recommended for value travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at at Sunset Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: SarahNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: After having spent one week at the Sunset Inn along with my husband, we having nothing but praise, both for the apartment and the staff. The apartment was well furnished, bed comfortable and the kitchen was well equipped. The bathroom was spotlessly clean. The bonus was the complimentary breakfast which we collected each morning from the foyer and ate in the comfort of our apartment. We found the staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful, especially Paul and Dean. We booked all our tours at the front desk and got lots of advice on the best trips. We were able to leave some luggage there for 3 days when we took a trip to Whistler, which incidentally was wonderful. The location of the Sunset Inn is great on a quiet street, and a lovely walk downhill brought us to English Bay. On our return from Whistler we even had an upgrade to an executive suite for one night. We had a marvellous holiday in Vancouver and found the Sunset Inn to be a great place to stay and such great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Budget Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: whitechristmas07
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on TripAdvisor we booked direct with Sunset Inn and on arrival very early in the morning (before 10am)our room was ready. Room 705 non smoking floor, great for families, huge king bed for parents and kids had their own sofa bed each. Kitchen was more than adequate to have breakfast if you did not indulge in the intercontinental breakfast provided on a single trolley in the lobby! We even cooked dinner and made sandwiches for lunch in our kitchen. All is good for this budget accommodation however staff could be a little more helpful or happy!! Note - you have to take your own bags to your room don't expect help. There is a on site laundry with washing powder free you just pay for the washing machine and dryer. Although in a quiet street parallel to Davie Street it is opposite the Youth Hostel - where revellers may wake you at 3am coming home - not a major issue. We walked everywhere from this hotel even home from GM stadium after watching our first ice hockey game. Overall, a great place for families on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms great--service needs and upgrade”
Reviews.Author: cynlouhoo
Reviews.Content: My husband is a repeat visitor to this property, but for the rest of our family, it was our first time. On the plus side, we were upgraded to an executive room, so we got to experience the best they have here at Sunset Inn. The room was quite nicely decorated for the most part (the kitchen appliances could use upgrading), and the room was very spacious (a large one bedroom). The downsides were: room is not well insulated from noise, shower either not working or too confusing to figure out (neither a good situation), the breakfast was marginal and completely self serve (so, no one to assist or explain where things are, etc.), and the front desk staff really seem uninterested and unfriendly. Another downside was at check out, we had to take our luggage down 7 flights of stairs because the elevator stopped working. The front desk person didn't offer an apology for the inconvienience or anything! Also, parking is quite tight here....tricky to get into the lot. If you have a large vehicle, it will be a major challenge! Overall, a great choice if you have a larger group or require a kitchen. I'd advise buying breakfast supplies and making your own.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Golden-mole
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Vancouver. The decor may be a bit tired, but you are not paying much for it. The rooms are a good size and have all that you need. The secure parking is free and removes worries about leaving your car on the street. The location is very good. Not far from English Bay, Stanley Park or downtown. The area is in the 'gay quarter', but there is no hassle for straights. There are restaurants within easy walking distance on Davie (try Moxies's Classic Grill) and also on Pacific Street. There is a Vera's Burger Shack on Davie that serves really great burgers prepared fresh. There is a 24hr supermarket nearby. The hotel is also just down from the big bus tour bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “The Sunset's Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: jcsrtnv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sunset Inn and Suites for two nights in September. We had an Executive studio which was on the 9th floor of this 11 story property. The Inn is located just a block off the popular Davies Street, on a quiet street of mixed apartment/condo buildings and small scall lodgings. The lobby is small and unassuming here, but the staff are friendly and helpful. Our room was a nice sized well appointed studio consisting of a bedroom/living area with patio, and a combination dining/ kitchen area. The room was stylish, spotless, and well furnished; and the king bed was extra comfortably dreamy! The bathroom had nice amenities, and was very well maintained with new fixtures throughout. The bedroom/living area had large windows with an outside patio that had great views of the city. There was ample closet and drawer space and an in-room safe. The Inn has only about four rooms to a floor, and this gave a nice feel to the place; sort of like having your own condo in the city. Sadly we had to move on after two days, though we were sorely tempted to stay after the manager offered us a great rate for an additional two night stay. There's no pool here, no room service, no restaurant, and a modest continental breakfast; but hey! You're just a block from Davies Street where you'll find everything you could want.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments”
Reviews.Author: BukkenBruse
Reviews.Content: The Sunset Inn and Suites is situated in a quiet street centrally in Vancouver and offers free, secure parking. The apartment we stayed in was freshly renovated and included a small but well-equipped kitchen. You'll find plenty of restaurants, a supermarket and banks just around the corner of the hotel. The wifi connection was included in the price of the room and worked very well. Breakfast was also included, only slightly inconvenient that we had to take it back to the apartment to eat it. Also loved the fact that they had a laundrette, so we could wash and dry some clothes (at a charge) while we were staying there. Loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jakeshunny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sunset Inn & Suites a year ago and loved everything about this property so we booked again this year. We are in Vancouver for two nights prior to an Alaska cruise. We would certainly rate this hotel a great choice because of the friendly helpful front desk staff. We also love the location in a quiet residental area with an easy walk to Stanley Park and to the ferry landing to Granville Island. We enjoyed nice walks to the grocery story to get items to eat in our very complete and functional kitchen. When visiting Vancouver, we will always stay at the Sunset Inn and Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: DJVera
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August in a one bedroom apartment on the ninth floor. Although the view wasn't amazing so we didn't use the balcony much, the apartment was clean and large and had everything we needed. All the staff we encountered were incredibly friendly and helpful, particularly the cleaning staff who were lovely! The hotel itself is in an excellent location and they even provide a free continental breakfast in the lobby until 11am. We stayed in a couple of other places in Vancouver but this was definitely our favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Great as We Had Hoped”
Reviews.Author: MaryOConnor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-August (high season) for $209 (Can.) per night, which came to almost $250 (Can.) per night with taxes. We were scheduled to stay for 5 nights, but ended up checking out early. Our first room was on the 2nd floor facing the alley. The room smelled like deodorizer, and I immediately suspected that we were on the smoking floor. The front desk confirmed that the second floor was for smokers, so we asked to move to a non-smoking floor. We were then put in a 1 bedroom on the third floor facing the front of the building. A group of young people (at the oldest in their early 20's) were staying in the room next to ours, and they were in and out of their room, partying and talking in the hall at all hours of the night. We heard three of them take a cab to the airport at 4 am. The next day, I asked at the front desk whether this group had checked out, and the person at the front desk said that they wanted to stay another day, but he was going to tell them they had to leave because they were too much trouble. After that, the floor was mostly occupied by families with young children who allowed them to run and play in the hallway. The apartment itself was comfortable, but on the small side. When the sofa bed was unfolded, it filled the entire living room, and no one could make a cup of coffee in the kitchen without disturbing the people on the sofa bed. Our overall impression was that we overpaid for what we received -- especially since the Hyatt was running a special for $118 (Can) per night during out stay. If you want to give the Sunset Inn a try, definitely make sure that you are on one of the upper floors in the larger, refurbished apartments.

HotelInfo.Name: Sunset Inn and Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 1111 Burnaby Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6E 1P4, Canada
